1.content:
"Give it up John. You're not going to trick them into telling you" a voice said kindly. You turned and smiled at your girlfriend, Megan. You and her had been friends since you were kids, but only started dating for the last couple of months. She was sitting on the couch, looking pleased with herself. You don't blame her; although she, like herself was curious into your family's weird actions over the last couple of years, you could tell she was more pleased about the fact she could finally enjoy herself while see was doing her cheerleading.

"I know you're glad that you're got a much better cheer captain, but that doesn't help me, Megan. Mel got home two weeks ago, and all I got from her when I asked the question, 'So where were you?' was I bet you'd look cute as a girl."

"I think you would" a male voice laughed. You frowned, not happy with Harry's sense of humor.

"Guys. Mel's air-brained comments aren't helping. I need your help" you said.

"I guess they'll tell you when you're ready" Harry said.

"Like when? Don't you want to know? Doesn't it bother you? I know you've still got a thing for my sister" you said.

Harry blushed slightly. "I don't know what you're talking about, bro."

"Sure you don't" you said sarcastically. Slightly thirsty, you decided to get some cola. As you got up, you tripped over something. You saw it was some kind of leather bound book, like something out of the school's library. "Real mature, guys" you said.

"What do you mean, John?" Megan asked.

"This book. How did you get this old fashioned encyclopaedia?" you asked, mainly towards Harry. He had a really strange hobby of collecting antiques and then selling them.

"That isn't mine" Megan said.

"Don't look at me" Harry protested.

"This looks like the sort of junk you collect. The 'magic' book. Original" you muttered.
1.title: The key to the puzzle

choices: Ask mom why she was sad.
11.content:
The instant you picked up the book, you felt a powerful surge, a rush flow through your body. It was not an unpleasant sensation but it definitely felt strange. The feeling passed quickly but it felt you in a strangely placid mood as you opened the cover. "That was odd." Muttering, you said.

"What's odd?" Looking over your shoulder, Megan asked. She looked at the book. "The pages are blank, that is strange."

You rose a single eyebrow. The pages were filled with words but in a language you did not recognize and the pictures seemed strangely out of focus. "Yeah... they're blank." slowly, you agreed. "Maybe its a journal one of my sisters picked up at a curiosity shop."

Just as you closed the cover, you spotted mom walking in. She looked at you and then the book before giving a low sigh. "John, that book belongs to me." Patiently, she said. "Please give it up."

"There's noting on the pages, Ms H." Defending you, Harry said. "No harm, no foul."

"I'm not angry with anyone, Harry." Smiling slightly, mom said. "Relax."

You walked over to mom and took her arm. "Can I have a minute with you, please?" Whispering, you asked. You pulled her out of earshot. "The pages are not blank; what is this?."

"That is a book passed on from mother to daughter." gently, mom replied. "It includes a tradition and a year of training that is a well kept secret among the women of my side of the family."

"Why did you not tell me this before?" handing the book back, you asked.

Mom gave you a sad look. "We knew that you would feel left out, being the only boy in the family." softly, she replied. "We thought it best to simply not talk about it in front of you." she gave you a sad smile. "We will see what happens in a month, okay?"

"In a month?" confused, you asked.

Mom did not answer, she merely sighed and walked away with the book. Worried, you decided to question her more later in private and walked back to your friends.

"Your mom is acting weird, bro." shaking his head, Harry said. "What did she say about the book?"

"It's something passed on from mother to daughter." Honestly, you said. "They didn't speak of it because they thought I'd feel left out."

"So its a girl thing." Smiling, Megan said. "Maybe you don't want to know about it after all."

"Maybe." Wincing, you agreed. You paused then added, "She seemed sad; I wonder why."

You nor your friends noticed that your hair had grown an inch and was a lighter shade of brown.

Later on decide to...
11.title: mom walked in

choices: you look the same age, but you notice your changes
111.content:
...confront mom. You know something was wrong, knew whatever it was was somehow linked to your greatest frustration, and you was determined to find out why. Having made up your mind, you quickly walked to mom's bedroom, where you knew mom had disappeared to.

"Mom. Why are you so sad? You're certainly not yourself" you demanded.

Mom took one glance at you, and froze. While Megan and Harry didn't notice the changes to your body, mom could see what was happening to you. Gulping rapidly, she wondered what would be the best course of action. Finally she gave a sigh and answered.
"John. What would say to me if I told you that I have magic powers?"

"Very funny, mom. I know something is bothering you, but joking isn't the way to approach whatever is troubling you" you said.

"I knew that would be your answer. That is why we kept this from you, that both I and your sisters have magic powers. Plus, I didn't want you to start panicking about something that may or may not have happened. Something that I can know see is unavoidable."

"Mom. I don't know what you're thinking with all this witch crap, but I can tell that something is going to happen to me. What is it?" you demanded.

"Please understand, I had nothing to do with this. I don't know whether is due to a curse or some other spell, or your genetics, and you have to believe me that both Hayley and I have done everything we could, but.... you're turning into a girl."

"Mom!" you growled, tired of this madness.

"I thought about telling you to look at your reflection before telling you. Humor me. Go look at your reflection" mom said.

"Okay, but once I do, I want a real answer" you said. You walked over to the mirror and saw your reflection
111.title: Ask mom why she was sad.

1111.content:
"What?!" you gasped slightly, seeing your reflection. The first thing you saw was your face. For the past few years, every time you've seen your reflection you've seen a figure that appeared older than your real age, which to you was a blessing and curse. Blessing, that you liked being bigger and stronger than your peers; a curse that you could not really act your age. Now, your face looked more like the 14 year old you were. "Mom, you have magic powers? Why are you reducing my age.... MY HAIR!!!" you screamed as your attention turned away from your face to your hair. Your now longer, blonder hair.

"You have to believe that I'm not doing this to you, John. From what I can see, you're not just changing gender, you're also getting younger" mom said, her voice sounding regretful.

"What!? You've got to do something. I can't be a kid again! Is this some sort of curse?" you moaned. Has someone done this to me, thinking its some sort of ironic punishment?

"I don't know. I know you have issues that you feel like you have to act the age you appear, but I have no idea whether its a curse, John. It's possible that its something that would have happened to you, regardless of anything. I just hope you don't get too young. my best guess is at the oldest you'd be is Brooke's age" mom said.

Oh god you despaired, wincing at the idea of turning into an 11 year old. "And worse case?"

Mom winced slightly and said flatly, "Hannah gets a little sister."

"Mom!" you yelled.

"I'm sorry, John, but I don't think you want me sugar coating it" mom said, as she placed her hands behind her back. You stared at her suspiciously.

"What have you got behind your back? Mom... get that away from me. I'm not wearing that! How did you get that thing?" you screamed, as mom brought her hands into view, along with the training bra that she was holding.

"I'm a witch, John" mom said, as the bra flew from her hands, onto your shirt. Instantly, it began to sink through it, onto your chest..."
1111.title: You've smaller and younger looking

choices: Your sisters decide to stop after they've done your nails
11112.content:
"Get it off me" you screamed as the bra finally disappeared, only to have rematerialized around your chest. You had mixed feelings; shame and embarrassment that you was wearing a training bra, fear that someone would discover that awkward fact despite that externally nobody could see, and horror since it really made what mom said sink in. Your feelings of embarrassment won out; without waiting for mom's response, you fled towards your room.

I've got to get this thing off. Thank god that Harry and Megan have left you thought, panicked, as you rushed down the hall and into your room. After quickly locking your door, you turned and groaned. All three sisters were waiting for you on your bed. Instantly, you felt your checks blushing, praying that none of them would notice the slight changes to your body or the extra item of clothing that you wore, even though your hair was nearly entirely blond and a couple of inches past your ears.

"John. Are you okay?" Mel asked, her voice sounding slightly anxious.

"If he was calmer about this, he would say 'what do you think, you stupid airhead'. Of course he isn't okay. We can see that the changes have occurred and from the way he fled into this room, and from the look in his eyes, he knows what is happening to him" Hayley answered for you.

"Hey! Don't you start calling me and airhead!" Mel pouted, causing Hannah to giggle slightly. She knew what you'd call your twin when she's at her ditzier best.

"Girls, just leave me alone. I need to think" you protested.

"What you need is our help" Hannah said, as the older sisters slowly nodded .

"I don't need your help" you protested, before adding. "Unless you can stop this."

"We can't. I can't even slow it down. Take a seat" Hayley said, causing the blood to drain from your face.

"I don't want to see your magic. you'd probably give me a magic makeover" you said. as you raised your hands defensively. Hayley gave a slight smile and to your horror, your nails began to grow out.

"What is happening now?" you moaned at the sight of your now long nails

"That was me, John. Let me show you how shape them, then I'll paint them" Hayley said, apparently taking the lead. Now more angry than fearful, you tried to run, but found you couldn't. All you could do was watch them reshape your nails, then paint them a bright pink
11112.title: Flight for sanctuary... or maybe not

111121.content:
"LET ME GO!" you yelled, furiously as Hannah painted the last of your fingernails. She seemed keen to continue, but both Mel and Hayley were hesitant. Especially Hayley.

"I think we better do what he wants" Hayley said, softly looking at you.

"Why? His hair is in his eyes and needs to be made pretty" Hannah said.

"While I agree that he needs to get his hair tied back, now is really not a good time. See his eyes? He is mad" Mel said.

"Of course I'm mad, you stupid airheaded.... witch!" you growled.

Hayley was more diplomatic. "I wouldn't continue. You should know that unfocused, emotional based magic is dangerous and right now that emotion would be focused on us. I know you Mel; you would be so focused on doing whatever makeover you'd be giving our new sister, you'd miss the signs of her gaining her own powers. She only has to be sufficiently changed to work her own magic."

"Will you stop that! My name is John and I am a boy" you yelled.

"Sorry, but not for too much longer. The only reason why I'm any part of this makeover is that I'm trying to help you adjust. I don't want to torment you or something" Hayley said. It didn't calm you down much.

Mel snorted slightly, as she let you go. "Sell-out" You didn't pay much attention; the only thing you wanted was for all of them to leave, preferably with them leaving with acetone, or something like that. "We better leave her alone" Hayley warned, as she motioned for your other sisters to leave.

A couple of hours later, mom yelled. "John. Dinner."
111121.title: Beware the wrath of John

1111212.content:
No way. I'm not going down there. Not like this... you thought glumly as you stared at your body. Since you kicked your sisters out of your room, you spent your time between desperately checking to see what had changed, and checking the internet for anything that could had been of use. Typically, there was nothing on the net, and as for your body, you didn't need a mirror to tell of some of the changes; your hair was now brushing against your shoulders which was made even more infuriating since the rest of your hair had rapidly vanished into your body. Worse, something was happening to your face, though it could had been swelling because of your prodding. Still, the idea of rising checkbones wasn't as bad as the changes down below. To your horror, your balls had started to retreat about five minutes before mom's call. It make mom's estimate of a week seem like a cruel joke; from what you could see, you'd probably be all girl by breakfast the next morning.

After the forth call, mom got up and knocked on your door. "Forget it mom. I'm not going down" you said in the deepest voice you could manage.

"Hiding up here won't change anything. I know you're hungry, sweetie" mom urged.

"Forget it. And don't treat me like I'm a little girl" you said, your slightly higher pitched voice had an obvious hard edge to it.

"Damn it John! Is it because your sisters used witch make up on you?" mom asked.

"Witch make up?" you gasped, horrified.

"Relax. The only difference it only comes off with magic" mom soothed.

"I just need time alone to deal with this. How would you like the whole 'your family is full of witches. By the way, you're going to turn into a girl and regress to an unknown age'?" you snapped.

"I wouldn't be too happy" mom admitted. She paused and said, "Are you worried about what your sisters would say?"

"No" you snarled, your temper finally snapping. Angrily, you stormed open to your door, flung it open and glared mom down. At that moment you saw that you had lost an inch as well. "Look at me!"

Mom looked troubled. "Okay, John. I'll give you some space."
1111212.title: you look girlier

choices: Hayley tells you that Mel is getting younger as well
11112121.content:
The next morning, you woke up startled hoping your weird 'nightmare' was just that, a nightmare. As you opened your eyes, you saw a shadow by your door; it was Mel, and from the looks of things, she must had seen that you was stirring. "Melanie. What... my voice! I-it wasn't a dream? Why?" you screamed as you heard your much higher voice. Furious you leapt out of bed, and stopped cold. Sometime during the night, someone dressed you in pink pajamas. You suspected Mel.

"Damn it" you said, determined to get out of such a girly and embarrassing outfit, but your blood turned to ice as you saw that under your pajama bottoms, you was wearing panties. That was too much for you to handle. Screaming as you headed for your door, you yelled, "MELANIE. I'LL KILL YOU!" You never made it; the door opened, revealing Hayley. She had a worried look instead of the bemused look that you expected.

"Calm down John" Hayley soothed.

"Calm down? Look what she did to me!"

"We noticed that you had shrunk during the night" Hayley said.

"What?!" you said, noticing that she was right. You had shrunk at least an inch. Maybe two. Hayley sighed, seeing that it replaced your fury with fear.

"I saw Mel sneaking into your room. All this dress up is her way of dealing with all this" Hayley said.

"She has to 'deal' with this? I'm the one that is getting changed" you protested.
11112121.title: the next morning

111121212.content:
"That isn't entirely true" Hayley said hesitantly.

"What do you mean? Its not like she's changing" you angrily said. You was about to fully vent your anger and frustrations, but upon seeing Hayley's increasingly hesitant look, you paused. Some things didn't needed to be said aloud, and this was one of them. You gasped slightly and said, "You're telling me that Mel is changing as well?"

"I am. However compared to you, her transformation is delayed" Hayley said as she bit her lip.

"My god. Does she know? What is going to happen to her?"

"Yes, she knows, John" Hayley said.

"And what is going to happen to her?" you pressed.

"Mel is your twin sister.....and will remain your twin sister" Hayley said.

"Do this have anything to do with me transforming?" you demanded.

"Possible, but we don't really know. It could be over a dozen different reasons for your transformation. But you don't need to worry about that, little sis. I'll help you get dressed" Hayley said, as she rubbed your hair to your extreme annoyance.

"Hayley! I'm a boy" you hissed angrily as Hayley walked out of your room. It wasn't too surprising to see her return a minute later holding a bunch of girls' clothes, and underwaer. While the overalls and pink top was much more tomboyish than what was the norm for your family, it was still unacceptable in your mind.
"Out" you hissed.

"I thought you would prefer this to what Hannah wanted me to get for you" Hayley said. She paused and waved her hand. To your shock, the clothes she was holding vanished, replaced by pink pajamas. Gulping, you looked down and saw that you was dressed in a pink top and overalls.

"What did you do?"

"I used my magic to dress you, sis" Hayley said giggling. "I even did your hair for you since I know it'll just get in your face." Furiously, you reached up and felt your pigtailed hair.

"Mom!" you screamed in frustration.
111121212.title: Linked fates

choices: but Harry did cross paths with a more powerful witch.....
1111212122.content:
"What is going on?" a voice yelled from downstairs. Both you and Hayley froze since it was Harry. Half the time he just waited for you at the bus stop. but he had been increasingly waiting for you downstairs, though you suspected it was really Mel he was waiting for. While you was furious at Hayley for what she had done to you, you gave her a pleading look; no way you wanted Harry to see you like this.

"Don't come up, Harry. John isn't feeling well" Hayley said. After a few seconds, you heard his footsteps coming up the stairs. Panicked, you said, "Do something."

"Like what?" Hayley said as Harry opened the door. He saw you almost immediately, causing you to wince slightly.

"Where's John, Hayley? And who's that?" Harry said, confused by the sight of you. You was stunned that he didn't recognize you, until you realized that you was thinner, way shorter, had longer hair done in a girlish hairstyle, and was in girls' clothes. Plus the other thing was that it was obvious that you was a Harrison, yet your clothes was far more tomboyish than anything the members of your family wore. There was no reason for him to suspect you was anything other than a 11 year old tomboy.

"John is at the doctors. I'm...." you said in the highest pitch voice you could, but Hayley cut you off.

"That isn't going to work, sis" Hayley said as she shook her head. "John is under the effects of some sort of magic, Harry"

'What are you doing?" you screamed at Hayley, ignoring a disbelieving Harry.

"He would figure things out soon" Hayley said.

"Um, what is going on?" Harry said in an annoyed voice.

"I know you don't believe me. All I'll say is that I never knew you wore that. Don't worry, only us will notice" Hayley snickered as she discretely cast a spell. Harry, annoyed had enough. He stormed out. Once you was alone, you turned to your sister, and asked in a worried voice, "What did you do?"

"Turned his boxers into plain white panties. Don't worry. Unless he comes across another witch with powers greater than mine, only he, you and me would be able to perceive it. Not even Mel you be able to see" Hayley said, giggling.
1111212122.title: Your cries attract Harry

11112121221.content:
To Hayley's surprise, you giggled slightly. "He's not going to be very happy with you when he finds out what you did." Smiling, you stated. "It's a nice prank, though." You sighed. "Sis, what is going to happen to me; will I ever be a boy again?"

Hayley gave you a sympathetic smile before sitting down next to you on the bed. "All boys in witch families have magic in them, sis." Soothingly, she explained. "Normally, when a witch boy finds a magic book, he does not change at all."

"Does being Mel's twin have anything to do with what's happening to me?" Gulping, you asked.

"You have good instincts, John." Using your real name, Hayley said. "Yes, as a twin to a witch, your magic is closer to the surface so when you opened the magic book..."

"I 'turned on' my own magic powers?" Wincing, you asked.

Hayley nodded. "None of us had anything to do with this, John. Your own magic is causing this change and there are two other factors involved."

"What are those?"

"Your curiosity and concern."

You rose an eye brow. "What do they have to do with magic?"

"You were curious about the book as you could read but not understand it." Smiling, Hayley said. "Your own magic provided the means to read the book. You were concerned for mom as she seemed sad when you started to change." She paused, pulling you into a one armed hug. "You have always been protective of us and your own magic accelerated the changes when you became concerned for mom's well being."

"I'm afraid not." Wincing, Hayley replied. "I'll have my hands full dealing with a younger Mel before too long so I really need you to... um... 'man up' and deal with this." she giggled at the end.

"Bad pun, sis." Sourly, you said.

"It's going to be a difficult transition for everyone." Turning serious, Hayley said. "There will be a lot of things you will not like doing at first." She looked at you for a moment then added, "I'll offer you a compromise, something that might make things easier for everyone."

"I'm listening." Curious, you said.

Hayley smiled. "Nothing can change the fact you are going to be just as much of a girl as the rest of us but I'm willing to let you pick what parts of girlhood you want to learn first in exchange for your cooperation and not fighting us when we teach you. What do you say?"
11112121221.title: Hayley offers a compromise.

choices: mom wants to talk about Harry
111121212212.content:
"I'm not sure" you said hesitantly.

"Why?" Hayley said.

"Its too much of a blank cheque. Plus its only for you. Mom would have me in pink dresses, especially if I get too much younger" you said sourly.

"John, I've got you in overalls. They could had been pink, or I could had gone straight for a dress" Hayley argued.

"True" you admitted, before you asked in a slightly cold voice. 'Why did you initially said that the cause of this is unknown?"

"Because I didn't want you to start blaming us, or worse, yourself. Plus there is still a chance it could had been a curse, sis. in either case it would likely be totally irreversible" Hayley said.

A part of you felt like crying but another saw the black humor. "Totally irreversible? You sound like Mel."

"Very funny" Hayley said, sitting down, though she remained silent for a couple of minutes. "Sorry, sis, but I've got to go to school. Try to have fun today."

You snorted in answer, preferring to stay in your room while the others left for school. From the sound of it, Harry was still clueless. After twenty minutes, you decided to confront mom, wanting to make sure things were on your terms. As you appeared she took one look at you and surprisingly, had a bemused smile.

"Morning John. I believe your sister made an offer" mom grinned.

"Yes, but uncompromising acceptance? Forget that!" you said.

Mom nodded. "There would be things that I do need complete cooperation on, while others I would allow."

"How young will I get?"

"I don't know" mom said.

"Really?" you asked as you raised an eyebrow.

"Really" mom said flatly.

"So I guess that means no mall trip or room redecoration" you said softly to yourself.
111121212212.title: You are not sure.

1111212122122.content:
"I need to talk to you about your friends, especially Harry" mom said, causing you to get a sinking feeling in your gut. Already you was unrecognizable to him, you with the right clothes and a haircut, he would figure out the truth. Plus he would certainly notice your continued presence, or that of his changing girlfriend. Then there was that stunt that Hayley did....

"What about him? Why him in particular?" you asked slightly fearfully.

"Harry unwittingly has been exposed to magic much more than any of your friends, and with his temperament, he might be willing to do something foolish once he discovers the truth" mom said.

"Are you going to.. do something to him?" you gasped.

Mom laughed slightly. "What do you mean? Turn him into a form, allowing him to be your new bff? Sweetie, I admire your concern for your your friend, so I want you do have this." to your surprise, mom flicked her wrist and a box flew into your hands. "Open it" mom urged.

You hesitated for a few seconds, but you opened the box. It was a silver heart shaped locket, and obviously something mom had kept for a long time. It would be something that your sisters, especially Hannah would love. "Jewellery?" you inquired.

"I kept it for thirty years, the first thing I got after I discovered that I was a witch. Out of you girls, I want you to have it" mom said.

"Mom..." you said, but mom gave you a weak grin. Though you felt liking sighing, you remained silent and slipped the locket into one of your pockets.
1111212122122.title: Mom's gift

11112121221221.content:
You was playing video games trying to forget what was happening to you when the noise of the front door opening caused you to jump. It was Hayley and she had a slight disappointed look on her face.

"Why are you looking so sour? You're not the one that is changing" you said, irritably looking at your sister. You knew now there was no way you could pass off as a boy; your face alone is that of a very cute girl.

"Have you finished changing?" Hayley asked.

"No" you said sulkily

"Oh.,,,, That prank on Harry didn't work, sis" Hayley said, She shook her head and said, "I raced ahead. Do you want to be here when they arrive?"

"No" you said, as you dropped your controller and raced for the stairs. You was able to reach the top before the door opened a second time, revealing a slightly worried looking Mel and an annoyed looking Harry. You knew he couldn't had found about his secret; he was too calm for that. It could only be Hayley's prodding.

"You're sure there isn't anything unusual about your clothes, Harry?' Hayley giggled.

"I've told you. Why are you being like this? Between saying that my clothes are different and about 'magic', you're driving me insane. Mel, do you know anything about why your sister is..... weird?"

"You hadn't cast any spells on him?" Mel said grumpily.

"Just a subtle one that only he, me and John would notice" Hayley said sweetly.

"Have you lost your mind?" Mel demanded, which caused Harry's frustrated face to twist into a smirk.

"He is obviously being magically affected for him not to notice that he is wearing panties, Mel" Hayley said.

"That's it. Sorry Mel, but I need answers right now" Harry yelled.

From your position, you winced at the developing fight. Harry's patience was at breaking point, and you had began to realize that neither he, or you had sport that day. As for Hayley, she was preparing to cast a spell, something you wanted to prevent. "Hayley. Stop" you shouted, as you got up from the top of the stairs. All three stopped what they were doing and stared at the pigtailed tomboy at the top of the the stairs.

"Who are you?" Harry asked as he blinked slightly, repeating the question from the morning. You knew that you had changed throughout the day, becoming more girlish looking and that Harry might had noticed subtle changes.
11112121221221.title: later, that afternoon

111121212212211.content:
"I want to talk to Harry. Alone" you said.Both your sisters stared at each other and harry was hesitant to obey you, but eventually he figured that you was willing to talk and followed you to your room.

"Why did you take me to John's room. Who are you?" Harry demanded.

'Shut up and listen. Its me. John" you said, wincing slightly. You noticed at Hayley must had been able to fire off a spell at Harry, either as he was leaving with you, or during the argument.

"Don't waste my time" Harry growled.

"I'm not. I'm sure you don't wear your jeans above your waist" you said, eying Harry's changing clothes.

"Alright. I'm play your game... Arrrrrrghhhhh!" harry screamed as he saw his jeans were resting at his upper chest. he was still screaming as two denim straps formed, completing his overalls.

"Calm down. You're only wearing girls' overalls. you're still.... you" you pleaded.

'I-if.. but. that means... oh my God" Harry stammered as he realized the girl in front of him was you.

"They didn't do this to me, bro" you said, trying to reassure your frightened friend.

"Who did? J-John. y-you're a girl!" Harry stammered.

"Almost" you said sadly. "Seems they don't know what caused it, though Hayley thinks its because of my family... you know, witches. they had magic and a girl me would have it to. All that sort of thing."

"W-witches?" Harry stammered.

"You think clothes morphing, or me changing is natural? You're been dating a witch for the last four months, bro" you said.

"What?" Harry said, regaining some of his composure. While he was shaken, he wasn't stammering like an idiot.

"Put it this way. If Mel wanted to do anything to you, she could and would had done so months ago. She hasn't done anything to you, or to me. It was Hayley that decided to meddle and change your clothes" you said.

"Am I.. going to change?" Harry asked, wincing,

"No, unless you do something stupid. Promise me that you won't do anything stupid" you urged.

Harry ignored you. Growling, he said, "I think I need to talk to your sister"

"Which one?" you asked, fearing he was going to be stupid.

"Both" Harry said, storming out. You cautiously followed..
111121212212211.title: A talk with Harry

choices: you overhear mom talking about girl's names with your other sisters
you overheard mom planning a mall trip
1111212122122112.content:
The next morning you yawned, flung the covers off of you and looked at you body. It wasn't long before your face formed a sour expression. While it was welcome that you was the only one in your room, you was once again in pink pajamas and panties. Quickly, you slip your hand down and confirmed what you feared; you was now completely a girl.

"Damn it" you hissed as you stood up, realizing that wasn't the only change. The room seemed bigger somehow, and that hit you harder than your loss of gender. "I-I'm ten?" you moaned as you saw as much of your body as you could. Despairingly, you picked up your discarded top and overalls from the previous day and tried to put them on, only to find that they were too big. Stunned, you sank back onto your bed, wondering what to do.

Christine; Grace wants to know if she can come over and play with Hannah for a while.” After a pause, she said, “Okay great; I’ll send her over.”

Feeling excited that she might actually find out what happened to her, Harry said, “Thank you mommy.”

With her mom watching, Harry ran across the street to the Harrison’s house. Knocking on the door, Harry waited. It didn’t take long for the door to opened to reveal Melanie. Looking down at Harry, she said “___________________."
11531121.title: Visit the Harrisons (Locked for Hawkeye)

choices: Leave the book in your closet
Try to read this book again
12.content:
You decide to stuff the book in your backpack that is lying at your feet. You turn to Megan and Harry and say,"I'll ask Mel when I see her, it looks like something she might compulsively buy."
"I'd ask you guys to stay longer, but I have two tests and an essay due tomorrow and need to study," you say as they walk towards the front door. As they close the door, Hayley pokes her head through the living room door frame and asks,"Hey John, have you seen an old looking book siting around here lately?"
Not wanting to expose yourself, you answer, "No, but if I see ann old book around, I'll let you know," as an afterthought, you said "You might want to check Hannah's room, she does randomly grab things that are lying around."
"Dang, where could that book be! I'll be in sooo much trouble if Mom finds out," she mutters to herself as she walks out of the room.
You head upstairs to your room to decide what to do with the "magic" book, wondering the whole time why Hayley would have that book, and why Mom would get mad at her for losing it.
12.title: Hayley walked in

124.content:
As soon as you close your door, you project the thought "Einstein's Merlin" towards your closet. After a few seconds your closet changes from a disorganized teenage boy's closet into a small elevator. As soon as you step in, the elevator drops, and your closet is reformed around it. You quickly arrive at your destination, your main lab. You set down your book-bag, take out the magic book, and place it in a scanner that detects the elements the book, and its writing are made from. As this takes a while to complete, you think back a year.

1 Year Ago
You are in your basement on your birthday doing laundry. As you wait for the laundry to finish, the drier started to shoot electricity. Quickly, you pull out the plug and start coughing from the smoke. Looking behind the drier, you notice that there is a small disk covered in dirt. Entranced by this technologic marvel, you take it to your room and start to tinker with it. In no time, you swipe your hand across the top, and a holographic image of your Uncle Jack appears! You watch as your uncle begins to speak,"John, if you are watching this, listen carefully. What I am about to tell you will change your life forever." "If you want to step into your family heritage, go down to the basement and say 'Einstein's Merlin'."
As true to your curious self, you walk down into the basement and reply,"Einstein's Merlin!" As you say this, a empty wall in the basement splits down the middle, revealing a laboratory, and a robot version of Jack walks up to you and says,"Prepare to be shown a new, exciting, and sometimes dangerous world." You follow him into the lab, where for the next year you learn about the fringe sciences, including genetic manipulation, telekinesis, energy manipulation, and many others. All of that has led to you having the math, language, and science skill of a rocket scientist, a theoretic mathematician, and a congressman combined. Your body is now 10 times as productive as a normal human in every way.(strength, reflexes, mental, senses, flexibility, etc)

Present Day
After snapping out of your reminiscing, you end up floating some bread over a floating green fire and then smearing peanut butter and jelly on it, all while siting at the work table writing your essay that is due tomorrow. After you finish eating, you start to feel a little drowsy again as you thought,"Maybe I shouldn't have pulled 5 all nighters just to learn about and make that elevator. You then collapse in exhaustion.
124.title: John the Chaotic Scientist

choices: Mel said she was getting acting lessons
Mel looks apologetic at your friends, but says its for your ears only
Mel tells you she has magic powers
Mel casts a spell on you
13.content:
As you held the book up, you heard a door open. It was Mel and she looked slightly pale for some reason. She was wearing a pink spaghetti strapped top, shorts, and sandals. Combined with the fact she was blond, and busty for her age meant that she attracted a lot of attention. Her presence had an effect on your friends too; Megan greeted her best friend warmly, but Harry started to become nervous, which caused you to grin wickedly.

He's deluding himself when he says he doesn't want to date her. Look at him. he's turned into a bumbling idiot. Melanie is still the same girl she was last year you mused, as you looked at your twin. Mel had barely changed over her year's absence; she still general appearance, and same slightly ditzy demeanor she always had. The only difference was that she seemed to be a bit smarter, less impulsive.

"I like what you said to John last week. Happy Birthday. I think you'd make a cute girl" Megan giggled. You frowned since you didn't share her sentiments. Still, you had to admit you thought it was a bemusing way for her to deflect your questions.

"Mel, you may as well tell me. I'm sure whatever it is is far better than whatever I can think of" you said.

"Like what?" Mel said, though you could see that her attention wasn't really on you. Instead she was focused on the book in your hands.

Frowning, you said, "You know. Forget it." Annoyed that you're being left out, you was about to walk off with the book, but Mel had other ideas. She looked at you crossly and said, "You really want to know why? Fine"
13.title: Mel walked in

131.content:
"I was sent to a school that specializes in performance arts. Happy now, John?" Mel snapped. She obviously had enough and headed for the door.

Yeah right you thought. While you knew Mel was very photogenic and did have an interest in acting when she was younger, you doubted that that was the real reason. Especially since Hayley also had her own mystery trip the previous year. "Do you really expect me to believe that?" you demanded.

Mel stopped in the doorway and said in a irritated voice. "Don't come crying to me if you find your information white whale, Ahab Harrison"

You stared at her annoyed, fully understanding her analogy. "I'm not obsessed with this, Melanie!" you shouted at her receding figure. Once alone, you turned to Megan and Harry. "I'm not obsessed. Am I?"

Megan bit her lip. "You are in a way, John."

"I just need to know why. Don't either of you think its strange that two of my sisters go away for a whole year, and don't even mention what they did?" you said.

"I never said it isn't strange. Maybe its something that Mrs H is doing. Like Mel said, she is older than you. Maybe its your turn this year" Megan said, unaware that mom had arrived and had overheard your complaints. Later she called you to her study and almost immediately got straight to the point.

"I know you're feeling frustrated John, but there is a good reason why both Mel and Hayley have kept their secrets" mom said.

"Of course I'm frustrated" you said.

"I realize that. I overheard your conversation with Megan and I've come to the conclusion that maybe I should send you away" mom answered.

"You was listening in?" you grumbled.

"Its not exactly hard, John. Where is the magic book by the way?" mom asked.

"What does that old book have to do with it?" you demanded.

"I can't have it lying around while you're away. Its valuable and I do not want your cousins getting their hands on it" mom said.
131.title: Mel the 'actress'

choices: You suddenly felt like you're smaller
Rikki takes you to your dorm
1311.content:
"Its in my bedroom. What is this about this school? I know its got nothing to do with acting" you said.

"You'll find out soon enough young man. You're leaving right now" mom said.

"What?" you said surprised as mom grabbed your hand and dragged you to the car. Slightly stunned, you got in and asked why mom was acting so fast.

"Its a long journey, John" mom said curtly.

"You know what I meant, mom. I never even got to say that I was going to anyone" you complained.

"You'll be fine" mom said. Several hours later, she drove through some gates that obviously belonged to some sort of private academy. You got out and saw that you weren't alone; A woman in her forties was standing near a couple of bewildered looking teenage boys around your age. One was fairly tall, athletic and had brown hair. The other was slightly plump and pale looking. He too had brownish colored hair. Mom smiled and greeted the woman. She smiled at mom and said, "Nice to see you again, Natalie. I see you've brought your son this time."

"Yes, Rikki. I see he won't be alone" mom said.

"No. James and Sam arrived a few hours ago" Rikki said. You stared at her, guessing that she must be someone at the school rather than a parent of the boys. "I'll take things from here."

You looked around since you started to get an uncomfortable feeling. "Mom, what does this place teach? I know its not acting' you said, wondering why you felt uncomfortable.

Mom smiled. "You'll find out. I'll see you in a year. Got to go..."

"Wait!" you yelled, but mom was already reversing to leave. Seeing that you wasn't going to get any answers from her, you turned to James, Sam and Rikki. "Do you guys know what is going on?" you asked the boys.

"No" the plump boy said. "I'm Sam."

The other boy nodded. "James" he said.

"John" you said, introducing yourself. You turned and said to Rikki, "What is this school?"

"Witchbloom. I've got to get you three ready" Rikki said
1311.title: A new school

choices: Rikki ignores you and leads you to your dorm
13111.content:
"Ready for what?' you asked, half growling since you're tired and annoyed by the events of the past couple of hours. Plus you're becoming suspicious of both this Witchbloom school and Rikki.

"I've heard about your temper. You've got to watch it, miss" Rikki said.

You stopped walking at that comment, "What did you just call me?" you growled.

"What I see is a slightly tired, bratty little girl" Rikki said.

"That does it" you growled. Both Sam and James also were becoming annoyed since to them, Rikki had gone crazy and was unfairly targeting you. As you was preparing to run for the gates, you felt a slight pain in your shoulders. Wincing, you tried to ignore it, but the pain seemed to be spreading to the rest of your body.

"What is happening to me? Help me. Get a doctor" you moaned, the pain clear in your voice.

"Don't just stand there" Sam scolded Rikki. "Help him... arrgghhh" he moaned as both he and James started to get pains. You looked over at them and screamed. "You're shrinking!" you screamed in a increasingly squeaky and higher pitched voice. Upon hearing that, you looked down and saw that you was shrinking too. Looking closer, you saw that your muscles were receeding. It could only be one thing; you're getting younger, though oddly your clothes seemed to be resizing with your shrinking frame.

"What did you do to us?" you yelled.

"Can't you tell yet?" Rikki asked as your vision was obscured by brown hair. As you reached to touch it, it changed color to a honey gold, just like the hair found on mom and your sisters. Similar things were happening to the boys, though both Sam and James looked more like girls.

"You! Change us- arrrgh" you moaned as you felt strange as your internal organs changed and external ones inverted, changing you into a little girl. "What have you done to us?" you said horrified in your new six year old girl voice.

"This is Witchbloom, the leading school for young witches. Didn't you know? Ah crap" Rikki said.

"I don't want to be a widdle girl in a witch school" James said awkwardly.

"Yeah. Change us back" Sam added.
13111.title: You suddenly felt like you're smaller

choices: A familiar feminine voice yells, "What are you doing, miss Turner?"
131112.content:
"I can't. There is no such thing as a male witch" Rikki said.

"Then kick us outh. Wook at me! I canth me a widdle girl" James lisped. Her emotions were unsurprisingly, in a mess, hence she didn't care all that much that she was lisping.

"I can't" Rikki said.

"Can't!?! Why did you turn us into little girls?" you demanded, empathising the word little.

"I don't have to explain myself to you, missy. You've getting a Witchbloom education, and it starts from tomorrow when you're introduced to the rest of your first grade class" Rikki snapped. She was obviously in a bad mood, and you wondered what caused it.

"You're putting me in first grade!?" Sam screamed.

"You three know nothing about magic or girls" Rikki snapped. She quickly muttered some words, and to your surprise, Sam's, James's and your own hair started to float up into the air.
"What are you doing?" you demanded.

"Giving you three a new hairstyle. Like I said, the three of you know nothing, and I won't have you looking like a mess" Rikki said. Within seconds your hair was divided into two pigtails, held by a small bow. Sam and James were marginally better; James hair was braided into pigtails, which in your opinion made her look more mature. Sam was the luckiest; her's was secured by a green bow. Rikki nodded, pleased with herself. "Better, but you girls still need more work. Take those shoes. They're a disgrace."

"What's wrong with my shoes?" Sam asked. The three of you looked down and saw that the shoelaces were wiggling out from the shoes. "This better not be what I think it is" you growled. it was; and moments later, your shoes hardened, became rounded and was secured to your feet by its strap. James looked at her new mary janes horrified. "Isn't it enoghff you turned us into widdle girls?" James wailed.

It could be worse you thought disgusted. James and Sam's shoes were black. Yours were pink, making you look my far the girliest out of any of them. You looked sharply at Rikki, who seemed to be enjoying herself. trying to deepen your girlish voice, you said, "Funtime is over, witch."

"Its just beginning, miss Harrison. You see, Witchbloom has a dress code" Rikki said to your horrified expression
131112.title: your clothes start changing

1311122.content:
As Rikki giggled meanly at you, you glanced down and saw that your shirt was beginning to change as well. You had no doubt what it would end up as, but you was determined not to go down without a fight. "If you like all this pink so much, why don't you wear it?" you said.

"Don't be so silly, little girl" Rikki snickered. Her laughter died in her throat as a powerful voice said sternly, "Miss Turner. What do you think you're doing?" You turned, and was stunned into silence. It was your grandmother, Elvira.

"Madam Head Witch" Rikki said uneasily. You looked at them bewildered. Head Witch!!?!

"Your behavior is totally unacceptable. I've told you that greeting new students in this manner is not the way I want them to be introduced to magic" Elvira said coldly.

"But...." Rikki said. Elvira didn't allow her to get another word in. Elvira continued her rant. "I think you've been especially hard since this group contains my granddaughter." At this point, Sam and James turned their attention to you, their faces showing their surprise. Your own face showed you was just as surprised. Elvira was oblivious; she continued to scold Rikki. "Give me a good reason why I shouldn't give my granddaughter a new witch doll."

"Don't do anything to me" Rikki pleaded.

"You've been warned. Now get out of here. I'll take of this myself" Elvira thundered. As soon as Rikki scurried away, you turned to Elvira. By that time, your shirt had completely sealed itself at the front, split down the back and had buttoned itself up and its sleeves had began to puff up. Basically it was the top part of a little girl's dress. Color-wise it had also started to fade to a light pink. Both Sam and James also were experiencing similar changes, though they were 'lucky' to get pale blue and cream.

"You're the head witch?" you asked.

"Yes I am. I am truly sorry you had to discover this in this manner" Elvira said warmly.

"Can't you do anything about this?" you asked as you felt an unfamiliar feeling as your jeans split, and refused into a long dress.

Elvira ignored that question, instead answering the real one. "I bet you want to know why you're all kids. In all your files, it said to regress. Rikki took it too far."

"What? Mom wanted this?" you asked.

"You're a twin, John. If you was changed first, it was areal possibility that you would remain like this permanently" Elvira said.

"What about them?" you asked, pointing to the two girls, who were now wearing their dresses.

"I'll tell Bella and Olivia privately" Elvira said.

"You're renaming us?! What's wrong with Sam?" Sam demanded.

"There are some names that are off-limits for witches. Samantha is one of them, Olivia" Elvira said.

"Why?"

"There is a witch of that name that has caused us endless trouble. I had to personally prevent on more than a dozen occasions her exposing magic to Lucy" Elvira said, pointing at you. She smiled, and said, "I'll let the three of you talk and find your way around the grounds. Good luck, girls."
1311122.title: Enter the head witch

13111221.content:
"Wait!" you pleaded, but Elvira was gone. Seeing that you was alone, you quickly looked back towards Sam and James. "I haven't anything to do with this. I didn't know about magic or anything" you pleaded, annoyed that you sounded like a whiny kid.

"I believe you. I hope my lith.... damn it" James said.

"Do you think your grandmother will get us out of here?" Sam asked. She seemed to coping a bit better than James.

"Honestly, I don't know. She was quick to call you guys 'Olivia' and "Bella'" you said, grimacing.

"What do we do?" you asked. "I do not want to be called 'Lucy' for the rest of this year, or (wince) the rest of my life.

"I guess we should check out the dorm we've been assigned, pray that there are no other girls around" Sam said. you and James agreed, and you quickly found your dorm. To your dismay, there was enough room for five, and that two spots appeared to be occupied by someone. Someone girlish, but the looks of things. The only thing going for you was that whoever it was seemed to be away.

"What do we do?" you asked.

"What's your story?" James asked.

"Maybe we should get used to those girl names, 'Bella'" Sam said distastefully.

You winced slightly. "Like grandma said, I've got a twin sister. She disappeared for a year and had only recently come back" you said slightly bitterly. A part of you wondered if she knew what would happen to you, and whether she tried to warn you in her own, annoying way.

"My girlfriend disappeared too. But she can't be a witch! She is too religious for that!" 'Olivia' said. She was looking through her drawers distastefully, since they were filled with girls clothes.

"I haven'th had anyone acting weird around me, though my mom has been thaying I've got some big changes coming. I thinkth she knew and wanted me to be wike thith" 'Bella' said bitterly.
13111221.title: continue

131112211.content:
Upon reaching what would be your new dorm room for the year, you found a teenage girl waiting for you, Olivia and Bella. "Welcome to Witchbloom, girls." Politely, she said. "I am Tia Hawk, your dorm mate and upperclassman guide."

"Can you tell us why we were sent here and changed into little girls?" Anger in your voice, you asked.

Tia nodded before summoning a flame to her hand, causing you, Olivia, and Bella to jump. "I am a witch." Patiently, she said. "Your mothers are witches, as are your sisters. It was magic that changed you all into little girls."

"Okay..." Shaken, you said. "It still does not answer why all this was done to us."

"It's really quite simple, Lucy." Smiling, Tia replied. "By understanding magic, you will know how to protect yourself from magical mischief and end magical fun if you do not wish to play along."

"Wha about my lithp." Pouting, Olivia asked.

"You had a lisp as a child, Olivia." Simply, Tia replied. "It's only natural that you would get it back if regressed into that age." Seeing your face harden, she added, "You had been reduced to this age for different reasons, depending upon your case."

"Grandma told me that I was a twin to Mel." Wincing, you said.

Tia nodded. "As a twin to a witch, your transformation into a teenage girl would have been permanent." Firmly but kindly, she said. "However, as a little girl, you can be changed back to your teenage boy self without any risks."

"What about them?" Worried, you asked.

"Each case is different." Serious, Tia replied. "Olivia and Bella both showed a powerful magical potential. If their mother had waited much longer, their own bodies would have transformed to give that magic an outlet, making them witches for life." she smiled. "All three of you have a chance to remain male by simply enduring a year of grade school as little girls; learning magic."

"What happens to us after this?" Wincing, you asked.

"You return home as teenage boys and continue on with your lives." Smiling again, Tia said. She gently touched your shoulder. "This is a new beginning not an ending. Let us show you how magic can influence your lives for the better."

Albeit reluctantly, you, Olivia, and Bella nodded. "Where do we begin?" Curious, you asked.

Tia smiled and replied, "We begin with regular first grade classes with real girls your age."

"Witch girls?" Worried, you asked.

"As girls, you are witches too." Serious, Tia said. "This is to get you used to being girls so learning magic will be easier. Also, the real girls here have no knowledge who is a real girl and who is a transformed boy here." She grinned. "So, unless you want to be teased..."

"We have to try to blend in." Gulping, Bella said.

Tia nodded. "Right now, I suggest you three...."
131112211.title: A new beginning not an ending.

131112212.content:
You didn't know what to say to Bella's story. It seemed cruel. You remained silent until you heard the clicking of mary janes outside the dorm. With a slightly frightened squeak, you turned and saw two six year old girls walk in. One looked almost as girly as you, but the other had a more mature air about her, and a really sour face. Neither girl noticed you or your new friends at first.

"Don't worry Tia. Being six is much better than being seventeen" the girly girl said.

"That's easy for you to say, Amanda. Its like what It would be for you if you was suddenly turned into a four month old" Tia said. She gave a small gasp as she finally noticed you. "I-I can explain. I got cursed and got turned into this" Tia stammered.

"Ith anyone actuallwy a widdle girl here?" Bella lisped. She grimaced and added, "Stupith lith."

"She is. I take it you're like me" Tia said.

"Maybe. We were fourteen" you said cautiously. Too cautiously. Amanda screwed up her face as she said, "Ewww! You were icky boys?"

Seeing that you wouldn't be able to deny it, you nodded. Amanda smiled and said, "Well you're pretty girls now, and its much better to be a girl anyway. Wanna be my friend?"

"Definitely a real six year old" Olivia muttered under her breath. "What's her story?"

"Amanda has a couple of older sisters, some naturally she wanted to learn magic. Amanda, why don't you go a play?" Tia said.

"Okay" Amanda said cheerfully. Once she was out of the way, you continued your conversation.

"What about you?' you asked Tia.

"My name is Tia Hawk. I was a rouge hunter, least one in training. As you can imagine, not all witches are nice. I got into combat with one, and while I defeated her, she reduced me to this, and took away all my practical skill. i'll regain it, but its going to be a tough road for me. Bella, don't worry. That lisp of yours is natural for a girl your age. You'll grow out of it."

"We were talking amongst ourselves. I think Olivia's girlfriend was a witch and was the one that sent her here" you said.

"Interesting" Tia said.

"Mom did thith to me. I fink she wanted a widdle girl instead oth me" Bella moaned.

Seeing that Tia was just as uncomfortable as you was, you said, "I've got a twin sister."

"That explains it" Tia said.

"What?" you demanded.

"If you were a teenaged girl, you'd be one for life. What is your full name?"

"Ummm Lucy. Lucy Harrison" you said uncomfortably.

"Granddaughter to the head witch?" Tia asked, surprised.

"Apparently. Is anyone else in our first grade class" you said dryly.

"Yes. Mostly girls like Amanda, though there are a few transformed boys. I'll try my best to help you fit in" Tia promised
131112212.title: meeting your other roommates

1311122122.content:
The next morning, you opened your eyes, hoping everything was a really weird dream, but the sight of the pink walls dashed your hopes. Damn it. Witches are real, and they're going to make me into one of their numbers as a six year old girl you thought sourly. The others were up and getting dressed, and you could see the only one truly happy with her situation was Amanda. "Why does this place have to be an oversized version of a kids bedroom?" you muttered as you threw on your clothes, which unfortunately was the same dress from yesterday.

"Not all those that find themselves here are like yourself, Lu. A lot would be normal kids and they would be frightened to be away from home. That said, are you girl enough, or are you afraid of a little pink?" Tia said as she walked over to you.

"No" you grumbled as you put on your shoes. Seeing that the others are ready, you thought of the right reply. Turning to Tia, you said, "Majority of this dorm is former teens, including you. What if we redecorate?"

"As mucth as I hath it, Amanda thoves it, so leavth it. Can't you magicathly fixth this?"Bella said, wincing every time she mispronounced a word.

"You'll grow out of it" Olivia said. She opened the door and cautiously looked out. "Guess its class time. What is the first thing you want to learn?"

You heard a few chuckles. Quickly you walked through the maze that was Witchbloom's corridors and found yourself in a room, where there were six more girls waiting. Ignoring them, you looked at the teacher, standing in the middle of the room. Relieved it wasn't Rikki or your grandmother, you took a seat.

"Okay class" the woman said without even giving you an introduction. "Could you open the books in front of you?" You opened your book, and found....
1311122122.title: first lessons

choices: you find the problems are becoming increasingly difficult
13111221221.content:
.....a ordinary looking textbook containing math problems. Worse, they're all at the first grade level. Your initial reaction of the ease of such schoolwork quickly gave in to panic; you remembered that you in a magic school, and it wouldn't be too hard to take away your knowledge, leaving you as a real first-grader. You looked around and saw that the rest of the class was just as hesitant as you. Olivia was the first to complain; she stuck her hand up and spoke before being addressed.

"I thought we were here to learn magic, not all this math" she complained.

"You will, but you're not witches all the time. Witchbloom is here to give you an education, but not just in magic. Reckless and single minded pursuit of magic will end in disaster. One more thing, you should wait for me to call you before asking a question, young lady" the teacher said, her voice stern.

"But..." Olivia protested.

"Magic is a powerful thing, but you cannot use it all the time. Math is something you do need constantly. Please do not interrupt me like this again young lady. Could you all open to page 3" the teacher said.

You felt like screaming as you opened to the assigned page, not sure who would be laughing more at your fate; Harry, Mel or that witch, Rikki
13111221221.title: Its first grade math

131112212211.content:
Slightly fearful, you turned your attention to the set of problems you learnt years earlier. You didn't bother to read the instructions; instead you just started on the math problems. The first six were easy and were done almost as soon as you saw them, but as soon as you started the seventh, you took a few seconds. The eight problem was worse, and by the time you reached the tenth math problem you was staring at it blankly

Why can't I do this? your mind screamed. You knew that Hannah, and Mel when she was your sister's age was terrible at math, and if you couldn't do it...

What is happening to me!?! Did that.... witch put a spell on me. Does she know the problems my sisters have?" you thought as you eyed the still 'nameless' witch in front of you. As your eyes lowered, you caught at the sight of your pink dress and had an even worse thought. 'Or am I still changing? That my mind is changing to suit this body."

Panicked, you leapt out of your seat and rushed for the door. ignoring the teacher's demand for you to stop, you rushed into the hallway only to bump into Rikki. She grinned meanly at you.

"What's wrong, Princess?" she mocked, in a slightly knowing voice.

"What have you done to me!?!" you wailed.

"Starting to feel a bit girlish, are we? What to play with some dollies?" Rikki said, clearly enjoying herself.

"No! I want you to make me a teen again" you demanded, trying to sound tough. You winced since your young body didn't exactly have the attributes to look tough.

"Not going to happen. I know what is your problem. You've started math in Lillian's class, and you can't do it. Admit it, little girl. You are one now. Sure you don't want...." Rikki mocked.

"Lucy?" a voice said from behind you. You saw it was the teacher, who you now assumed was Lillian. Her face was much softer, belying her former strict demeanor.
131112212211.title: A hard lesson

choices: you actually get to see some magic
1311122122111.content:
"You're upset that you can't do the math problems?" Lillian asked. Without waiting for a reply, she said, "Although this is a normal lesson, you are in a magic school and the books are enchanted. Because you didn't read the instructions on how to do the problems, you lost your ability to do them."

"Why aren't Sam or James affected? When will this wear off?" you asked.

"Olivia and Bella" Rikki corrected in her almost sneering voice. You're more than a little uncomfortable being about her, an even more since Lillian seemed content to allow her to bully you. "You should be remembering your skills in a week. If you do it again, it would be a month. Third time, you'll be the little girl you now are. Right, Lil?"

"That's correct. It may seem harsh, but magic can be deadly if mishandled. As for the others, they must had read the instructions, therefore they haven't experienced your problems" Lillian said.

"Okay. One more question. Why are you enjoying being mean to me?" you said, pointing at Rikki. "My little sister would be calling you a stupid poop head."

1311122122111211121112221111.content:
"Are you trying to wake up the entire school?" you hissed, as you, Tia and Tiffany snuck out of your dorm and crept towards the science classrooms where you hoped to find equipment to make your revenge. Unfortunately, the footwear that Rikki had cursed you and the others with wasn't made for sneaking. Every time you heard the clicking of Tia's shoes, you felt that someone would awaken and demand why three six year old students were creeping around at 1am.

"I'm not. Its your shoes doing all the clicking, Lucy. Haven't you learnt how to walk in your janes, yet?" Tia said. You could tell that Tifaany thought it was funny, so you gave her a poisonous look. After two minutes, you managed to open the main door to the science wing. You walked in hoping to find some chemistry equipment, but to your surprise it wasn't difficult; the lab looked like any other science-focused classroom from any school on the planet.

"I thought this is a magic school. Why do they have a science lab?" Tiffany asked.

"They teach more than just magic. Besides I'm guessing that chemistry would have some value for things like potions. We needs some beakers, some flasks, that hotplate, some chemicals....." you said, half hissing in an attempt to remain stealthy. Originally you thought about cooking up the slime in the lab, with Tia and Tiffany standing guard, but you changed your mind, deeming it too risky. Instead, you decided to take the equipment with you.

"This is what we're looking for?" Tia hissed back as she passed to you a bottle.

"Yes. We should had asked one of the others to come. This is heavy" you moaned.

"No. You're just weak like..." Tiffany started to say, but you cut her off by dumping several bottles in her arms. It shut her up for the remainder of your time in the lab, something that you thought was a small miracle. You quickly took the pillaged equipment back to your dorm and began your work. Amanda and Bella were asleep, but Olivia was still awake. She looked slightly surprised that you was able to get the equipment back.

"What now?" Olivia asked, almost like if she thought someone would be knocking on the door at any moment.

"We get some sleep. I'm not going to make anything when i can't see what I'm doing" you said.

"You could sneak around yet you can't see anything here?" Olivia scoffed.


Several hours later, you woke up just before six. Yawning slightly since your body wasn't used to the punishment you was giving it, you got out of bed, and opened your textbook. As you started working, you heard someone stirring. It was Amanda; she yawned and noticed that you was watching some liquid on a hotplate.

"Is there really a recipe for making slime?" Amanda asked somewhat timidly.

"You're afraid of some little boy doing to you what we're going to do to Rikki?" you asked. Amanda nodded slightly.

"Don't worry. Its not here, but you can make things if you know the principles behind it. I suppose its like magic" you said reassuringly.

"Okay. Lucy, I think you're missing something" Amanda said as watched you sir the now green looking mixture. Ducking away from you, she searched for something in a box by her bed.

"What?" you asked, before moaning at the sight of the fairytail princess hat that Amanda was holding. You knew she meant for it to be an improvised witch's hat. "Fine" you muttered, as Amanda placed the hat on your head.
1311122122111211121112221111.title: cooking up some trouble

13111221221112111211122211111.content:
Within a hour all the other girls woke up. Tiffany was amongst the first, and she giggled for a few seconds (you suspected that she realized that she giggled and thought it was too girly) at the sight of the hat you was wearing. Tia was the last; she yawned deeply, the use of magic and your late night plundering of the school left her worn out. With a tired yawn, Tia said, "You've already made the slime?!"

"Yeah. What's wrong?" you asked, seeing Tia's slightly troubled look.

"Your endurance. What if Rikki is right in saying you're the princess?" Tia said, causing a ridiculing snort from Tiffany.

"Trust me. I'm tired. Guys, the other dorm is ready to support us in providing a distraction, but we need some bait" you said, as you eyed Tiffany. She gave a slight smirk. "What do you was me to do?" she asked, as she spotted the gross looking green sludge that was in front of you.

"Nothing too bad. Just wear the sports' uniform" you said, a slight smirk of your own forming on your face.


------------------------------------------------------------

"I hate you!" Tiffany whined as she anxiously walked in front of you in her ballerina leotard to the agreed ambush spot near the gym.

"Maybe next time, you shouldn't tease me" you said. A part of you wanted to continue, to suggest giving either Hannah or your other cousin, Brooke a picture of the 'improved' Tim Towers, but you knew better than to antagonize, especially since you needed all your energies focused onto Rikki.

"Rikki has encountered Mia. She is swallowing the bait" Olivia said suddenly, waving a small cell phone.

"Quick. Hide!" Amanda whispered, causing everyone but Tiffany to scatter. A disgusted looking Rikki, who was following Emily, paused as she spotted Tiffany. "Hello. You must be the new student. Elvira told me that you was coming" Rikki said with a shark-like smile. It was clear to you that she suspected nothing, nor had any precautions. Even if she detected the magic coming off of you, she must had dismissed it.

"iI've been told about you, mud magnet" Tiffany shouted back. It caused Rikki to grin even more.

"You look adorable. Hope you like your class, little girl" Rikki mocked, stressing the word girl, as she stepped under the target zone, where you, Tia and Bella had the green ooze suspended, waiting for the right moment. Tiffany knew this, and said as she pointed upwards, "I'm going to enjoy it, you brainless witch!"

"What..." Rikki as she saw the slime dripping onto her. It fell right onto her face, hair and shoulders.

"Real mature. I'm glad you're acting your age. You really think this would be embarrassing?" Rikki said sarcastically, as she wiped the slime from her mouth. As she did, she grabbed her stomach. "What did you put into this?" she moaned.

"What do you think?" you replied as Rikki, still holding her stomach, rushed to the bathroom. With Rikki gone, Olivia smiled. "I've got the whole thing . So Lucy, what did you put in that slime?"

"Its not what you think" you said, smiling slightly. "So what now?"
13111221221112111211122211111.title: continue

131112212211121112111222111111.content:
"We confront her, but I suppose the others can do a bit of freeform ballet" Olivia said somewhat distastefully as she watched the bathroom door. Although the others, including the more girlier girls, heard Olivia's suggestions that they go and do ballet on their own, none left. Ten minutes later, Rikki emerged, still covered in the slime, looking slightly sick, and extremely furious. Her eyes narrowed as she saw that you was patiently waiting for her.

"You! You little bitch!" Rikki growled.

"What's wrong? Did a bunch of 'babies' get the better of you?" you asked, in a overly sweet voice.

"You tried to poison me!" Rikki screamed, attracting some attention from some of the older students. From their glances, you guessed that you and your classmates weren't the only ones that Rikki had tormented.

"You know I didn't Now, what are you going to do? Start treating us with the respect we deserve, or admit you just got outwitted by a six year old?" you asked. Despite yourself, it actually felt good saying you was six, and could see why Hannah occasionally played the 'cute' card.

Rikki glared at you, silently as if she was deciding how to respond. You never got to heard her immediate response since Elvira, attracted by the crowd, came to investigate. She gave you a slight glance and that was all what you needed, You followed her back to her office.

"Am I in trouble?" you asked as soon as Elvira closed her door.

Elvira smiled slightly, much to your surprise. "Virtually all the staff knew that sooner or later someone would break and do some sort of prank on Rikki. Miss Jameson isn't exactly the most friendly, or humble witch."

"Then why did you hire her?" you demanded,

"You don't need to know, young lady. It does present all sorts of problems" Elvira said, sighing. You remained silent, waiting for Elvira to continue.
"While I, and many others on the staff, I might add, won't say I'm displeased that you put Rikki in her place, it does leave you open to retaliation."

"Retaliation?" you asked.

"Yes. As you know, Rikki is fixated on the idea of Princess Lucy Harrison. It is certain she would try to get you into a princess costume any means she can."

"Why? Would such a costume just stick to me? I regret doing this, but since Timothy is now here, why not Princess Tiffany Towers?"

"You are magically stronger than any of your sisters or cousins, Lucy. Just watch yourself. I doubt that Rikki will even wait the two weeks for Christmas" Elvira said, avoiding your question.
131112212211121112111222111111.title: Retaliation

choices: Lillian casts a spell on Tiffany
1311122122111211121112221111111.content:
"Don't worry. I know how to defend myself" you said.

"Really?" Elvira said, as she raised an eyebrow. "I hope for you sake, you can back up those words with actions. False bravado and overconfidence would lead to a painful lesson. Just (chuckle) ask miss Jameson."

As you was about to leave, Elvira said, "One more thing, Lu. Don't encourage the others to go sneaking about the school grounds at night." Five minutes later, you navigated the maze that was Witchbloom's corridors and entered the classroom where you saw there everyone else, including Tiffany, was seated. You quickly sat down next to her.

"So what happened? Are you going to get expelled?" Tiffany asked, her eyes lighting up slightly. No doubt she was hoping to follow through on such a tactic.

"No, and that would be a terrible idea, Tiff. I've be warned that Rikki will be more determined than ever to see her idea of 'Princess Lucy'." you said, your voice fill with disgust. You noticed that Olivia, whom was sitting on the other side of you, had taken an interest. So did Mia, whom was seating behind.

"i thought that was something make up to tease you because you're a gross girl. What is going on?" Tiffany asked, her voice torn between curiosity, disgust and a slight panic.

"Apparently it seems 'princess' is a term for an extremely powerful witch. Grandma is being vague about it but I'm guessing maybe future head witch" you moaned, though the uncomfortable questions that were being asked by your cousin were cut off as Lillian walked into the room. She had a slightly bemused look on her face, as if she was secretly glad of what happened to Rikki. She also took no notice of Tiffany, like if having an extra student meant nothing to her.

"Morning class. I believe you had an interesting sports lesson and because of this, you've forced me to alter my lesson plans" Lillian said. She paused, closed her eyes and said, "I was going to focus on regular schoolwork...."

"After all this, I'm doing normal stuff!?! If I'm stuck in this cootie addled body, I want to see magic" Tiffany protested, causing most of the class to giggle. Lillian frowned slightly.

"I do not appreciate being interrupted like that young lady .... Very well. You want to see magic...."
1311122122111211121112221111111.title: continue

choices: you get a visit from a furious aunt
13111221221112111211122211111112.content:
You stared at Tiffany, then towards Lillian, worried that your cousin has invited for your teacher to cast spells at her. What would Lillian do? I know she could do much worse than worse than switch her gender and take a year or two off her age... you mused. Tiffany seemed to realized this as well; she panicked, as she leaped out of her chair in near record time. Before Tiffany could take more than a couple of steps, Lillian cast her spell.

"What did you...." Tiffany tried to say as a sprout of water hit her directly in her mouth, instantly cutting off her cries.

"Class. You might be wondering why I choose to hit miss Towers with water? Especially since she foolishly invited me to cast something more amusing" Lillian said, her stern features morphing into a warm smile.

"Why?" Mia asked. You knew she wanted to get Tiffany in dress similar to everyone else, and you knew that Tiffany would be close to starting WW3 if she tired.

"You can't fight what you can't see. I heard what all all did to that Rikki and I think some precautions would be appropriate. Plus Tiffany is a transformed boy. Trust me, they seem to enjoy learning these sort of spells" Lillian said as she continued to spray water into Tiffany's face. Your cousin was trying to shield herself, but with not much success.

"No" Lillian said to Tiffany's wincing frame. "Our magic cannot change a person into non-human forms."

"Oh" Emily said disappointed. As she slumped back into her seat, she gave a slight scream. You knew instantly what happened, and realized that you didn't need magic powers to outwit a witch. Tiffany, true to form had placed Fella on Emily's desk.

"Ewww! Get it away from me? How can you stand that gross thing!?" Emily yelled.
13111221221112111211122211111112.title: Lillian talks about defensive magic

131112212211121112111222111111121.content:
Naturally placing Fella on Emily's desk caused tension between her and Tiffany, that was enough to cause them to continue their argument once class had finished. Most of the others decided they wanted to see how the confrontation between the biggest tomboy and girliest girl would unfold, but you didn't want any part in it. Neither did Bella or Olivia; they quickly followed you back to your dorm.

"What ith going to happen to us?" Bella asked, a hint of frustration in her voice

"I don't know. Continue to pray that we get changed back once this year is over" you muttered.

"I know. I still can't get used to these clothes" Olivia agreed as you approached your dorm. You didn't need to ask for clarification; you knew that your clothes just felt weird on your body. As soon as you pushed open the dorm's door, you knew that it wasn't empty. Slightly wary, you went inside and found that you aunt, Catherine was sitting on your bed, and she didn't look happy.

"John Harrison! What is wrong with you!?!" Catherine yelled as you walked into visual range. you shuddered, slightly annoyed that it felt strange to be called by your real name. By now, 'Lucy' seemed to be almost natural..

"What did I do?" you shuddered.

"You know exactly what you did! What was you thinking teleporting Timothy here?! Where you trying to show how big and powerful you were and that you're not suited for first grade? Or are you so pissed about being such a cutie, you decided to take it out on someone that has no ability to handle it?" Catherine screamed.

"Why would I want that girl taunting jerk here?" you snapped, so annoyed your restraint had momentarily broken.

Do you have any idea how weird it is to be wearing this" you demanded as you pulled it your dress. "or to be wearing these panties? How snug they feel?"

"Tim was snooping around my room, going through my things. This isn't about Timmy, is it? Or is it? You think I'm going to be stuck like this, and Timmy would be the last guy in our family? Not going to happen" you snapped. Pausing, you added, "If it wasn't for Melanie, neither of us would had discover the truth! What is it with you witches and boys? See 'Bella'? Her mom preferred her like that, and 'Olivia' wasn't even allowed to keep her name, Sam."

"Don't bring us into it" Olivia muttered to you. Both you and Catherine ignored Olivia's comment.
131112212211121112111222111111121.title: A visit from a furious aunt
