1311122122111211121112221111111211.content:
"How long were you going to keep us in the dark?" you demanded, your voice growing increasingly colder.

"It was for your own protection" Catherine said. Seeing your increasingly sour look, Catherine quickly added, "Both Natalie and I have made mistakes in the past, Lucy. For what it's worth, you've nearly discovered the truth on three separate occasions."

"What kind of mistakes" you growled, your voice harsh.

"Overzealous use of magic. Some witches change boys for amusement. Others because they want to share their magic...." Catherine said, her voice slightly hesitant.

"So which am I" Bella interrupted.

"I don't know your mother, but from what you've told me, I think she wants a daughter. To teach magic; to do girly things..."

"So which one am I? I'm thinking 'ironic punishment'" you demanded.

"Don't press me, Princess" Catherine said, suddenly closing up. That infuriated you; your aunt was willing to talk to Bella and Olivia but not you.

"Damn it! Why won't you tell me!?!" you screamed, as you stamped your feet.

"I won't" Catherine said hesitantly.

"Why?" you pressed.

"Its inevitable that you'd find yourself changed, Lucy regardless of when you discovered magic. It would be inevitable that when you did, Tim would too. Its all done to protect you. Can't you see that?"

"I can look after myself" you said.

"Really?" Catherine said, raising her eyebrows slightly. That wasn't her only response. Within seconds, your dress became even more puffy, your shoes became glass slippers, pale pink gloves formed over your arms and a tiara materialized in your hair, giving you the look of a little girl playing pretty princess. Worse, Catherine changed both Bella and Olivia as well, though both hadn't realized it. Bella had a belle costume on, something you knew would infuriate her; more that Olivia's new snow white costume.

"Very funny. So you made me play dress up. Why did mom finally cave in? Was it Mel's lack of restraint" you asked.

"Didn't your twin say that you'd have to live with the consequences?" Catherine warned.

"And that landed me here."

"Fine. Don't blame me if you find your form locked, young lady. Your curiosity landed you at Witchbloom. If Natalie hadn't taken you here, you would had gone asking questions to the wrong person. Trust me, being a six year old girl isn't bad" Catherine said, opening up once more.

"Like whom?" you asked.

Catherine's sudden warm evaporated. "Forester. Samantha Forester."

"Mom always warned me not to go near her. Let me guess, evil witch?" you said.

"Witch, yes. Evil...." Catherine trailed off, her voice oddly bitter.

"What happened to you?! Were you... like us?" you gasped.

"No, and that is all I'm going to say" Catherine said in a sharp, clear tone that told you not to press any further. "I better leave before my daughter comes back and demands that I take her home."

Three weeks away you thought

Upon hearing Lillian's comment, your face turned red with anger. "That Rikki lied to us!" Fuming, you thundered. "She told us it had to be ballet!"

Lillian turned to you, concerned. "Lucy, you need to calm down this instant." Firmly but kindly, she ordered. "Strong emotions augment magic."

"She lied to us!" Hysterical, you screamed.

You slammed your fists onto your desk, rising to your feet. Your anger was beyond the breaking point and Lillian knew that she would have to pacify you quickly before something happened to make you permanently a girl and a witch. "Lucy, you will never be John again if you use your magic as emotional as you are right now." Sternly, she warned. "Calm down."

As she was talking, she hit an emergency call button on her necklace that alerted the other teachers that she had an angry transformed boy on her hands. The magic keeping you a girl was powerful but a few boys had managed to break its hold on them long enough to do some damage if a teacher or student angered them enough. She feared you would return as a boy long enough to cause Rikki physical harm as she was the first to rush into the room.

"What's the matter, princess?" Smiling at your anger, she asked. "I heard you say that I lied to you." She gave a mocking pout. "Did I say something to ruffle your pretty little curls?"

"Rikki, you are out of line." Unimpressed, Lillian said. "If he reverts to his male form, even for a moment with you so close...."

As Lillian continued to scold Rikki, you fell into an almost trance like state as your mind struggled to contain the rage you were feeling. You turned to a line of girls' book bags and smiled, thinking of how it would be fitting for them to take Rikki down a peg. Unknown to you, your magic reacted to that thought and the book bags began to change.

The effects were instant; immediately your shirt started to shrivel up into nothingness, and the neckline instantly plunged down to your upper chest. It would had given anyone a slight glimpse of your breasts, if you had any. The material around the neckline changed as well as more of your shirt disappeared, giving you thin straps, just like the spaghetti strapped top that Mel was wearing. Te only difference was yours was green, but that didn't last too long; within one tenth of a second, color started to bubble and radiate from the center of your new top, turning it pink like Mel's. All this took about half a second, barely enough time for Megan and Harry's brains to register the changes. As their eyes opened wide with shock, the other part of Mel's upper outfit formed on your body; a replica of her padded c cup bra.

As your top changed, your bottom changed too. You jeans instantly shriveled up in the same way as your top did, leaving only the part above your knees intact. Almost as rapidly, the stitching in your jeans came loose, as the fabric shifted to a soft cotton, only for the stitching to link up, forcing the torn leggings to come together into a skirt. You barely had time to register that the strange feeling of a breeze flowing up your skirts wasn't quite right when your underwear started to shift as well. As rapidly as it was for your other clothes, your underwear softened and twisted shape into a pair of pink cotton panties.
1341.title: Your clothes change to a copy of Mel's outfit

13411.content:
Megan and Harry were hysterically laughing at the scene before; you standing in shock wearing an exact replica of your twin sister’s outfit, even down to her padded bra. You chalked that last part up to Mel’s insecurities about her body; all of the woman in your family were big chested and at 14 years old Mel was only a B cup.

Crossing your arms in frustration, you turned to Mel and said, “Okay Mel, you’ve made your point; now get me out of this silly outfit before Mom or someone else sees me.”

“I don’t think so...dear brother.” With a smirk, Mel said, “I said I was going to give you a taste of my powers; the problem is that only girls can be witches.”

A look of dread appeared across your face as you realized what Mel was going to do next. “Please don’t, Mel; I-I’m sorry.” Putting your arms up in self defense, you said, “I didn’t mean to get you mad.”

“I’m not mad; I’m just having fun.” With a chuckle, Mel said, “I’ve always wanted to have a twin sister; now I guess I’ll have one.”

By that point both Megan and Harry had stopped laughing; with Megan coming to her boyfriend’s aid. “Mel; don’t overreact here, it was just some simply teasing from your brother.”

“Stow it, Meg; you and I both know John needs to learn a lesson here, especially after he’s less than supportive whenever you have your monthly visitor.” Turning to you, Mel said, “Perhaps a few weeks where he experiences life with my powers and perhaps his own monthly visitor; he’ll be more understanding about what we go through.”

You turned to Meg in desperation; hoping that she was going to continue siding with you. You were shocked when she turned away and walked towards Megan. “I’m sorry babe, but your sister is right.”

“Fine, I don’t need your support then.” Turning to Harry, you said, “I’ve got my best friend on my side.”

“Sorry man, but don’t drag me into this.” Stepping away, Harry said, “I still have nightmares from Hayley swapped me and my pregnant aunt last year. Childbirth is not something a 13 year old boy should experience.”

Realizing you were outnumbered, you sighed and said, “Fine, just get it over with.”

With Megan and Harry watching in silence, Mel continued the changes to your body. The first things to change were your hair and face; as your hair grew to just past your shoulders and your face became more feminine.

As you struggled to get the hair out of your eyes, you felt your chest starting to feel puffy. Looking down you saw it growing until you had breasts the same size as Mel’s. After that the rest of the changes progressed quickly; it wasn’t long before you were a complete girl.

One last change that Mel made was to change the color of her top so that the two of you could be told apart. As you walked over to the mirror to see yourself, you were stopped when _______ walked into the room.
13411.title: John becomes Amanda, the younger twin

134112.content:
Having heard the commotion from downstairs, Natalie had decided it was time to see what was going on. Walking into the bedroom, she was surprised to find a perfect copy of her daughter Mel staring dumbfounded at her reflection in the mirror. It didn’t take a genius to figure out what was going on.

Turning to the real Mel, Natalie said, “Melissa Rachel Harrison; what did you do to your brother!?”

“He was asking for it, mom; he was saying my...our powers are simple parlor tricks.” Getting fearful, Mel said, “So I...turned him into a girl so he could experience the power for himself.”

“That was very irresponsible of you, young lady.” Gesturing towards her former son, who was currently grasping his breasts in his hands, Natalie said, “You may have spent a year training at the school; but that doesn’t mean you have the control needed to safely change the gender of a boy born into a witch family. There could be drastic consequences for John down the road.”

“My name’s Amanda now, mom.” Turning away from the mirror, seeing the confused look on Natalie’s face, Amanda said,
“Don’t look at me; something in my mind...told me that was my name.”

“So help me, Melissa; if you took my son from me, I’ll see that you’re punished.” Taking Amanda’s hand, Natalie said, “Come on...Amanda; let’s get you into some clothes you’ll be more comfortable in.”

Once Natalie and Amanda were gone, feeling unsure of what she had done, Mel turned to Harry and Megan. “You guys think I did the right thing here; John needed to be taught a lesson.”

“You took my boyfriend from me, Mel.” Angrily, Megan said, “I don’t like girls; if John is stuck like this then that means our relationship is over.”

As Megan walked out of the room to see Amanda, Harry spoke up. “Instead of using your powers to teach John a lesson; maybe you should’ve used them to teach yourself how to control your anger.”
134112.title: Mom

1341121.content:
Upset by the comments, Mel ran to her room, book still in hand. She was crying, not expecting to have been turned against like that int he end. She was so mad. Everyone was overreacting! It wasn't like John...sorry, Amanda...didn't deserve it. Mel opened her spell book and tore through the pages, casting spell after spell in anger, not even fully realizing what she was doing. Soon enough, flowers were growing from her floor, her T.V. turned itself on, and she could swear that she heard some kind of ghost that she probably accidentally called into the house. Most ghosts tended to be friendly, so that wasn't a big deal. Ugh, why was she even doing this? physical transformations were some of the hardest spells to reverse, so for all the knew, John was actually stuck as Amanda forever now. If only there was something she could do to make it right...

As Mel kept reading her spells randomly and things kept happening, she didn't even realize the spell that she had just landed on. It was a simple spell, but required some very advanced magic. It wasn't until after she said it, when the book began glowing brightly, that Mel realized what she had done. She started yelling "No! No! I don't really want this! Stop the spell!!!" to no avail. Every exploded from the book, hitting everything it could find. The picture on Mel's desk of her and John changed into one of her and Amanda, her twin. All family pictures that had John in them changed to having Amanda. Even baby pictures changed from having a baby boy to a baby girl. As the energy hit John's room all of his clothing changed in size and design to become much more girly and fit someone of Mel and Amanda's size. All the videogames were replaced with girly books and magazines and the room became a place with much similar taste to Mel's. Then the energy spread away from the house.

***

Megan was looking at all the pictures of herself with John, crying about the possible loss of her boyfriend. She really loved him and didn't know what she would do without him. Suddenly, the energy hit her room. The pictures of the two of them on dates were changed and all the pictures of the two of them on her phone got deleted or altered. The one she was looking at now suddenly changed to a picture of her with Amanda. Megan frowned as the energy hit her. She suddenly held her head, now having a huge headache. She moved a hand to her eye and felt a tear. Had she been crying? Why would that be? She looked at her phone and smiled at the picture. Nothing could brighten Megan's mood like seeing a picture with herself and her best friend Amanda. The two were practically sister's and were on the cheer squad together. she flipped to another picture of her photo bombing Amanda and Harry's first kiss. The two of them had been a couple for awhile and Megan was always hanging out with them. Megan laughed, wondering if she could crash their next date.

***
Back at the house, the new Amanda was getting being helped by her mom to get dressed in a comfortable dress when the energy hit both of them and they held their heads.

"Mom? why were you helping me to get dressed again?" Amanda asked, confused as she fixed up her dress and looked int he mirror. Her mother looked at her with an equally confused look.

"I have no idea, sweetheart. Why don't you go back to your sister and work on magic together?" she asked, turning around to leave. She smiled as she watched Amanda run over to Mel's room. Her twin daughters were getting better by the day.

***
In Mel's room, she was crying hysterically. The last thing she wanted was to cast that spell. If all of reality was now changing, there would be no possible way for John to come back, because no one would know who John was. Mel was still crying when Amanda walked into her room. "Hey, are you alright, sis?" she asked, concerned, kneeling to the ground. Mel pushed her away.

"No, of course I'm not, John!" she yelled, reading more random spells from her book in an effort to reverse things. Amanda just looked confused.

"John? Who's that? Why are you reading all these spells from our book?" she asked, recognizing the spellbook as the one that the two girls had always shared and learned from.

"Just shut up and let me fix this!" she yelled as the energy came full circle, hitting Mel hard. She dropped the book and fell to the floor, holding her head. As her concentration broke, her room returned to normal. Amanda shook Mel's shoulder.

"Hey, sis, what happened? Helloooooooo....earth to Mel?" she asked, taking the book from her sister and flipping through it. Amanda found a spell for healing a headache and said it with a smile. Mel felt the pain go away and smiled at her sister.

"Tanks 'Manda. Hey, was I crying?" she asked confused, wiping the tears away. Amanda nodded.

"Yeah. You were yelling about how you did something bad and you called me John"

"John, who's that?"

Amanda shrugged. "Beats me, but I think you thought I was him. As if I could ever be a boy...that's just gross" she said with a laugh.

Mel just giggled at her twin's statement. "Oh I don;t know sis...I think you'd make a cute boy" she said
1341121.title: A big change

choices: I know Meg wants to practice her cheers. I'm just finding her a partner
John is acting childish so i'm giving Hannah a playdate
1342.content:
"What was that? What did you do to me?" you demanded. Even though you couldn't see, or hear anything, you knew that Mel had done something to you.

"Okay. I've got magic powers and I just cast a spell onto you, John" Mel said as she gave you a odd smile. It was more of a forced, sweet type of smile, and definitely not one to make you feel easy.

"You know I don't believe in magic, Melanie" you said annoyed.

"Maybe you should, John. You're smart; can you think of a rational explanation for what you've seen, or what is about to happen to you?" Mel said with a slight giggle.

"What is wrong with you?" you growled.

"Nothing, though I guess it will be highly embarrassing for you, little bro, amusing for me, and assuming you guys don't run away, I think you'd be amused too" Mel said as she addressed Megan and Harry.

"Mel, what is going on? I'm with John; I'm worried...." Megan started to say, but her words died in her throat as your hair rapidly lengthened and tied itself to form two blond pigtails. You didn't notice your new hairstyle, but you saw the stunned looks on your friends' faces.

"You guys look like you've seen a ghost....' you said confused.

"M-Me-Melanie. W-What are you d-doing?" Harry fearfully stuttered.

13421.title: I know Meg wants to practice her cheers. I'...

134211.content:
"John. Quiet! You're going to attract mom's attention" Mel said anxiously. Even if you were in the position where you weren't terrified, you would had screamed anyway. Mel bit her lip slightly as she heard the clicking of mom's heels as she got up to investigate.

"What is going on? Why is your brother screaming?" mom thundered as she walked into the room. She took one look at you, Megan and Harry and turned white, though you didn't know whether it was from rage or fear.

"Did you do this?" mom demanded in her sternest voice.

"Mom. I...." Mel said, but mom wasn't in the mood for excuses. She cut Mel off from speaking almost immediately.

"Not only you've revealed everything to your brother, you've revealed it to Megan and Harry too" mom said.

"Mom, its okay. They're...."

"Not at all equipped to deal with this. Not only you've exposed your own secret, you've exposed mine. What where you trying to achieve? Cheerleader transformation" mom said after a quick glance at your hair.

"Mom..."

"Did you consider to adjust to the increased twin reactions?" mom asked.

Normally you wouldn't step in when Mel is getting in trouble like this, but the talk of adjustment unnerved you. "What do you mean by reaction?" you asked before Mel could answer.

"John. My office. Megan and Harry too" mom ordered.
134211.title: Your screams attracted mom

1342111.content:
As you walked to mom's office, you began to feel increasingly angry about the fact neither mom or your sisters trusted you to even know the truth. Megan, who was following you was becoming increasingly concerned since she noticed that your hips were beginning to sway, though you didn't notice it. She gulped, wondering whether to flee, but she quickly followed you and Harry into mom's study.

"Take a seat" mom said. You sat down, unaware of the 'padding' around your butt and glared at mom. "Finally you said in an icy voice, "Why didn't you tell me? Don't you trust me?"

"Its not a matter of trust, John. I forbade your sisters from telling you to keep you safe, and to prevent you from panicking. You must had really pressed her buttons for her to openly do this" mom said as she held up a hand to signal Megan to remain quiet.

"Whatever. I don't even care anymore" you said in the same icy tone.

"I know you're hurt. Think this stunt of Melanie's is the worst that could happen?"

"That Mel could curse him?" Megan interrupted.

You stared at mom with a horrified look. "No. That wasn't your sister. It was me. Even though you was completely aware of magic, and was watching my every move, you didn't even see the spells I placed on you."

"Spells?" you gulped.

"Yes, and technically Harry is the only guy in this room" mom said coolly. Hearing that, you panicked. "Turn me back!"

"Calm down! All of you!" mom said. "John. Listen to me. If I told you about all this after Hayley got back, I doubt 'you' would be in my office listening to this. You'd have about 80% chance changing for good, including self-triggered changes."

"And how would you know that? I can understand us not knowing, but not John" Harry asked, speaking for the first time in an equally icy voice.

"What do you know about multiverse theory?" mom said.
1342111.title: Learning the truth

13421111.content:
"I've heard of it. Sci-fi channel" Megan said.

"Yes, but does any of you know what it is?" mom asked.

"Infinite number of alternate universes running parallel to our own. These alternate realities can be anywhere from being completely alien to being virtually identical to our world. Mom, what does this have to do with magic. More importantly, CHANGE ME BACK!" you yelled.

"What are you saying? Magic came from a different world?" Harry asked, seemingly clueless about your plight.

"Possibly, but if it did, it occurred thousands of years ago. I'm more concerned about the present day. I was never going to show you this, but thanks to your sister, you three have questions that need answering" mom said, as she lifted her hand. A 3-D map of the globe appeared above mom's desk. Harry and Megan looked impressed, but you weren't so happy. Mom grimaced as she pointed to a flashing dot that appeared in the middle of the south Pacific. "This is the most potent magical point on the planet."

"Is that where Mel and Hayley went?" you demanded.

"God no. I don't want any of you within a thousand miles of this place" mom said. "Its used for either training, or dealing with certain.... problems" mom said.

"Training?" you asked.

"John. Do not question me anymore in this topic of training, or I swear, you can forget about me changing you back. Ever" mom said, her urgency unnerving you.

"I wasn't the one that brought it up. Why?" you demanded.

"Under this island is a tear in our reality" mom said, seemingly more calm.

"So this goes to another universe. What's it like?" Harry asked in an impressed voice. He was always more interested in this sort of stuff.

"Five universes actually. One has magic far stronger than ours and seems that all the myths you're ever heard comes from this reality. Another seems to had magic seeded into it. Whether from our universe or another, I don't know. Another universe is much more technologically advanced compared to us."

"Sounds nice" Harry said, apparently interested in mom's story. You and Megan weren't sharing his enthusiasm though. Mom gave a thin smile. "We've add some nasty things come through that tear, though luckily it seems the people on the other side somehow blew themselves up."

"Nice..." you muttered, not sure whether to believe mom's story. "What does this have to do with me?"

Mom smiled, though you wasn't sure whether it was one of sadness, regret, or distain. "Just before we lost contact, my brother tried to reverse engineer some tech from that world, but mom caught him. Its like giving allowing children to play with a nuclear weapon. This leads to a point of divergence. The fourth universe is identical to ours, except for one detail; you" mom said.
13421111.title: the five worlds

134211111.content:
"What do you mean me!?" Startled, you asked.

Mom sighed. "You do not exist in that reality; you left that world thirteen years ago."

Your eyes widened to the size of saucers, the color running from your face. "Are you trying to tell me that I came from that fourth reality you told us about!?" Almost yelling, you asked.

"Your uncle Jack tried to gain technology from the advanced world." Darkly, mom said. "He did it by paying witches to construct a magical portal that would pull items from that world into our own."

"Only something went wrong." Guessing correctly, Harry said.

Mom nodded, sighing. "Jack did not set the controls correctly and opened the portal to the fourth reality I just mentioned." Looking directly at you, she said. "Instead of stealing advanced technology, he ended up inadvertently kidnapping an infant from another world."

Megan and Harry turned to you, their eyes turning wide. "Dude! You- You are an alien!?"

"Mel originally had a twin daughter who died shortly after birth." Shedding tears, mom said. "When Elvira brought you to me, John, I was amazed by how much you looked like her."

"No... No, its not true!" Crying, you whimpered. "I'm your son!"

"You are my son." Firmly but kindly, mom said. "You were just... adopted. Elvira could not send you back, she said it was too dangerous."

You began to cry uncontrollably, not understanding how or why mom was being so cruel. She tried to comfort you but you ran from the room before another word could be said. You bolted up the stairs in tears and ran into your bedroom, slamming the door behind you.

You remained in your room, crying for the remainder of the day. As the sun slowly began to set, a knock came to your door. You refused to answer and it opened revealing...
134211111.title: continue

1342111112.content:
....your grandmother, Elvira. "Do you want to talk, John?" Elvira said gently. Your didn't answer; instead you curled into a ball. Elvira sighed and said, "I know what Natalie said to you, John. I've got two things in my hand that should interest you."

"What? that my 'mother' isn't my mother? That I'm an alien?" you demanded, speaking for the first time.

"Hank in that world was a scientist. They were working on teleportation technology. They then slightly altered the machine with a temporal effect in mind, but they instead formed a portal between these realities" Elvira said.

"Was?"

"John, the technology of that world was at least 50 years ahead of this world. The point of divergence seemed to be 1918, which in turn produced an alternate WW2 and cold war" Elvira said.

"I don't like where this is going" you said.

"Neither did your father- in both realities" Elvira said, starting some sort of dvd player. "As you guessed this tape has in it the backdrop of the opening blows of the third world war. It was far too dangerous to send you back, and your father in both realities wanted you to stay. As for believing the story, would you had believed it? Look at the comparison with you and Melanie" Elvira said.

13421111122.content:
"I was originally Mel!?" Stunned, you asked. "How!? Why!?"

"You were a version of Mel, pulled through on Girl Island." Darkly, Elvira replied. "Being from the world I had just described, your gender was changed to give your body the physical strength to bounce back from your injuries."

"Wouldn't magic have done the same thing?" Shaken, you asked.

Elvira shook her head. "Normally, yes." Softly, she said. "Only our magic and your magic were not in sync at that time. Only now are you able to use magic in the form of a girl."

All of what you were hearing was becoming too much for you. Tears rushed down your face as you clenched your fists in anguish and frustration until your left fist began to glow. Elvira was the first to take notice and pointed to it. "John, open your left hand."

Now seeing the glow in your fist, you slowly opened your hand. A spark ignited and you jumped upon seeing a small globe of energy hovering and spinning over your palm. "What- What is this!?" Terrified, you asked. you jumped up onto your feet, staring at the globe of energy. "I thought mom said only girls could work magic!"

"Only girls can work magic in this world, John." Patiently, Elvira corrected. "You are from another reality; one where boys work the magic. That is why we waited to tell you."

"Because I'm the only boy here that can work magic?" Confused, you asked.

Elvira nodded. "You are unique, John." Softly, she said. "If magic works for you as a girl as well, I strongly suggest you stay that way as other witches and witch boys will want to know 'how you did it'."

"You mean magic may not work for me as a girl." Frowning, you said. "I would be... normal."

Again, Elvira nodded. "Yes but it is equally possible that you could have magic as a girl." Giving you a small grin, she said. "Will you let me change you so we can find out?"

What do you do?

Your body was slightly more developed, and you was slightly taller. "Why did you 'enhance' my body?" you demanded, infuriated by your new appearance.

134211111221.title: You reluctantly agree.

1342111112211.title: The flame test

134211111221112.title: Elvira doesn't change you back

1342111112211121.content:

As you appeared, both your friends gave you an anxious look, though you doubted it had nothing to do with the fact you're the opposite gender. Hannah though, had a big girlish grin on her face as if she wanted to do everything she could with her new, older sister.

"i take that your talk with Elvira went well?" Mom asked.

"Turn me back, mom. i don't want to be a girl. I-I look like a cheerleader! Sorry" you said, addressing Megan for the last bit.She brushed it off; she knew you had nothing against her or the rest of the squad. It was just the discomfort of being 'placed' onto it against your will.

"John. There is a real risk if I do change you back, that you could start spontaneously changing into a girl during class" mom said evenly.

"That is a risk I'm willing to take" you snapped. As you looked around a still worried looking Mel, you snapped, "What is her problem?"

"Mel and Hannah was about to perform a duel for us" Harry said

"Hannah?!" you said, surprised.

"Of course since Mel is trained, Mrs H was going to turn her into a boy first" Megan said, slightly too gleefully for your tastes. You felt your anger building; it was okay in Mel's mind to change you, but not okay for herself. mom stared at you, deep in thought.

"Okay. I've got a solution. Mel, you're not dueling Hannah anymore. You're dueling John. Unchanged" mom announced.

"What!?" you demanded, knowing this would be an unfair fight.

"Lose, and you remain as you are, daughter. Win, and I've got all the proof I need that you can handle yourself. Do you accept these terms, John?" mom asked.
1342111112211121.title: You ask mom to change you back.

13421111122111211.content:
"Yes' you said sulkily since you saw that you had no other option. Even so, you felt cheated. Mel was trained to use her powers, whereas you didn't even know real magic existed. Worse, Mel was still herself, about to fight in her normal body, and you was completely changed.

"Don't worry john. Being a girl isn't bad. once this is over, I'll take you shopping" Mel offered, her voice filled with confidence and while she meant it kindly, it did come across that she expected to win quickly, and get you into the girly stuff fast. As you wondered despairingly how to overcome the two disadvantages that were facing you, you heard Hayley's voice saying, "This fight will involve elemental type magic. Vaporize water so Mel can't see."

"Huh?" you thought, as you looked around, expecting to heard Mel's moaning that it was 'unfair' that Hayley was giving you advice on how to fight Mel, but Mel was still looking at you, with the same smile that was generated by the thoughts of having a 'true twin'

"Mel won't be able to hear us, John. I'm mentally sending you messages" Hayley's voice echoed in your mind.

"How?"

"You know that, 'sis'. I've decided to help you mainly because i'm with you; this isn't a fair fight, and mostly because of Mel's disdain. She was going to be turned into a guy to fight me, and know that she is fighting you, she is probably already- no- is imagining how to girlify you in the shortest amount of time. Now, move to the left..." the voice said. You obeyed, as Mel knew out what looked like lighting. It caused both Megan and Harry to panic, but mom was unconcerned, saying that it wouldn't harm you... only incapacitate you, and win the duel for Mel. You barely noticed, since you was focused on Mel's slightly shocked face. She obviously expected to win in the first move. A surge of anger rippled through you.

"Good. Magic is like hard exercise, 'sis', and Mel will be using a lot. Counterstrike now. Imagine water. A lot of water, and boil it" the voice said.

You frowned and to your shock as you imagined water, water magically appeared above your hand. "H-how?" Mel stammered.

"You're forgetting your training. John is a girl, and all girls in this family, even Hannah would have some ability to work magic" mom said irritably, though she gave a faint smile as you tried to throw the water into Mel's face....
13421111122111211.title: you reluctantly accept

134211111221112112.content:
"Hey!" Mel gargled as a stream of water her her directly in her face. You felt a slight surge of satisfaction, but it was quickly cut short; Hayley continued her mind trick and she didn't sound too happy.

"I told you to vaporize water, not throw it in her face" Hayley's voice echoed in your head.

"Why not?"

"Because you're inexperienced. Yes, you're powerful sis, but Mel is trained. Either two things happen if you continue like this. You overexert yourself, pass out, which would meant you've lost. The alternative is that you get yourself a Pyrrhic victory."

"Pyrrhic victory?"

"Yes. Your win comes at an overwhelming cost"

"I know what it is, Hayley. Get to the point" you thought, furiously as Mel counteracted. You dodged her spell, but could see that Mel was more cautious.

"Your magical exertion would lead you to be either finding yourself stuck in this form, or finding yourself as the Princess. Sorry, John. 'Princess' is the rather unfortunate title for the successor to Elvira" Hayley's voice explained.

"What now? I'm outgunned, and out maneuvered"

"Stay on the defensive . See Mel's face? I think she is starting to realize that you're getting help" Hayley ordered. You looked and saw that Mel looked furious.

"John! You're cheating!" Mel screamed, as she started to fire fireballs at you. While it alarmed Megan and Harry, you just knocked them down with more water.

"I'm not cheating, Mel. And even if I was, what about your ethics?" you protested.

"Me?" Mel yelled.

"You're too eager to fight me. You want me to stuck like this" you said.

"No"

"Then stand down" you said.

Slowly, Mel nodded. Her flame went out, as she sat down. Mom was smiling slightly too, though you could tell she was surprised. "A duel is over when a combatant is either physically or mentally unable to continue the fight. Impressive tactics, John, though I know you did get some sort of interference" mom said, giving Hayley a glare.

"You said you're change me back if I won, mom. Turn me back right now" you growled.

Mom looked at you closely and said...
134211111221112112.title: A pyrrhic victory?

1342111112211121121.content:
"Of course, John. I did give you my word, though I did say it with the intent that you would be able to magically defeat Mel" mom said.

"I still defeated her" you snapped, though your temper was restrained as you felt your body shift. Within seconds, you was physically back to normal. Emotionally, it was a different story. You felt angry towards nearly everyone, and took that anger out on your bedroom door as you slammed it shut. After a couple of minutes, someone cautiously knocked on your door. Without waiting for a response, the door opened. It was Harry.

"You okay, bro?" Harry asked.

"What do you think? this has to been the worst day of my life" you said.

"I can understand that' Harry sympathized.

"I'm surprised that you're still here" you said.

"I can't believe that your mom wanted to keep you changed. John, I admit I'm barely keeping calm about this magic stuff, but you're got it worse" Harry said, as he shut the door.

"Where is Megan?" you asked.

"With Mel. After you stormed off, she did too, complaining about being humiliated. What is her problem?" Harry asked, rhetorically.

"Mel never liked to lose, Harry. I think she felt cheated that Hayley was helping me. I guess there is at least one person here that that isn't out to get me" you admitted.

"So, with this whole alien crap-" Harry began, but you were interrupted by another knock. Thinking it was Megan, you opened it, but you wasn't too thrilled to see that it was Hayley.

Guess I've got to talk, John. A real one, not some mental link thing" Hayley said.

"Yeah. Were you going to keep him in the dark? Did you have any plans against me? And what is with this whole other dimension thing?" Harry jumped in.

"What dimension thing?" Hayley asked, showing real confusion.

"You know the whole thing that I was born in an alternate universe, as a girl" you said, the sarcasm dripping from your bitter words.

'Impossible" Hayley protested.

"Why not?" you said, half moaning, half demanding.

"You don't want to know. Trust me, I know that except for today, you're always have been my brother and you' were born in this reality" Hayley said, as she eyed Harry.

"Why not?" you repeated.
1342111112211121121.title: back to normal

choices: You decide to ask for other's stories
13421111122111211211.content:
"Do you really want to know?" Hayley asked, though her question was mainly directed at Harry.

"Yes. Stop playing games! Do you have any idea how I'm feeling tight now!?" you screamed, your temper flaring to almost breaking point. Hayley sighed and said in a low and slightly hesitant, grossed out voice, "Shortly before I left for Witchbloom, I accidentally watched the tape of you and Mel getting born."

"Why were you watching that?" you demanded, as you realized why she didn't want to talk about it, least in front of Harry. His face showed his discomfort, not that you blamed him. That was one side of his girlfriend you doubted he ever wanted to think about. After a few seconds, you said, "So, it doesn't say anything. I was told that it showed two girls."

"No. Definitely Mel, then you" Hayley said.

"What? Are you sure?"

"Positive, and there are two memories mom would never magically change. Us, or dad" Hayley said.

"What is going on? What you're saying totally conflicts with what mom, then grandma told and then shown me" you said, confused at the news.

"It could be that they are testing your emotional stability, bro" Hayley said.

"Why? First they turn him into a girl, then they're being cruel about it" Harry said, regaining his voice.

"Not everyone takes a gender switch spell well, Harry. look at your girlfriend. She hated the thought of being changed, and I don't think it was because of the presence of you or Megan" Hayley said, smirking slightly.

"And you?" Harry asked, somewhat boldly. You half expected that Harry would had started to change, but to your slight disappointment, he remained normal.

"Its weird, but as you know, this family is weird. John, I suppose there is one way of testing it" Hayley said.

"What?"

"The other thing is maybe that the story is a deterrence; that you wouldn't try magic as a boy. If someone else had a similar story...." Hayley trailed off.

"I see where this is going. Why don't I try magic right now?" you asked.

"That could work, but its not one hundred percent accurate. It could be a false positive " Hayley said.

"Mrs H said boys can not work magic" Harry said.

'True, unless they were beginning to change. That is known to happen with powerful witches; twins tend to be more powerful, John."
13421111122111211211.title: Conflicting evidence

13421111122111212.content:
"Those conditions are beyond unfair, mom!" Nearly screaming, you protested. "Mel got a full year of training in magic where I had none whatsoever! What happened to you not playing favorites!?"

"Exactly what are you implying, young lady?" Annoyed, mom asked.

"If this duel is to be anywhere near fair, I would have to get the same year of training as Mel!" Angry, you shouted. "Without that training, I am guaranteed to lose and you know it!"

Mom looked at you closely then smiled. "I suppose you do have a point." Calmly, she said. "Mel does have a slightly unfair advantage, being a trained witch. However, if you were to get that same training, the odds would be more even."

"It would help." With a satisfied tone, you agreed.

Mom's smile grew. "Then its settled." Satisfied, she said. "Tomorrow morning you will be transferred to Witchbloom all girls boarding school for your year of training in magic."

Your satisfied smile flattened and you turned to mom, confused. "Wait. Didn't I just win?"

Hayley giggled, walking out of the room as mom smiled. "It depends upon how you look at it dear."

Mel laughed. "John, you protest too much!"
13421111122111212.title: You protest too much.

134211111221112122.content:
Hearing mel's comments, you fled out the house. No way you wanted to go to Witchbloom. As you flew through the door, you hear footsteps. Fearing it was mom, you turned around and was glad to see it was Megan and Harry.

"I-I've got to get out of here" you said.

"I know. my room" Megan said.

"What? Won't that be the first place anyone would look" you protested.

"Not quite. My house would be first. Anyway, Joanie, I think your family is smart enough to let you cool off first" Harry said.

"Don't call me that. Its bad enough I've been turned into this. How would you like it? It would complete the trio" you said, indicating your feminine body and the cheer uniform. Harry looked alarmed by that comment, though Megan seemed bemused.. Wordlessly, Megan half pulled into through her front door and past her slightly bemused looking mother. You felt slightly alarmed, knowing that Dr Thompson was mom's best friend, and you wondered if she knew about any of the things that was happening to you. Once in Megan's room, you felt safe enough to talk.

"I think your mom knows" you said.

"What? How? If you didn't know.... Sorry, John" Megan said, trying to be diplomatic; you brushed it off, trying not to think of why Dr Thompson would know and you didn't.

"How can we turn him back?" Harry asked.

"We can't. Sorry, John, but you may as well try to enjoy it" Megan said.

"Enjoy?" you hissed.

"You're nearly a perfect match for Mel" Megan said, as a mischievous look formed on her face.

"I was told I'm an alternate version of Mel" you said downcast.

"Oh. Sorry" Megan said.

"You're still your own person. So what? You're completely different personality wise to your airheaded sister" Harry said, making you smile. Your smile faded as you heard something knocking on Megan's window. It was Hayley.

"How?" Megan asked. unlike you or (until recently) Harry, there was no way anyone could climb up into her room. Hayley smiled, and said, "What do you think? I need to talk to my cute sis."

"Go away. tell mom I'm not going" you growled.

"I've got your uniform" Hayley said.

"i said. No way I'm wearing that!" you screamed as Hayley showed you the uniform she was holding. It consisted of a white blouse, pleated skirt and black mary janes with knee high socks.

"You don't have to wear it now. I've got some other clothes with me if you don't want to wear that cheerleader uniform, or borrow Meg's stuff" Hayley said.

"Not going to happen" you protested.

"Only the girls in grade three or under don't have to wear uniforms. You don't want that, do you?" Hayley asked.

"Hayley. Can't you see this isn't what you brother wants?" Harry argued.

"Joanie is a witch whether she likes it or not, though maybe she would prefer a different name. i'll let you guys talk if sis doesn't want my clothes" Hayley said. As she was about to leave, she added, "One more thing. If you guys want, you can both join sis at Witchbloom."
134211111221112122.title: Hayley talks to you about Witchbloom.

1342111112211121221.content:
"Aren't you forgetting something? To go to a magic school, you actually have to have something, like magic" Megan said, as she looked at both your and Harry's stunned and puzzled faces.

Hayley gave a warm smile. "Mom can imbue someone with her powers. Enough to get you through a year, though Witchbloom does teach more than just magic. Think of it as a reward for not running out the door screaming."

"Not going to happen. Firstly Witchbloom is a girls' school. More importantly, you said that we'd be in the same class as John. What if you decide that he is having a 'temper tantrum' and enrolls him in kindergarten?" Harry demanded.

"Yes, that is true. You would be same age as my little sis. There is no 'dishonor' or punishments for declining, guys. Even Samantha wouldn't.... never mind" Hayley said, though you was suspicious of why she cut herself off. You was also angry that your friends had a choice, whereas you was being forced.

"What are you hiding?" you hissed, in an accusing tone.

"You'll find out. Megan and Harry have a big decision, sis. We should leave them in peace. You also need to come up with a new name for yourself" Hayley soothed.

"Damn it, Hayley. You know I don't want this" you yelled, as your temper bubbled to the surface.

"You're a Harrison, John, and you're female. Deal with it since you do not, repeat, do not want to find out what happens if you don't go. Least you have someone to talk about this stuff, which is more that could be said about either Melanie or me" Hayley snapped. "Start acting like the 14 year old you're supposed to be before someone decides to match your body with your attitude."

"What happens if John doesn't go?" Megan asked.

"It would be considered at John was defeated in the duel, and she would have to get used to the idea of bras, skirts and boys. And I'm not going to let that happen, sis. Sorry guys that you had to hear 'Joanie's' temper tantrum. Mom will need an answer by tomorrow morning." Hayley said, as she half dragged you out of Megan's room.
1342111112211121221.title: continue

13421111122111212211.content:
I'm going to make this very clear to you, little sister." Firmly but kindly, Hayley said. "It does not matter where you were born or where you were originally from. All that maters is that you are John Harrison."

"Not anymore, apparently." Downcast, you said.

Hayley slapped the back of your head, causing you to wince. "Would you think any less of me if I were suddenly turned into a boy? Serious, she asked.

"Of course not." Annoyed, you replied. "I'd try to help you all I could."

"Do you think we are trying nothing?" Her temper showing, Hayley pressed.

"I never said that!" Quickly, you countered.

"That is how you are acting." Accusingly, Hayley said. "As a girl, you have magic. However, without training, there is no chance, I repeat, NO chance of you becoming a boy again."

"What are you saying?" Startled, you asked.

Hayley sighed. "Once the changes are complete, it would be considered cruel by witch law to change you into a boy as you would feel empty without magic." More calmly, Hayley explained. "You would have to do the gender change on your own."

"Which requires magic training." Sighing, you said.

Hayley smiled. "However, when you do change yourself, have a magic phrase or time limit to change yourself back into a girl."

"Why would I do that?" Curious, you asked.

"Magic is almost addictive." Smiling slightly, Hayley said. "Not having it after learning all of its uses can leave you feeling empty." She paused. "Now, about a new name..."

"My name is John." Firmly, you said. "It's the name I'm used to and I'm kind of fond of it." You sighed. "If you can think of a female equivalent then fine."

Hayley giggled. "Okay, Johannah."

You moaned, trying not to giggle but failed miserably. Hayley smiled; she knew she was slowly winning you over though you would never admit it.
13421111122111212211.title: contimue

134211111221112122113.content:
"If I'm going to be called anything, I'd be more comfortable with my middle name." Pouting slightly, you said. "Its something I'm used to and it will be easier to identify myself with it."

You had always hated your middle name, 'Lucy' and had often wondered what possessed mom and dad to give it to you. Now you had a better idea. Hayley smiled gently at you. "I know you are used to being a boy but I can assure you that being a girl is not as bad as you are making it out to be."

"It's not being a girl that's got me all hot and bothered." Honestly, you said. "It's my entire world, my entire life being turned upside down all around me. "I had finally got Megan to be my girlfriend and now we can't have that relationship."

"Mel and Megan are closer than that in their relationship." Politely, Hayley countered. "They are almost literally one person. One will lay her life down to save the other; you can have the same kind of friendship with her as Lucy."

"I don't know." Sighing, you said. "Maybe."

"We all know this is difficult for you, Lucy." Patiently, Hayley said. "Still, fighting it like this is only going to make the transition harder to endure."

"What do you want me to do?" Tearing up, you demanded. "Everything has changed practically overnight; no one should have to go through this!"

"It's something we can't control." Sighing, Hayley said. "I wish you could stay a boy but its not my call to make; only you can make that happen after you are trained."

You sighed yourself, shaking your head. Trying to make sense of everything that had happened thus far was making your head spin. "I guess I have no choice but to take the training if I ever want to be a boy again."

Hayley smiled. "A ten spot says you'll want to stay a girl when you come back."

You turned to Hayley, glaring but you saw that mischievous twinkle in her eye and gave a hick up type laugh before smiling slightly. "You're on."

Days layer, you were all packed and ready to go to Witchbloom for magic training. Mom gave you a hug and told you she was proud of you for not fighting this. You sighed, nodding then turned to Harry and Megan. "Have you two decided?" Dryly, you asked.

Harry and Megan nodded.
134211111221112122113.title: A middle name is still a name.

It turned out that Harry had a twin sister, Sarah, who was kidnapped when she was extremely young. While he could certainly emphasize, things got (understandably) quite heated, though you knew that currently, his relationship with his parents had been patched up.
With Megan, it wasn't quite obvious. She was eager to follow you, though you've uncertain whether its to do the things to you that you'd never allow Mel to do herself. The other thing was that Megan was a cheerleader; a very good one. Without the former head cheerleader's bullying, Megan had really blossomed within the squad. Going to Witchbloom meant giving that up.

"Yes, we're going. Someone has to stop you from getting into trouble" Harry said, a half smirk on his face.

"Have you thought this through? Both of you?"

"Yes. God, you really are a whiner, Lucy" Megan said, shaking her head.

"I don't want either of you to regret this. Harry gets to know what peeing sitting down feels like, and you lose your cheer dream" you countered.

Megan giggled. "When do we see the improved version?" she said, still giggling.
1342111112211121221131.title: Harry and Megan are coming along.

14.content:
Just as you reached over to open the book, your little sister Hannah walked into the house after her latest ballet class. Seeing you with Meg and Harry, she ran over and said, "Hi guys!"

"Hi Hannah, how was ballet?" trying to be friendly, Harry said, "You look nice in that tutu."

You didn't notice Hannah blush when Harry said that; unbeknownst to you Hannah had a sizable crush on Harry. "Thanks, Harry." Spotting the book in your hands, Hannah said, "Hey that's mine!!"

"What?" confused, you said, "I've never seen you with this book before."

"Mommy just gave it to me last week; she made me promise not to lose it." Getting annoyed, Hannah said, "Give it back!"

Knowing how Hannah got when she was annoyed, you quickly gave her the book and said, "Here you go."

As Hannah ran off with the book, which looked a little heavy for her to carry, Harry said, "What do you say we go upstairs and start that project?"

"Sounds like a plan to me."

**********************


Meanwhile, upstairs in her bedroom, Hannah was sitting on the bed with the book in front of her. Still annoyed at John, Hannah wanted to get back at him for the book and for not spending as much time with her as he used to.

With a smile on her face, she opened the book and started looking through the book until she found what she was looking for. Unbeknownst to John and his friends, this was actually a spell book passed down from mother to daughter for generations; because the women of this family were in fact witches.

Looking at the spell in question, with a smile on her face, she said, "You'll be sorry you didn't spend more time with me, John."
After taking a breath to calm down, Hannah looked down at the page and started to recite the spell. "Ut alicui melius, experiri ambulantes ad mille passus calceati."

Down the hall in his bedroom, John was booting up his computer while Harry and Megan poured through history books about World War 2. Just as the computer finished booting up, John was about to say something when he saw a bright flash of light followed by blackness.

**********************


John regained consciousness a short time later; the feel of fabric telling him that he was lying in bed. Slowly opening his eyes, he expected to see Megan and Harry looking down at him; instead he saw the face of a large teddy bear staring at him.

Startled, he screamed in shock and jumped off the bed; only then realizing that his scream sounded a lot different and that he was no longer in his bedroom. Looking around, he found himself in Hannah's bedroom; made obvious by the large of amount of stuffed animals around the room. "What the..."

John stopped when he heard the voice coming from his mouth...it sounded like Hannah's. In a panic, he turned to the mirror and saw Hannah's reflection looking back at him. After a moment of shock in which the reflection copied all of his movements, John screamed at the top of his lungs. "AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!"

It wasn't long before the door opened; as _________________ came running in.

To know someone better; try walking a mile in their shoes

You were still screaming at the top of your lungs when Hayley came rushing in; looking tired after having just coming home from work at the Beach Shack down the road. "What's wrong, Hannah?" with an annoyed look on her face, Hayley said, "Did you see a spider or something?"

"N-no; the-there wasn't a spider!" Regaining your composure slightly, you said, "Hayley; it's me John!"

Either Hayley was in no mood for games, or she simply didn't believe you. "Very funny Hannah; if you were really John I doubt you'd still be wearing that ballerina outfit."

"But it's true!" stammering, you said, "I was in my room working on the project with Harry and Megan; when suddenly I found myself in Hannah's body."

"Stop playing games, Hannah; you're not powerful enough to do a body swap spell."

"Body swap spell?" protesting, unknowingly using the same whiny tone Hannah did when she was annoyed, you said, "I'm not playing games! I'm really John!"

"Hannah listen to me." Sighing, Hayley said, "I know how much you want to do all the things that Mom, Mel and I can do; but you're just not ready for that yet."

After a moment of protest, you realized that Hayley's reaction was entirely justified; there was no way anyone would believe you'd been placed in your 8 year old sister's body. Suddenly you had an idea; if you were in Hannah's body then she was probably in yours. " I want to see...John."

"Sorry kiddo; but he just left to go to the library with Megan and Harry." Sighing, Hayley said, "This project has to be done by next week; and there's no time for him to play with you."

"I'll tell you what; if you get out of the tutu and take a nap, I'll play tea party with you later on."

Realizing that for the time being you were stuck like this with no one believing you, you sighed and said, "Fine."

It wasn't long before Hayley had you out of the tutu and into a pair of Hannah's Disney princess pajamas. Once you were in bed, despite your protests to the contrary, you suddenly felt tired and dozed off.

14222.content:
You wanted to continue protesting before Mel could dress you in one of Hannah's outfits, but you could see it was pointless; she believed you was Hannah. As she walked towards Hannah's wardrobe, you desperately thought of anything that would shock her into believing you.

"Mel. I can tell you what Megan, Harry and I was studying! We..." you started to say. Unfortunately, the door opened, revealing a worried looking Megan. Mel turned from whatever monstrosity she was planning to dress you in, and immediately saw that something was wrong.

'What happened?" Mel asked.

"Its John. He collapsed! We were studying when he collapsed without warning" Megan said, her words disjointed and uncertain.

"Did you check on him?" Mel asked.

"Yes. He is breathing and I checked his pulse. Its perfectly normal, as if he was awake. Harry and I been trying to get him up for the last ten minutes" Megan said.

"I think I know what happened. I've seen this before. Trust me, John will be perfectly fine" Mel said calmly. Neither you nor Megan knew about one of mom's favorite spells, putting someone instantly to sleep, and one that all three of your sisters knew of.

"You're sure?" Megan said hesitantly.

"Positive" Mel said. As she watched as your friends left she had the same cheerful manner, but as soon as Megan and Harry were gone, her mannerisms hardened. "Care to explain yourself, young lady?" Mel hissed.
.
14222.title: What happened to the real Hannah

15.content:
You opened the book to the first page and raised an eyebrow as you found a not that seemed to have been written to you. It read:

'John, if you are reading this it means that you have reached an age where you can see things that were before invisible to you. It is at this point you must make a choice. You must either be true to yourself or take the journey to rediscover yourself. No matter what you choose, you will learn there is far more to you than you could have ever imagined. This is not an easy choice to make, John; you must consider this carefully. My love, always; Mom.'

"That's weird." Shaking your head, you muttered.

"What's up?" Looking over your shoulder, Harry asked. He looked at the book. "It's blank."

You turned to Harry as if he had lost his mind then turned the page to find it filled with letters but they were all in a language you did not understand. What made it more curious was that they seemed familiar somehow like a language you had spoken years ago but had forgotten. "You don't see the words or pictures in this book?" Confused, you asked.

Harry shook his head, chuckling. "You're funny, bro." he said. "It's probably a journal one of your sisters picked up from the mall."

"Yeah... maybe." Closing the book, you said. "I'd better take this to mom. She can find out who it belongs to and give it to her."

You walked down the hall to mom's study; the door was open. You stepped inside to place it on her desk but paused as you spotted a letter from a school you did not recognize. Curious, you looked at it and found that it was a private school inquiry letter with you name on it!

"It looks like Mom is thinking about sending me away, just as she did with Hayley and Mel." Worried, you said. "Only what is this school?"

You looked at the letter again and found that there were two schools offering to accept you due to excellent grades and a 'powerful potential'. One was Witchbloom all girls boarding school and the other was Witchstone all boys boarding school. This only made you more curious as you never heard of either school. Still, you were not about to attend an all girls boarding school, being a boy. Also, you were not sure you were willing to just up and leave as Hayley and Mel did.

Later you decide to question mom in private only when you finally got a moment with her, she did not seem to be in the mood to talk. "I'm sorry, John but I am very busy right now." Patiently, she said. "You may ask me one question but make it quick."

You sighed, frustrated and tried to think of what would be the most important thing to ask mom and finally asked her about...
15.title: A cryptic choice.

151.content:
"I don't have just one question, I have a thousand." Annoyance in your voice, you said. "Let's start with this 'magic book' I found with a note to me, from you in it."

You held up the book open for mom to see the note; she turned slightly pale then took the book from you and placed it onto her desk. "I am a witch, John." Softly, she said. She summoned a flame to her hand to prove it, causing you to jump slightly. "I and your sisters have the power to harness and control the powers of magic."

"What does that have to do with me?" Curious, you asked.

"Only girls have this power." Patiently, mom replied. "You will have this power only if I or one of your sisters change you into a girl." she sighed. "As a boy, you have powerfully enhanced attributes; making you blessed physically."

"Is that why I'm the strongest boy in school?" Your curiosity rising, you asked.

Mom sat down and urged you to do the same before the door to her study closed quietly on its own. "Yes but that is only the tip of the iceberg, John." Smiling, she said. "You will develop incredible physical prowess that will match your sister's magic."

You smiled but it flattened with mom's frown. "As a twin to a witch, you may fall under a condition known as the twin factor which means you will change into a girl and a witch to match your sister to form a balance." Serious, she explained. "As you go into training for your physical powers, Mel stands the risk of changing into a boy to make the same balance."

"Ouch..." Wincing, you said. "I'd hate to know I was responsible for her being a boy for life."

Mom let out a low giggle. "Mel basically said the same thing only she would not mind having 'girl John' around for a few weeks." she said. She then turned serious. "There are two leading schools for the witch community; one for the boys and one for the girls. Both have been sending inquiries, hoping to entice you to sign up to their school."

"I see..." remembering the inquiry letters, you said. "What do you think I should do?"

Mom sighed, rising to her feet. "All I ask is that you trust me." Serious, she said. "I was heading out for some recreation; would you care to join me?"

"Sure." Smiling, you said.

Before you knew what was happening, mom cast a spell, changing your...
151.title: The note in the magic book.

1512.content:
"Mom! What are you doing to me!?" Startled, you asked. "I'm shrinking!"

"No, you are getting younger." Serious, mom corrected. "Again, all I ask is that you trust me."

"Why are you making me younger?" Pouting, you asked.

"Remember what I said about that twin factor?" Looking at you, mom asked. You nodded. "Well, as a younger person, that will not effect you."

"Is this the recreation you were talking about?" Seeing you were now about six years old, you asked.

"Only part of it." Smiling, mom replied. "I am going to visit the two schools I had mentioned. You need to be a girl to enter Witchbloom grounds and being a teen girl would be too risky for you."

"So you regressed my age so I have a better chance of being a boy again when we get back home." Guessing correctly, you said. "I see..."

"None of this is personal... Lucy." With a giggle, mom said. "Just try to be patient with me for a little while so I can sort out this business."

Albeit reluctantly, you agreed. Mom smiled. "Thank you, Lucy." she said. "Which school would you like to visit first? Witchstone all boys boarding school or Witchbloom all girls school where Hayley and Mel spent a year learning magic?"

Which do you choose?
1512.title: age. (younger)

15122.content:
"I'm not sure I want to visit either one." Wincing, you said. "Can't I just be a regular guy?"

Mom smiled. "You are not the first boy born in a witch family to feel this way, John." Gently, she said. "Why don't we visit Witchbloom first; it will answer a lot of your questions."

"Didn't you say I'd have to be a girl to visit there?" Nervous, you asked.

"Mom nodded, waving her hand. "It's already taken care of... Lucy." Giggling at the end, she said.

You looked down and let out a short scream seeing that you were now a little girl in a pink dress and black mary janes. "Mom!"

"It's only for a short while." Smiling, mom said. "Please trust me."

You sighed. "I do trust you mom." Whining slightly, you said. "Just go easy on the surprises, okay?"

Mom giggled then opened the door to her study. "I'll try."

With that, you reluctantly followed mom to the car. The drive to Witchbloom was a long one; it took nearly a half hour to reach the school where mom pulled into a visitor's parking space and stepped out where she and you were greeted by a young professionally dressed woman.

"Welcome to Witchbloom, Ms Harrison." Smiling the woman said. "Did you convince John to attend here as a student?"

"It's good to see you again, Rikki." Smiling mom replied. "John is just visiting. I want him to make his own decision regarding his training."

Rikki smiled. "Of course." Politely, she said. "I would be happy to give 'her' the grand tour."

"I'll be going along." Firmly but kindly, mom said. "Lucy just discovered magic; she's a bit jumpy as it is right now."

"This way then." motioning them to follow, Rikki said.
15122.title: Witchbloom.

151221.content:
"Are you not forgetting something?" Sternly, mom asked.

Rikki produced a bracelet with a number of multicolored flowers; it looked like something Hannah would wear while playing dress up. "This bracelet is enchanted to keep you from becoming magically enrolled in this school." Placing it onto your wrist, she said. "You will only become enrolled if you willingly take it off yourself so keep it on until you are well off school grounds."

"Thanks for telling me." Looking at the bracelet, you said.

Mom sighed. "This is just a tour, Lucy." Patiently, she said. "I want you to see what both schools offer before you make any decisions."

With that said, Rikki lead you and mom to the first classroom where the teacher was teaching simple mathematics to a class of students. Seeing this confused you as you thought the school taught girls how to control magic.

"Magic and potion making is an exact art." Whispering, Rikki explained. "Mathematics plays a very important role; it is crucial that all witches know their math well and the best way to make certain of that is to start at the beginning."

"That makes sense." Smiling slightly, you said. "I mean you would not want to make anything too weak or worse too powerful, it may hurt someone."

"I'm so glad you understand, Lucy." Smiling, mom whispered. "This is why Hayley and Mel needed to be away for a year. Reckless use of magic is dangerous."

"Both boys and girls come to this school to learn magic." Smiling, Rikki said. "For the girls, it is a requirement but for the boys it is a chance to feel closer to their sisters and experience magic."

"Some boys who come here decide to remain girls for the rest of their lives." Chiming in, mom added. "However, they must make the choice out of their own free will."

"Is that why you and my sisters kept this from me for so long?" Curious, you asked.

"Part of it." Sighing, mom said. "I know how curious you are; I did not want your sisters to be tempted to sway your decision one way or the other."

You nodded then followed mom and Rikki as they moved on to another room where the teacher was demonstrating a simple spell. She summoned a small flame to her hand and caused it to change into the form of a horse that galloped around the room to the surprise and delight of the students. From the hall, you watched in wonder as the teacher took notice of you and sent the fiery horse running to you. It galloped around your head then neighed before vanishing. Your eyes were wide and filled with a childish wonder as you turned to the smiling teacher. "That was cool!" Whispering, you said.

"That is called a summoning spell." Politely, the teacher said. "I am Lucy Connor; welcome to Witchbloom all girls boarding school... Miss Harrison."

"Miss Connor taught Hayley and then Mel during their year here, Lucy." Smiling, mom said. "If you choose to attend here, she will be your teacher as well."

"Would you like to try that spell... Lucy?" Motioning you to enter, Lucy asked. "It's quite simple, once you know how to do it."

What do you do?
151221.title: The grand tour.

1512211.content:
"Will I still be a boy when I leave here?" Wincing, you asked.

"Trying a simple spell will not trap you as a girl." Smiling, Lucy replied. "Also, so long as you are wearing that bracelet, you are just a visitor."

You turned to mom, who nodded, then stepped into the classroom where Lucy had you face the class of all girls who smiled politely at you. "First, relax." Instructing you, Lucy said. "Close your eyes and find your center."

"You mean like in Yoga?" Closing your eyes, you asked.

"Something like that." Giggling, Lucy said. "Have you found your center?" You nodded and Lucy smiled. "Raise your hand as I had and try to visualize a harmless flame burning in your palm."

You tried to visualize a flame in your hand and was surprised when you heard gasps from the class. Upon opening your eyes, you saw that a harmless flame was burning in your hand. "I did it!" Smiling, you said. "That's cool!"

"That's just the first part." Patiently, Lucy said. "Now try to visualize the flame as a horse and make it gallop around the room."

You concentrated on the light blue flame in your hand but jumped as the flame suddenly got bigger and full sized fiery horse appeared next to you. It neighed then ran between the desks of the startled girls before it dispersed and vanished upon hitting the wall. "That was unexpected." Catching your breath, you said.

You felt tired, drained but that was nothing compared to your surprise. You jumped when Lucy placed a gentle hand onto your shoulder. "Lucy is a twin to a witch." Speaking to her stunned class, she said. "As such, her magical potential is much stronger than usual. Her sister also had a very strong magical potential only it was harder for her to control as Lucy here was a boy at the time."

"So I have magic as a girl?" Curious, you asked.

Lucy nodded, smiling. "Yes, you will." Politely, she said. "However, it must be your choice to want magic before we can train you." She shook her head. "It is unwise for a witch boy to toy with magic if he does not wish to be a girl for life."

With that, you were excused from the class and Rikki asked, "Would you like to see more of the school or have you sen enough?"

What do you say?
1512211.title: Agree to try the spell.

15122111.content:
"What happens if I want to learn magic?" Curious, you asked. "Do I have to stay a girl for life?"

"It is ill advised for a transformed boy to learn magic." Serious, mom replied. "They will be tempted to want to use it again and again, trapping themselves as a girl when that is not what they really want."

"So the answer is yes." Wincing, you said. "That is a lot to think about."

"Do you want to see more of what magic can offer?" Motioning to the hall ahead, Rikki asked. "I'm certain you would want to know all the facts before making such a life changing decision."

You turned to mom who shrugged. "It's your life, Lucy." Honestly, she said. "It has to be your choice, not mine or anyone else."

You smiled slightly. "You do trust me." Softly, you said.

Mom nodded. "I trust you are old enough to make some of your own decisions." Firmly but kindly, she corrected. "All I can do is hope I have raised you well enough to make them wisely."

Your smile widened slightly before offering your hand. "I'd like to learn more about magic before I make any decisions." Politely, you said. "It's best to get all the facts."

Mom took your hand, smiling. "I agree."

15122111.title: You want to see more.

151221112.content:
"Miss Harrison is just as powerful as her twin sister." Frowning, Rikki thought. "Witchstone would certainly try their best to interest 'him' in enrolling. I must find a way to peak her curiosity."

She looked at the various classes but they were all teaching the same lessons as Lucy's class; none of them were moving on to more advanced magic. Getting an idea, she led you and mom to the office of the Dean where she politely knocked. "Ms Tonya Garrison, I have brought a curious boy with 'her' mother."

"Enter." After a pause, a strong woman said.

Rikki opened the door and led you in with mom following to a large well furnished room with a huge oak desk on the opposite side. There, sitting in a comfortable chair was an Amazon of a woman with long black hair and blue eyes. She was professionally dressed in a woman's business suit but you could tell she was just as strong physically as she was magically. " Please allow me to introduce Ms Harrison and her 'daughter' Lucy." Smiling, Rikki said.

"Ah, Ms Harrison." Smiling, Tonya said. "It's so good to see you again. I take it your 'daughter' has reached her curious age."

"Yes, she has." Smiling back, mom replied. "She shows Mel's same potential but is slightly frightened by it all; I can't blame her."

"Magic is a powerful tool, Miss Harrison." Turning to you, Tonya said. "It is not anything to take lightly so I am pleased that you are a bit unnerved by your power; it means you will not abuse it."

"What does the other school teach?" Curious, you asked. "What power do boys have?"

"Boys do not have magical powers." Serious, Tonya said. "They do possess incredible physical prowess of which requires training to control." Pausing, she added, "It would seem strange if a young boy suddenly gained the prowess of an adult Olympian athlete."

"That would be unusual." Wincing, you agreed.

"That was the reason Witchstone was established." Smiling again, Tonya replied. "Boys in witch families deal with outside threats from the non-magical community."

"So witches are not forced to reveal their secret powers." Catching on, you said. "I see."

"There is a balance in witch families, Lucy." Chiming in, mom said. "We did not tell you of this until now because of new laws that prevent rifts from opening in witch families."

"Before, witches were permitted to 'toy' with their brothers so to help them gain a resistance to magic in order to protect them." Taking over the conversation, Tonya said. "However, there were growing cases where the witch boy completely lost his temper and seriously injured his siblings or mother before he even realized his sudden increase in strength and speed."

"As such, it is now frowned upon for witches to use magic against their brothers or boyfriends until they discover the magic for themselves." Serious, Rikki added. "After that, it comes down to a choice for them; magic or muscle."

"I take it that its frowned upon for a witch boy to use his increased physical prowess to win at sports or to stand up to a bully." Serious, you said.

"It would be the same as a witch using her magic for similar reasons." Firmly but kindly, Tonya said. "Now, to the point of your visit, what do you make of magic so far?"

You smiled. "It's certainly peaked my curiosity." Politely, you replied. "Still, I like to be me."

"Being a girl would not change who you are, just how you view others and they view you." Smiling, Rikki said. "In my humble opinion, being a girl is much better than being a boy."

"Have you ever been a boy?" Curious, you asked.

Rikki frowned, causing Tonya and mom to giggle slightly before Tonya then spoke up. "I would like to leave you with some literature about our school for you to read." Picking up some papers, she said. "After you visit Witchstone, I would like you to consider enrolling into our school." she then gave you a rueful look. "I know how lonely it can be as the only boy in the family as I am the only girl in my family. Please think about it; magic does carry its own rewards."

After leaving Witchbloom, mom instructed you to remove the bracelet before she changed you back to your male form. You looked at yourself and frowned. "Why am I still only six?" Annoyed, you asked.

"For the same reason you were six at Witchbloom." Firmly but kindly, mom replied. "So to better control your powers while you visit the school."
151221112.title: Magic or Muscle.

1512211121.content:
The drive to Witchstone was long and silent. Mom seemed tense about taking you there. When you asked her why she sighed. "Witchstone is a new school, John." Softly, she replied. "They have no real credentials, nothing concrete that proves their teachings help witch boys."

"Then why are we going there?" Wincing, you asked.

"Because there is nothing concrete that they make the lives of witch boys worse either." Managing a smile, mom replied. "I can not force you to attend Witchbloom unless you tell me that you want to be a girl and a witch."

"Only I have to attend one of the two schools for training." Worried, you said.

"That's right." Flatly, mom said. She then smiled again. "Fortunately, this is just a visit."

You smiled back but you sensed that mom was still feeling uneasy. "What would you have done, if it were up to you, mom?" Looking at her, you asked.

"You would be taking classes at Witchbloom." Serious, mom replied. "I'm sure Witchstone is a good school and only has the well being of witch boys in mind but I do not feel comfortable leaving you in a place I know very little about."

Upon arriving at Witchstone, you and mom were greeted by a towering man in a business suit. You recognized him as your grandfather, Moriarty Strange. "Welcome, Natalie." With a warm smile, Moriarty said. "I see John has reached that curious age."

"Yes, dad." Managing a smile, mom replied. "He has."

Moriarty sighed. "You know I am not permitted to try to sway your son one way or the other." Patiently, he said. "I am here to offer you two a tour of the school and show you what we teach."

"Lead the way, dad." Calmly, mom said.

Moriarty nodded and lead you and mom into the building. "First of all, Witch boys have heightened everything." Motioning to a large room, he said. "Attributes, senses, reflexes, everything physical and mental is enhanced."

"That's incredible." Surprised, you said. "How far are they enhanced?"

"Nothing that you would categorize as a 'super power', I assure you." Smiling, Moriarty replied. "Witch girls can summon the same abilities with their magic but it comes naturally to the boys."

"Magic or muscle..." Mussing, you muttered. "That is how Rikki at Witchbloom put it."

"That is the choice that faces you at this moment, John." Serious, Moriarty said. "As a trained witch boy, you can defend your family and friends from any non-magical threat that falls upon them."

"Can I face a bad witch?" Curious, you asked.

"That is where your sisters and I come into play." Firmly but kindly, mom replied. "As strong and fast as you are, you will never be a match for a fully trained witch in a head to head duel."

"This school does not teach you how to fight witches." Serious, Moriarty said. "We teach you how to control your heightened physical prowess so you do not accidentally injure someone."
