He sighed, his face softening. "The witch community has its own law enforcement, you need not worry about facing any magical threat."

"What is the first thing they teach you?" Changing the subject, you asked.

Moriarty opened his hand, producing a glowing ball of energy the size of a bowling ball! It hovered and spun over his palm. "This is called a witch boy's 'spark'." Smiling, he said. "This is their physical power personified into energy; a witch can gauge how physically strong a witch boy is by the size of their spark." He chuckled. "As you can see, I'm fairly strong."

Curious, you opened your hand and tried to produce a spark as you were instructed to produce a flame at witchbloom. What appeared was a sphere the size of a baseball. Seeing it, Moriarty smiled. "Is is a good thing?" Confused, you asked.

"Well, it shows that you are very strong, considering you just discovered magic a short time ago." Calmly, Moriarty said. "I can give you a tour of our classes or I can give you some literature to take home; its your choice."

You turned to mom and noticed that she still seemed uneasy. You decided to...
1512211121.title: A visit to Witchstone.

15122111211.content:
"Mom, the best way to know more about the school is to take the tour." Gently, you said. "As you said, this is just a visit."

Mom sighed and turned to you with a more genuine smile. "You are right, John." Softly, she said. "Perhaps this tour will prove beneficial."

Moriarty smiled. "This way, then."

After canceling your spark, he led you and mom out of the meeting room into the first class where a female teacher paused in the middle of a lecture. "Dean Moriarty?" Curious, she asked.

"Forgive the intrusion, Miss Tanner." Politely, Moriarty said. "I am merely conducting a tour for my daughter, and her son, John. They are both a bit uncertain of what we teach here."

Tanner smiled. "Well, Ms Harrison, we teach witch boys how to control their own powers without injuring anyone; especially those they hold dear." Kindly, she said. "Boys in witch families do not have magic but their enhanced physical forms more than compensate for that."

"Why are boys not told until they learn about magic on their own?" Curious, you asked.

"That is an excellent question, Mr Harrison." Smiling, Tanner replied. "You see... and I mean no offense when I say this... boys mature more slowly than girls and they tend to be more aggressive in nature so it is important that they are trained at a later age when they gain some maturity and are less likely to use their gifts out of anger."

"I was told that witch boys deal with non-magical threats." Still curious, you said.

"That was what I was explaining here." Motioning to her class, Tanner said. "Please, take a seat and you can listen in."

Uncertain, you walked into the class and took a seat at a desk marked 'visitor' near the teacher's desk while mom and Moriarty watched from the door. "The witch community is a very secretive group." Turning to her class, Tanner began. "If our existence were to be exposed, there will be people who will attempt to make use of us for their own selfish ends. This is the same for both the girls and the boys; you can imagine how some groups would make use of 'super soldiers'."

You and the boys in the room shuddered as Tanner continued her lecture.

"The boys in witch families deal with burglars, bullies, nosy neighbors, and so on." Firmly, Tanner continued. "Each case is different and each are handled in various ways. The point is, boys in witch families are the guardians of their family secret." She smiled. "With a mere glare, witch boys can send a chill down the spine of a non-magical man. It is not magic, it is all confidence."

You raised your hand and she nodded, allowing you to speak. "It would be wise not to mistake confidence with arrogance." Politely, you said. "Even the strongest of men can be taken down by someone half their size, if taken off guard."

"Very good, Mr Harrison." Smiling, Tanner said. "You are correct. Witches learn very quickly in their training that they are not invincible merely because they have magic. Witch boys will learn the same lesson; massive muscle does not equal invulnerability."

After leaving the class, Moriarty took you and mom to another room where a boy was blindfolded while three other boys were swinging wooded staffs at him. Your first instinct was to run in and defend the blindfolded boy but you paused as he blocked each and every swing with a wooded staff of his own.

"Enough." Firmly, a female voice instructed.

The boys stopped and the other removed his blindfold as a short, plump woman came into view, smiling. "That was incredible, Miss Rave." Happily, the boy said. "I could hear the staffs moving through the air when they swung them."

"Witch boys have enhanced senses as well as enhanced attributes." Firmly but kindly, Miss Rave said. "Just remember that witch girls can summon the same skills."

"So witches are still better than us?" Pouting, the boy asked.

"No! No!" Giggling, Miss Rave replied. "Witch girls are blessed with magic, a powerful tool. True, they can do many things you can not but you are blessed as well." She paused, seeing you and smiled as she turned back to her student. "Witch boys can see and hear things before a witch girl is even aware it is there. They have an awareness that magic can not summon; that is why they are the guardians of their families."

The boy smiled at that. "Thank you. Miss Rave." he said.

"Why are there only female teachers here?" Curious, you asked.

"That is simple, young man." Walking up to you, Miss Rave said. "A witch teacher can better control a class of rowdy boys if they get out of hand. Also, this is a very new school, there are not too many properly trained men to take the position of teacher."

"Before, it was the mother's duty to train their sons in the use of their enhanced strength." Frowning, mom said. "However, witch boys and witch girls require different approaches to training..."

"So its hard to balance the two." Sighing, you said. "I see."

"It was thought that making the boy a girl would give that boy a sense of participation." Patiently, Miss Rave said. "However, it did not teach that boy how to control his strength or to work against his instincts to gain revenge for being 'violated', being toyed with for his family's 'amusement'."

"There is nothing amusing about it." Almost sadly, mom said. "It was all thought to help the boy gain resistance to magic and feel as if he belonged."

You nodded. "I understand." Softly, you said. "I think I have seen enough."

Moriarty nodded. "Very good then." Smiling, he said. "If you will follow me to my office, I will hand you some literature to pour over to help you with your decision."

Twenty minutes later, you were back on the road with mom on the way home. "So what do you make of Witchstone school?" Curious, mom asked.

"Its okay, I guess." Shrugging, you said. "Only a lot of what they are offering I already know."

"Your father taught you a lot of that." Smiling, mom said. "He was pushing for that school to be built before he passed away."

"Is that why you did not want to go there?" Tearing up, you asked. "It reminded you of dad?"

Mom nodded. "I see a lot of your father in that school." wiping a tear from her eye, mom said. "He would be proud to see you go there but I would miss you the entire year and when you got back..."

"I'd be too much like dad." Whispering, you finished. Mom nodded. "I see..."

At home, you...
15122111211.title: take the tour.

151221112111.content:
You knocked on the door of your eldest sister's room. Moments later, Hayley answered and allowed you inside before closing the door. "I had a feeling you would want to talk to me, John." Offering you a seat, she said. "The choice that faces you is not an easy one."

"Hayley, I don't know what to do." Frustrated, you said. "I am curious about magic and the idea of going to Witch bloom seems to make mom happy but I want to be me." You sighed then added, "Only the idea of me going to Witchstone seems to make mom sad as she fears I would come back too much like dad."

"Did she seem against you going to Witchstone?" Raising an eyebrow, Hayley asked.

"Mom told me it was my decision but I got the impression she did not like the idea of me going to the all boys boarding school." Frowning, you replied. "There seemed to be some tension between her and grandpa Moriarty."

Hayley sighed. "Grandpa Moriarty has been trying to set up an all boy 'police' academy." Shaking her head, she explained. "Grandma Elvira is dead set against it because of the dangers that would face the boys in that line of work."

"She believes that it would be better the girls with magic handle that." Guessing correctly, you said.

"Exactly." Serious, Hayley said. "He won't try to recruit anyone until he gets approval, his word is his bond, but that is where the tension comes from."

"I see..."

"Back to the matter at hand, my advice is simple; take a six month course at Witchbloom then decide if you wish to continue or finish your training at Witchstone."

"I thought you had to have a full year of training at one school or the other." Taken back, you said.

"Dad started that school." Smiling, Hayley said. "You already got your one year of training from him; you just do not have a 'diploma' to prove it."

"So you think I should start at Witchbloom?" Curious, you asked.

Hayley nodded. "Make mom happy by going there then see what makes you happy in the end."

After a thought, you smiled and gave Hayley a warm hug. "Thanks, sis. I'll do that."
151221112111.title: asked your sister for advice.

choices: That is Melody's decision, not mine.
1512211121112.content:
Less than an hour after talking to mom, you were a little girl again and on the road to Witchbloom all girls boarding school. "I'm very happy that you decided to attend Witchbloom." Smiling, mom said. "I promise you that you made the right choice."

"Time will tell, mom." Sighing, you said. "I'm still a bit nervous."

"It's only for six months... Melody." Mom giggled. "Why did you choose that name?"

You blushed slightly. "Hannah suggested it and it seemed to fit." Shrugging, you replied. "Now Melanie and I are the 'Mel' twins." You managed a giggle.

Mom smiled. "Just remember to be yourself even though you are now a girl." she said. "I know a few things will be uncomfortable for you but think of it all as being part of the package."

"I'll try, mom." With a patient smile, you said.

"Good girl."

Upon arriving at Witchbloom, you were greeted by Rikki who smiled at you. "Welcome back, Miss Harrison; I'm pleased to see you chose to enroll here." she paused. "May I ask what name you have chosen for yourself?"

"Melody." Blushing, you said.

"That is a beautiful name." Smiling, Rikki said. She turned to mom. "Will your daughter be staying for the full year or the introductory six month tour?"

Mom smiled and replied....
1512211121112.title: Arriving at Witchbloom.

choices: Grandma Elvira comes to greet you.
15122111211123.content:
"You know very well that this is Melody's decision, Rikki." Firmly but kindly, mom said. "I'm just happy she decided to start here."

"I'll be here for six moths then decide from there, ma'am." Kindly, you said. "I got a lot of physical training from my dad before I knew magic even existed."

"I can see that, even through your young female form." Smiling, Rikki said. "All the paperwork is done so I will just escort you to your dorm where you will meet your fellow students."

You turned around, giving mom a hug. "I'll see you is a few months, mom." Smiling slightly, you said. "Don't worry about me, I'll be okay."

"I know you will, Melody." Smiling back, mom said. "I'll call to check on you over the weekend."

With that said, mom walked back to her car while you followed Rikki with your bags to your new home for the next six weeks.
15122111211123.title: That is Melody's decision, not mine.

151221112111232.content:
As Rikki lead you down the hall to the dorm rooms, you saw a familiar face. It was your grandmother, Elvira Strange. She was tall and slender with long black hair and piercing green eyes. She smiled kindly as she saw you. "Hello, John... or rather, Melody." Kindly, she said. "I am pleased to see you have decided to learn magic like your sisters."

"How did you recognize me?" Surprised, you asked.

Elvira giggled. "Every witch has a distinct magical signature." Simply, she replied. "They are like fingerprints; I knew your magical signature even as a boy, Melody."

"Boys have magic too?" Confused, you asked.

"Well, yes and no." Smiling, Rikki said. "Boys in witch families have magic but it is physical in nature. As a girl, that magic becomes like an energy you can use to work magic."

"The reason I have come to you is there has been a change in your dorm room assignment." Turning serious, Elvira said. "You will be attending the A-1 class."

Rikki gasped. "Madam head witch, is that wise?" Concerned, she asked. "Melody is only here for the six month trial period."

"By the end of the six months, I will know for certain if she is up for the job." Remaining serious, Elvira replied. "You will take Melody to the A-1 class immediately, Rikki."

"What are you two talking about?" Becoming worried, you asked.

"Some students who come here show incredible talent." Looking at you, Elvira said. "Both Hayley and Melanie showed great promise. You show that same promise so you will attend the same class they did and we will see if you are up for the job."

"What job?" Curious, you asked.

"It's nothing for you to worry about right now, dear." Lightly, Elvira said. "Just focus on your studies and let us worry about the job you may or may not be offered later."

With that, Rikki led you to the A-1 dorms.
151221112111232.title: Grandma Elvira comes to greet you.

1512211121112321.content:
A-1 class was in the center most building on campus. What worried you the most was that it was not built like the other dorms; it looked more like a fortress with reenforced concrete walls, security block windows, and heavy steel doors. You gulped, taking it all in and began to seriously worry.

"It looks better on the inside." Wincing, Rikki said. She smiled. "The building is made strong to contain the higher levels of magic you and your classmates possess."

"If you say so." Worried, you said.

Rikki lead you inside the structure where you found it to be cozy but a bit creepy on the inside. All of the walls were a calming pastel pink with a number of pictures with beautiful landscapes. The furniture was all wood but seemed to shine with an almost unnatural glow. From the ceiling, you heard a calming tune being played from speakers every ten to twelve feet in every hall. "What is with the anger therapy atmosphere?" Curious, you asked.

"Anger therapy, that's a new one." Giggling, a girl said. "You must be Melody."

You turned to see a tall, slender girl no older than you. She smiled, tossing her long jet black hair aside, revealing her fire hazel eyes. "I'm Laura; its a pleasure to meet you."

"Likewise." Politely, you said. "I was told I have a lot of potential."

"Everyone in this class has a lot of potential." Smiling, Laura said. "However, only a few are told what this mystery job is when we graduate in a year. Those who are told are forbidden to tell anyone else."

"Who are you talking to, Laura?" Entering the hall, another girl asked.

"The new student, Melody just walked in, Terri." Turning to the second girl, Laura replied. "She's pretty cute for once being a boy."

You blushed at that as Terri stifled a giggle. She was three inches shorter than Laura but well built with shoulder length fire red hair and deep blue eyes that seemed to have a glow of their own. "Don't worry; Melody." Lightly, she said. "Gender and age are rather fluidic when it comes to witchcraft."

"Well, I can see you are already in good hands." Walking to the door, Rikki said. "I'll leave you two girls to introduce Melody to the rest of your class before your teacher arrives."

With that, she left, pushing the steel door closed with a low grunt. You shivered slightly, hearing the clang and click of the door locking. "Why are we locked in?" Tearing up, you asked.

"The lock is not to keep us in, Melody." Serious, Laura replied. "It's to keep curious witches out so they are not harmed by our power."

A tiny frail white haired girl with ice blue eyes and freckles peeked out from a doorway. "Is- Is there a prob-problem?" Shaking, she asked. "Should I hide?"

"No, No, Ann." Giggling, Terri said. "We're just welcoming out new student, Melody."

You gave Ann a shy wave hi, which she returned and rewarded you with a small grin. "She seems to be nice, just a little shy."

"She is scared of her powers." Serious, another girl stated.

You spun around to see a tall and slender girl with long auburn hair and brown eyes staring you down. "I'm certain you know this feeling."

You nodded then turned back the the girl. "Yeah, I know this feeling but as a boy."
1512211121112321.title: Meeting your dorm mates.

15122111211123211.content:
"I'm sure you were told of the muscle and magic balance in witch families." Smiling slightly, the girl said. "My name is Emilia. Ann is my adopted sister; she is a first witch."

"A first witch?" Curious, you asked.

Emilia nodded. "A first witch is a girl born into a non witch family, the first of her bloodline." Glancing at Ann, she said. "Only she is a remarkable case as her power placed her into A-1 class with me."

"I can see how that would be unnerving." Wincing, you said.

"It would be like you discovering your enhanced physical prowess before the age of ten." Chiming in, Laura said. "It would frighten you just as much."

You nodded. "Do any of you know what we will be learning here?"

"You will be learning magic, just like the other students." Startling everyone, a powerful voice replied.

Everyone turned to see an Amazon of a woman with long black hair and deep blue eyes. "I am Viva Veronica, your teacher for this year." Introducing herself, she said. "You may call me Miss V."

"I'm only here for a six moth trial period." Wincing, you said.

Viva smiled patiently. "That will be honored, I assure you." Gently, she replied. "The reason you are here is because of the high level of your magic."

"So what are we going to learn first?" Curious, you asked.

"We will first discuss patience." Motioning to a number of comfortable seats, Viva said. "With any great power, magic or muscle, comes great responsibility. Those who overstep their bounds will be stripped of their power. This includes the power of physical strength."
15122111211123211.title: continue.

choices: alerted the others of the prank.
151221112111232111.content:
"The first thing you all need to understand is that, as a girl, strong emotion augments magic." Serious, Viva said. She turned to you. "The same applies for the strength of a witch boy; the angrier they are, the stronger and more dangerous they become."

You gulped at that. "Is that why I'm the strongest boy in my school?" Worried, you asked.

"It is why John is the strongest boy in the state, Melody." Calmly, Viva replied. "This is why your sisters were forbidden to use their magic against you a year after discovering their powers."

"Mom feared I would retaliate physically..." Horrified, you muttered.

"No one knows how a witch boy would react to magic being used against them." Gently, Viva said. "Your mother was more concerned about you being tempted to use magic; your physical strength as a boy mirrors your magical power as a witch."

"That's why I'm scared of my magic." Shaking, Anna said. "I- I might hurt someone or worse without even knowing it."

"That is why you are here, Anna." Smiling, Viva said. "It is why you are all here, to learn how to use your powers wisely." She sighed, gathering her thoughts. "You need to keep your wits about you and remain patient when dealing with others whose powers are significantly less than your own."

"No matter how annoying they might be." Smiling, Emilia said.

Viva nodded. "Exactly. Now, there are several ways to help yourself maintain your patience; we will discuss this throughout your time here in my class."

Viva giggled then summoned a huge bubble of water over the class. Seeing it, you...
151221112111232111.title: A talk about patience.

155.content:
You sighed and asked, "Is there any way I can help you, mom?"

Mom smiled slightly, her face softening. "Well, you can help by running a few errands for me in town." Kindly, she said. "You can take Hayley with you for company."

"Why can't I just take Harry with me?" Curious, you asked.

"You'll be in the mall for hours with his hobby of shopping for antiques." Smiling, mom replied. "With Hayley, you can get in and out in half the time."

"Okay." Shrugging, you said. "Do you have a list of things you need.?"

Mom nodded and gave you a hand written list of items. You read it then threw her a curious glance. "These are some rather strange things to buy." Raising an eyebrow, you stated.

"It's all for a project Hayley and I are working on." Lightly, mom said. "Maybe we'll let you help."

You placed the paper into your pocket then turned to find Hayley waiting for you. "Are you sure you want John in on this?" Wincing, she asked. "Gardening is not his strong suit."

"I want John to have a sense of participation in our... skills and interests." Serious, mom said. "We had kept him in the dark long enough."

"What are you talking about?" Worried, you asked.

"It's a girl thing." Smiling, mom said. "You are not afraid to get in touch with your feminine side, are you, John?"

"Well, no." Confused, you asked.

Mom giggled. "Good. Now be a nice lad and get those items for me."

Hayley smiled, taking you by the arm. "Come on, sis... I mean bro. Let's go to the mall."
155.title: How you could help her.

choices: Insist to pay for the spoon.
1551.content:
Twenty minutes later, you and Hayley stepped off the bus and walked into the gardening section of the mall where she began to pick out a number of odd herbs and plants. "What exactly are you and mom making in this garden of yours?" Curious, you asked. "I didn't even know you had a garden."

"Home remedies, mostly." Lightly, Hayley replied. "There is more to it but you will want to take things slow as there is a lot to take in."

"Mom said it was a girl thing." Wincing, you said. "I don't mind garden work."

"As I said, there is more to it, John." Smiling, Hayley said. "You'll understand more once you get into what we are doing."

You sighed and shrugged then looked at the list mom gave you. "We only have a one more item to get; an all oak stirring spoon." You raised an eyebrow. "Why does it have to be oak?"

"Anything else would ruin the taste." Simply, Hayley replied. "Don't worry, none of it made any sense to me when I first started either."

"Where are we going to find an all oak stirring spoon?" Curious, you asked.

Hayley frowned slightly. "From Forester's antiques."

"I thought mom didn't want any of us anywhere near aunt Samantha." Worried, you said.

"She had a falling out with the family years ago." Sighing, Hayley said. "I'll get the stirring spoon, you just wait out in the hall."

You followed your sister out of the gardening section to Forester's store where she motioned you to wait in the main hall. "I'll only be a minute." Quickly, she said.

"I'm not letting you go in there alone, sis." Firmly, you said. "Mom does not want anyone alone with that woman, you know that."

Hayley sighed. "Okay, you can come with me but don't touch anything." Sternly, she ordered. "Also, whatever you do, don't accept anything from that woman, she is nothing but trouble."

With that, you and Hayley walked into the store where a tall young woman was standing near the cash register. She had long red hair and cold calculating fire hazel eyes. Just looking at her gave you chills as she seemed focused on your every move.

"Welcome to my humble store, Hayley." Sweetly, she said. "What can I offer you today?"

"All oak stirring spoon." Flatly, Hayley said.

Samantha's eyed your purchases from the gardening section and nodded. "I see..." Grinning, she said. "Are you and your mother planning to let John in on your family business?"

"Family business?" Curious, you asked.

"That is not your concern." Serious, Hayley replied. "Please retrieve the all oak stirring spoon so we may make our purchase and return home."

Samantha threw you a mischievous grin that made you shiver before slipping behind a curtain to the back room. "She gives me the creeps." Frowning, you whispered.

"You don't know the half of it." Serious, Hayley whispered back. "For your sake, I suggest you don't pry; its not a pretty story."

You nodded then turned to see Samantha return with a long wooden spoon. "Will this spoon suit your purposes, Hayley?" Politely, she asked.

Hayley examined the spoon and nodded. "Yes, that will do nicely."

Samantha nodded then wrapped the spoon in a neat long box before handing it to you. "Here you go, young man." Smiling, she said. "This purchase is on me. Consider it a peace offering."

You half raised your hand to accept the box but hesitated, remembering Hayley's warning not to accept anything from her.

What do you do?
1551.title: Taking things slow.

choices: You only have a few days.
There is no real way to tell.
15513.content:
Hayley took the package before the situation could turn awkward. "Thank you for the peace offering, aunt Samantha; it is appreciated.." Politely, she said. "However, John is unaccustomed to our ways. I do not want him to inadvertently insult you."

"Huh?" Confused, you asked.

Hayley placed the package into the bag with the rest of the purchases then grabbed your arm. As she led you out of the store, she whispered, "We are all part of an order that has strict rules of conduct."

"You mean like a secret society?" Wincing, you asked.

Hayley giggled slightly. "Something like that but its no where near what you are thinking." Amused, she replied. "I know your love for science fiction and mystery; we are not some kind of cult."

"Then exactly what are you and mom involved in?" Worried, you asked. "It's got to be something big to keep it from me all this time."

"As I said, you will learn of it one step at a time." Serious, Hayley said. "If I told you everything now, you would likely not believe it and proving it would blow even your mind."

You gulped at that. "It sounds serious."

"Well, yes; it is serious." Reluctantly, Hayley admitted. "Just not as much as you might fear." She sighed at your inquisitive expression. "Please just trust us, John. Its best if we take you in one step at a time; we had to do the same with Mel and Hannah will be even more difficult than you."

"So Hannah doesn't know either?" Curious, you asked.

"She's too young to grasp what we are doing, John." Darkly, Hayley said. "Even if she did understand, she is not yet mature enough to take the responsibilities that come with it seriously."

You nodded at that and decided it beat to save all of your other questions for mom. Upon returning home, Hayley led you to mom's study. There, mom pushed a button under her desk you did not see before, opening a hidden door in the back of the room. "This way, John." Firmly but kindly, she said. "It's time for you to see and understand the family secret."

Curious, you followed mom and Hayley through the hidden door which closed behind you. Beyond it was a long stone stairwell that led to an underground room where you found libraries of books lining all four walls, a huge iron cauldron over a stone fire pit in the center, an impressive garden surrounding it and various work stations that look similar to a small laboratory. "What is all of this!?" Darkly impressed, you asked. "It looks like a scene from a Gothic science fiction movie."

Mom and Hayley giggled. "This is a private training center, John." Smiling, mom explained. "As my eldest daughter, Hayley had to go to a special school to learn how to control a certain gift all girls in this family are born with."

"A certain gift?" Raising an eyebrow, you asked.

"One step at a time, John." Gently, mom said. "Boys in this family are not born with this gift unless certain conditions are met but, because you are Mel's twin, you may soon gain that gift without anyone helping it along."

"Mom, you're scaring me." Uncomfortable, you said. "Are to telling me that I may turn into a girl?"

"It's a real possibility." Wincing, Hayley said. "As you reached thirteen, we sensed that the dormant magic in you was very strong and decided to wait a year before telling you anything."

"Are you guys are telling me that I'm in a family of witches?" Unnerved, you asked. Mom and Hayley nodded. "What difference does a year make in telling me all of this?"

"A year ago, you were dealing with puberty." Calmly, mom replied. "With all of those hormones running wild inside of you, it would have been dangerous for everyone to introduce you to magic."

"We had to wait until your body and mind calmed down a little first." Equally calm, Hayley added. "Boys who are born into families like ours are blessed physically. You would have been a real handful if you were to be panicked or worse enraged a year ago."

"That's why you insisted upon the athletics and meditation." Catching on, you said. "To prepare me for all of this and, I suspect, more."

Mom nodded. "Now for the kicker." Placing a hand onto your shoulder, she said. "We fear that your own magic is slowly changing you from the inside out. This is the most difficult of all transformations as it can be painful." she winced. "Or worse, painless and unnoticed by all until it is too late."

You ran a hand through your hair, frustrated. "Is- Is there anything you can do to stop it?"

"I'm afraid not, John." Flatly, mom replied. "You see, it is a condition known as the twin factor. You and Mel are mentally and magically linked so, once Mel learns magic and starts to practice it..."

"I will transform into a girl and a witch to form a balance." Guessing correctly, you said. "What if my physical strength raised above her magic?"

"Sorry, John but that is not how the balance works." Gently, Hayley said. "Your best bet is to keep your strength and other attributes equal with Mel's magic."

"That and there is your own dormant magic to consider." Serious, mom said. "If it becomes too strong for your body to contain it, you will spontaneously switch genders to give that magic an outlet."

"How long before I know I'm changing?" Begging, you asked.

Mom sighed and pointed to a mirror on the door to the underground room. "Sorry, John but I fear that..."
15513.title: Hayley intervenes.

155131.content:
"Too late?" Almost chocking on the words, you asked. "No..."

Hayley smiled slightly. "You are not going to die, John." She explained. "You are just going to change."

"Don't I at least have a few days to prepare myself?" Worried, you asked.

"We have been preparing you." Patiently, mom replied. She winced, adding, "Slowly enough so you would not take much notice."

"The pastel pink walls in your room as a 'calming effect' for one." Chiming in, Hayley said. "Asking you to help store some of Mel's excess clothes in your closet as another."

You sighed, looking betrayed. "What if I did not change?"

"Then everything would have been slowly changed back to the way it was without your notice." Softly, mom said. "However, as you can see by your reflection, you have a err... 'developing' problem."

You turned to the mirror and gasped upon seeing that you now had a pair of small bumps on your chest where your pecks were. "How can I be developing breasts?" Near panic, you asked. "I'm a boy!"

"At the rate you are changing, I'd say you will be a full fledged girl in a matter of hours." Standing beside you, Hayley said. "Don't worry though; you will still be you on the inside."

"It is best if you don't go anywhere while this occurs, John." Firmly but kindly, mom said. "You can learn more about what we do in this room or do something else until your changes finish."

What do you do?
155131.title: It's already too late.

choices: You have shoulder length hair, are shorter, but the same age
1551311.content:
"You said I could learn more? What is there, a book for witchcraft 101?" You joked.
"Actually, we do,"said Mom as she hands you a big tome, which looks a lot like the book from earlier. "Go read this, it will explain the basics of magic, although you won't be able to use it for at least a few hours."
You head back to your room and start to read through the book. Before you know it, it is time for dinner. As you get off of your bed, you look in your mirror and realize ......
1551311.title: Ask to learn more.

1551313.content:
"What exactly do you do in this room?" Curious, you asked.

"We make potions." Simply, mom replied. "Some must be drank while overs need only be sprinkled or poured onto the intended person. Each potion has its own purpose and I do not advise you to try your hand at it without proper training."

"So you teach young witches how to make potions?" Sitting down, you asked. You had not noticed that your voice had risen nearly two octaves. "I knew that you offered tutoring to young girls but I did not suspect this."

"We tutor young witches who have gained the power of magic but are too young to go to witch school." Smiling, Hayley replied. "It was not easy for us to keep these little witches from trying a little mischief on you while you were kept unaware."

You winced that the thought of a little girl trying magic on you. "Yeah... I probably would have freaked if one of them turned me into a doll or something."

Giggling, mom said, "Don't worry, we have the antidotes for all the potions we teach."

"Besides, a doll making potion requires a number of advanced spells that are beyond most young witches so you have nothing to worry about there." Soothingly, Hayley added. "Maybe when your changes are done, we can tutor you in a few simple potions."

Hayley's offer left you feeling dumb. "Wouldn't I be old enough to go to witch school?"

Mom sighed. "If you keep your normal age, yes." Looking at you, she said. "However, there is a slight chance that the twin factor will make you the twin of the witch sibling you are emotionally closest to rather than the one your are closer to in age."

"Hannah!?" Startled, you asked.

Hayley nodded. "You can deny it all you like, John." Smiling, she said. "We both know you and Hannah are very close. You secretly go to her ballet practices to watch her dance and even dance with her sometimes."

Mom giggled. "It won't be so bad if it happens, John." Calmly, she said. "You will still be you inside."

"Well, when will I know if I keep my age or become a little girl?" Nervous, you asked.

Hayley placed a hand onto your shoulder. "We will all find out together when the changes finish." Softly, she said. "Why don't you take a nap so you won't have to watch it happen."

Suddenly, you felt dizzy and sleepy. Within moments, you fell to the floor, fast asleep. When you woke up you found yourself in a room suited for...
1551313.title: The twist of the twin factor.

15513133.content:
... an eight year old boy. Huh? Why would mom do this to my room? you wondered as you glanced around your room. It was almost like what your room was like when you was growing up, and was nothing like the bedrooms of your sisters. Fearfully, you glanced down, and saw that you had changed.

"I'm a kid again" you said sourly, seeing that you was wearing some boy's pajamas. It puzzled you; you was turning into a girl. You saw the lumps on your chest. yet you was wearing boy's clothes. It was definitely out of character for mom. Wincing, you decided it was best to get things over with.

I'm still a guy?! What is going on? you thought, your eyes widening in shock. They widened even more as you heard Hayley's voice saying, "Yes, John. You're still my brother."

"Hayley! What is going on!?" you demanded.

"Lets say that your situation is unique" Hayley said, her voice slowing that she was reluctant to talk.

"I'm going to talk to mom" you said, as you got up from your bed.

"No. Don't go out!" Hayley pleaded.

You was alarmed by your sister's sudden change and sat back down. "Why? Am I going to be 'finished off?" you asked.

"No. Don't go" Hayley said. Wavering, you got up and opened your bedroom door. Immediately you saw that the walls had scorch marks, a sign there had been a fight.

"What is going on?" you said angrily.

"I didn't want you to worry, John, but our sweet, well behaved cousin got into the potion store" Hayley said.

"Oh God. What did he do?" you asked.
15513133.title: A surprising development

155131331.content:
"Tim thought that potions were like any other 'chemical' mixture." Rolling her eyes, Hayley replied.

"Let me guess." Frowning, you said. "He messed with them, mixing them at random, and ended up causing a magical explosion."

"Unfortunately, yes." sighing, Hayley said. "Unfortunately, Tim threw the mixture he made at Hannah and her friend Erin." she winced. "They were in the center of the blast."

"What!?" Furious, you asked.

"They're both fine." Quickly, Hayley said. "They were just changed into boys."

You paused, hearing that. "So the twin factor was changing me into Hannah's twin."

Hayley nodded. "Only now that she is a boy, you are a boy as well."

You were silent for a moment before you turned to Hayley; your jaws knotted in decision. "We have to fix it, Hayley." Firmly, you said. "I can adapt but it would be harder on Hannah and Erin. They are the most girly two I know."

"Mom is working on that now." Urging you to sit, Hayley said. "She asked me to keep you in here so you don't try to wring Tim's neck for his stupidity. Mel and Megan have their hands full with 'Hanson' and 'Eric' as it is, they are both furious."

"Where is Tim?" Curious, you asked.

Hayley sighed. "Mom and I tied him to a chair in the sitting room." Evenly, she replied. "Aunt Catherine is on her way now with Brooke.

Just then, a loud commotion was heard downstairs. You and Hayley ran to the landing to see that...
155131331.title: continue

1551313313.content:
.. that your new brother had gotten away from Mel. It would had looked almost comical as Hanson wore a pink princess costume, but his facial expression showed all he wanted to do was to wring Tim's neck. The other thing you noticed was that Hanson was fast; much faster than what Hannah was, and just as stealthy. A couple of seconds later, another oddly dressed boy brushed past you, followed by Mel's call of, "The boys are loose."

"I told you to watch them and calm them down" mom yelled from her position by a tied up Tim.

"I tried, but Hanson is surprisingly strong" Mel protested.

Hanson didn't like hearing that; he said, "Don't call me that. My name is Hannah and I'm a girl. Mommy, where is that toad?"

By the time you reached the sitting room, both boys had reached your cousin. He was securely bound to a chair, and despite being gagged, Tim seemed pleased with his handiwork. You was surprised by this; the only thing that separated him and two furious boys was mom.

"Sweetie, I know your scared and upset" mom soothed.

"Mommy. Please let me teach him a lesson" Hanson begged.

"Hanson. Please go back to your room and put on the clothes I've given you. You look ridiculous wearing that" mom said. Tim seemed to agree, but was prevented from doing something stupid by his gag. Hanson looked even more furious, if that was possible.

"Mommy, I...." Hanson started to say, but mom cut him off.

"Believe me, Tim will be punished, but not by you boys" mom said calmly.

"But Mrs Harrison. He turned me into a gross thing like him" Eric protested.

"Mmmmm mmmmmm mmmmmm: Tim's said, his muffled cries incomprehensible. Mom frowned, and said to Tim. "You're just digging your own grave, mister".

"What did he say?" you asked, causing your brother and Eric to jump.

"You boys don't need to know" mom said as she walked over to a window. "Good."

"Who is it?" you asked, knowing that someone must had arrived.
1551313313.title: Hanson got away from Mel.

15513133131.content:
Having to keep Hanson and Eric at bay, mom signaled Hayley to open the door. She dragged you down with her and ordered you to sit before opening the door. Catherine entered with a pale looking Brooke following behind. She looked about the sitting room, surprised. "Tim did all of this?" Stunned, she asked. she turned to him, angry. "You are in so much trouble!!"

"Not now, Brooke." Sternly, Catherine stated. "Please take a seat while I help your aunt Natalie return things to normal."

Brooke quickly walked across the room and sat down next to you. "Mommy told me that you are going to be a girl Hannah's age." Looking at you, she said. "What happened?"

"It's a long story." Wincing, you said. "I don't quite understand it all myself."

"We will explain everything in a moment." Firmly but kindly, Catherine said. "First, we need to set things straight around here so please be patient for a moment longer." She then turned to Tim. "You should know better than to mess with anything you don't know anything about, young man. I will deal with you when we are done fixing your mess."

"The magical explosion reversed the effects of the twin factor, making Hannah a brother rather than John a sister." in a forced calm, mom said. "Erin was caught in the blast but I do not know how that will effect things."

Catherine sighed. "It complicates things greatly, I'm afraid." Frowning, she said. "As John was the oldest, he is the trigger. His bond with Hannah moved the twin factor to make him her true twin. Only now Erin is in the mix which means if John does not change, neither will either of them."

"Does this mean I'm stuck like this!?" Near tears, Hanson asked.

"No, it means that I have to be your true twin to fix Tim's mess." Speaking up, you said. "Only this was going to happen any way." You turned to mom. "Am I right?"

Mom nodded. "Yes; if the magical explosion had not happened, you would have become an eight year old girl and Hannah's twin." Confirming your statement, she said. "Only, you would have been able to make yourself a boy again once you learned magic." She sadly shook her head. "Sorry, but because of the magical explosion, your change into Hannah's twin will be permanent."

You teared up but quickly wiped them away before Hanson could see them. "I- I'm okay with that."

Mom smiled, pleased that you were at least trying to be brave about it. "We'll all help you adapt." Softly, she said. "Catherine and I will get things ready."

"The potion you will need to drink will have an overly sweet taste." Warning you, Catherine said. "Once you change, Hanson and Eric will quickly follow."

"What about him?" Giving Tim an annoyed glare, you asked.

"You, Hannah, and Erin will decide his fate after your changes are complete." Firmly, Catherine replied. "Until then, he can stay tied up where he is."

Minutes later, you were given a tall pink drink to take down. As Catherine warned, it had an overly sweet taste to it, making you want to gag. Still, you managed to drink it all down. Soon after, you saw yourself changing and within seconds, you were an eight year old girl in over-sized boy's clothing.

You turned to Hanson and Eric, pleased to see them returning to their female forms. They smiled, relieved to be back to normal then turned to you, sadly. "Sorry, John." Wincing, Hannah said.

"This was going to happen anyway." Shrugging, you said. "I'll deal with it."

Welcome back, girls." Smiling, mom said. "I expect you to help Lucy adjust to being a little girl as it was 'his' sacrifice that saved you from having a 'thing' for the rest of your lives."

Hannah and Erin quickly nodded then turned to Tim. "What should we do to him?" Hannah asked.

"Make him clean the entire house by himself." Chiming in, Erin suggested. "He's the one who made the mess!"

"Make him a girl until Lucy gets used to being one." Angry, Hannah suggested.

The two turned to you, as you were the tie breaker.
15513133131.title: Your girlish fate is sealed.

choices: Tim runs downstairs, and complains to Catherine
155131331313.content:
While you wanted Tim to pay for what he had done, you knew things regarding Tim that neither Erin or Hannah knew. Plus you wanted to make sure Tim knew that you wouldn't tolerate any sort of girl taunting towards you. "Let me talk to Tim. Alone" you said in a commanding voice.

"But..." Hannah, said protesting your decision. She clearly thought that you was going to be lenient.

"Hannah. Let your sister do her thing" mom said, as you led a still grinning Tim to your room. Frowning, you said in a sharp voice, "Sit down"

"No way, you stupid girl. Its probably some sort of trap" Tim said, eying your still boyish room.

"I have two enraged girls downstairs that are out for your blood. Tell me why I shouldn't grant their wish?" you demanded.

"You're now too dumb to understand" Tim replied.

"I understand, Timothy. I've got plenty of ideas. I lost half my age and gender. Maybe you should receive the same" you suggested.

"I know you won't" Tim said, defiantly staring at you.

"I'm going to ask some questions and I want you to tell me the truth, Tim. Lie to me, and I'm going downstairs and tell mom that I like both of the girls' ideas" you said, finally getting Tim's attention. He remained silent, allowing you to continue. "I know what is going on. You knew more about the potions and magic than what you let on. You knew what was happening to me and you thought changing Hannah would stop me from changing into an 'icky gross girl'. And the reason you targeted Erin is because because you like her."
155131331313.title: You have your own idea.

choices: go back to your school as a gifted child
1551313313133.content:
Tim stared at you, his mouth open from both shock and fury. Glaring, he said nothing.

"Well? I'm waiting" you said, impatiently tapping your foot against your bed. While Tim was like Hannah in so many ways, he was also similar to you. When cornered, he tended to search for a third option. Taking you by surprise, he fled out of your room.

"Where are you going, you little brat?" you yelled, annoyed that your girlish, childish voice didn't inspire much authority. By the time you caught sight of him again, you saw that he was standing beside his mom, and a disappointed looking Hannah and Erin.

"Mommy. Mommy. John is being mean to me and is threatening to do both cootie-brains ideas" Tim whined.

Hannah and Erin shared a glance at each other, and started to smile. "You're going to make a cute girl, Timmy" Erin said.

"Shut up. Mommy, John tried to get me to said that I liked Erin. She's gross" Tim said.

Erin's smile instantly vanished. "Ewwwww. " Erin complained, her face showing she was disgusted by the idea.

Catherine sighed, seeing that things would eventually turn into an exchange of insults between Tim and Erin. "I better take him home."

"But what about his punishment? He turned me into a gross yucky boy" Hannah whined.

"Don't worry. he won't escape a punishment, Hannah" Catherine said. Seconds later, she and a slightly smug looking Tim vanished.


*********************************************

"That was a noble thing, sis" Hayley said. It was just you and your older sister; mom was in her car with Hannah, taking Erin home.

"Don't go mushy on me. So what happens now?" you said, sighing.

"We could send you out a grade school as you are now Hannah's twin, though we have to give you a bit of girl lessons first. Alternatively, we could send you back to school as a gifted child. Or maybe we could have you home schooled. As you now know, mom tutors.....
1551313313133.title: There is always a third option

15513133131331.content:
"I can't believe you. You've been turned into a kid again, yet you insist that you go to school with us" Megan said, surprised as she scanned your figure. The shock of discovering magic and of your sacrifice had worn off; the shock that you wanted your old seat at school, and bemusement at your appearance had set in. Despite going back to your normal school as a child prodigy, your clothes were that of a young schoolgirl. While you was slightly embarrassed being seen with your plaid skirt and knee socks, and hated the tapping of your mary janes, or the sight of the pink ribbon holding your pigtailed hair in your peripheral vision, you knew things could be far worse.

"I have my reasons" you hinted.

"Other than the fact I would be bored out of my mind if I went back to grade school, I don't want have my hair pulled by some boy trying to express that he secretly liked me. Least here, nobody is going to hit on me" you said, your voice turning sour as you mentioned boys.

"Guess you're right. You're cute" Megan giggled. From her look she gave you, you knew not only she was observing how you looked now, she was picturing you as a teen. You quickly decided you didn't want to go there.

"Thanks" you muttered.

"The other thing is that I was hoping you would mentor me" you said, blushing slightly. Megan blushed too. Without giving an answer. she said, "Least you don't have to worry about that Kristy bitch being here commenting about how they let a 'child' in"

***********************************

"I think you got the wrong room" a girl said as you moved into you old seat.

"It's Tonya. Right?" you feigned as Megan slide into the chair next to you. "I know exactly where I should be."
15513133131331.title: go back to your school as a gifted child

155131331313312.content:
"Really?" Tonya said, her eyebrow raising quizzically as if she wondered if you knew what you was talking about.

Megan intervened. "Trust me, Ton. Lucy is smart. Real smart" your friend said.

"How do you know?" Tonya asked.

"Trust me, I know. So does Rickards" Megan said.

You chuckled slightly, wondering how your teacher, Gary Rickards would handle having an eight year old wonderkid in his class, though you knew it could be worse; Rickards least made math interesting. Even for Mel. That said, you wondered where he was as he was normally around class. Deciding to play the game of the new student, you asked, "Is he usually this late?"

"No" Megan said. She turned her attention to the door, and hissed in a low, outraged voice, "What is she doing here?!"

"What?" you said, surprised by Megan;s sudden intense fury. Least until you saw the figure standing there. It was Kristy Hart, former head cheerleader, and Megan's nemesis. She had graduated the previous year, much to Megan's relief, so it puzzled you (and most of the class) why she was standing in the room. She couldn't had gone into teaching considering her distaste towards kids. As you looked at her face, you knew she preferred to anywhere else but your classroom.

What is she doing here? you thought, as Kristy started to introduce herself to a slightly outraged class.
155131331313312.title: An unwelcome surprise at school

1551313313133121.content:
'How is this happening', your mind screamed as Kristy droned on about how she was going to teach the class. Then in true Kristy style, she insulted the class by saying that she didn't relish teaching a group of babies. Nearly everyone was fuming; she was only four years older than you, and she still had her haughty attitude. Even as Tonya muttered "How could someone like her decide to go into teaching?", you wondered if you made the biggest mistake of your life by coming here. Grade school looked more appealing by the minute.....

'I could fake it. I'm eight. Plus both Hannah and Melanie aren't too great with math. I could easily pretend I'm not so good as well.... No, I'm here now, and I'm not leaving because of one teacher. Plus it would embarrass Megan. Kristy has to be here for a reason... and I'm gonna find out why you mused as Kristy started to drone on about math,

************************************

"Lucy Harrison. Could I have a word with you?" Kristy said as class ended. All the other students were eager to rush out of the class, except for Megan, who gave you a sympathetic look. You returned it with a look saying you can handle Kristy. Reluctantly, Megan walked out too, leaving you with the now hated teacher. As soon as you was alone, she smirked slightly.

"You look so adorable, little girl" Kristy mocked.

"Is that all?" you asked, wanting to get away.

"Not quite, Lucy. Or should I say, John?" Kristy said. Your face dropped, stunned that Kristy knew who you are. Or was. Kristy seemed to enjoy your discomfort.

"What do you want?" you hissed.

"Do would think I want to teach babies like you? No, I'm stuck here"

"I knew you weren't here by choice. What did you do?" you asked

"I stole this orb thing from that stupid old hag at the mall. Then this cloaked woman came and told me that I'm going to be the teacher here. She got to be some kind of witch."

"O-kay" you said, glad that Kristy herself doesn't have powers. It still didn't explain how she knew who you were; nobody else could.

"I think I'm joking? If you take a look at your crotch, Lucy, you'll remember magic is real. Either you help me, little girl, or I'll...." Kristy threatened.

"If you want help, maybe you should try another approach. Like being nice for once" you said, getting up to leave. Ignoring Kristy, you walked out the classroom
1551313313133121.title: continue

15513133131331211.content:
"Mom?" you yelled the second you walked through the front door. Mom was in her study, and from the way she spoke, you could tell she was really happy.

"Head to the bathroom. I'll be there soon."

"But mom...." you protested. You knew you had to tell her about Kristy, but mom was insistent.

"We can talk later" mom pressed.

"Okay" you said, as you flung down your backpack, which was to your relief something a teen girl would have rather than one a girl your apparent age would love, and headed for the bathroom. Mom was already there, and was running the bath.

"What are you doing? I can bathe myself" you said crossly.

"I know that sweetie, but you're still new to being a girl. Let me help you" mom said.

"Mom. Eek" you squeaked, seeing that mom zapped away your clothes. Embarrassed, you tried to cover yourself, but mom laughed.

"We're both girls, sweetie" mom said, as she motioned for you to head into the bath.

"We have a problem" you tried to say as mom 'helped' you in the bath. You was getting annoyed, both with mom's childish treatment of you, and her not listening to what you wanted to say. She seemed to be in her own little world. Fuming, you allowed her to continue, figuring it would be best to allow her to finish. After she had passed you a towel, your heart sank further. In the corner, there was several silver colored boxes, and you suspected that it was some sort of dress.

"Open them" mom gushed.

Ruluctantly, you opened the smallest box first. it contained a heart shaped pendant, but unlike the one Hannah wore, it was far more expensive looking. It also looked older.

"That has been in our family for generations, Lucy. I want you to wear it... least after you get some clothes on" mom chuckled. You didn't know what to say; instead you focused on the next box. it was plain white panties, which wasn't something you had an issue with. Quickly you put them on, and focused on the next box. It was something you had been dreading as much as a dress; a training bra.

"Mom?" you said.

"I know. Considering that you're.... you, and and that I do not allow Hannah to wear one, I decided to allow you to have one, Lucy. As you know, magic isn't the only dominant thing to run through the women of our family, and I know when you reach 14 again, you're going to be at least as big as Mel, if not bigger...."

"Mom. Can you talk about something other than the size of the breasts of my sisters?" you said, slightly disgusted as you stared at the white thing in the box.

"Its a part of being a girl. You know Hannah wants to do the things that Melanie and Hayley does. Anyway, you're a big girl and since you're not a grade schooler, I though maybe this would help you feel more grown up" mom gushed.

"Thanks" you said, not entirely convinced. Without warning, you felt a slight caged feeling around your chest. "mom, did you had to magically put that thing onto me?"

"Sorry, but I know you were hesitant. We're running late."

"So what other 'surprises' have you got for me?" you demanded.

Mom magically opened up the last box. It was, as you feared a dress, but this one was white. Another box containing wrist gloves was next to the dress.

"Mom? What is going on? And why white?" you asked.

"I thought you would prefer white to say, pink" mom said.

"White is fine" you said as you felt another weird sensation as mom zapped the dress and gloves onto you. As she zipped up the dress, you said, "That Kristy Hart is back and knows who I am."
15513133131331211.title: Mom's surprise

choices: A trip to Witchbloom magic school
155131331313312111.content:
"She knows? Mmmm, it doesn't matter" mom said somewhat casually.

"What?! How could you say that. Think about it, mother" you said, deliberately using a whiny voice to try and get mom's attention. How could the return of the biggest bitch you knew be anything but a bad thing.

"Miss Hart got caught trying to use magic she stole from Samantha Forester. And in Samantha, Kristy has met her match. Do you know who she is?" mom asked, as she motioned for you to sit down so she could do your hair. You made no attempt; instead you continued to pout.

"Just don't go near her. That witch has a short fuse. There are worse things than being a teacher" mom said, answering her own question.

"Where are we going anyway? It must be important for you to go and dress me like some sort of girly princess with both magical and conventional means" you demanded as you caught sight of your reflection. Not a single inch of you remotely resembled a tomboy. While you thought it made you look pretty, you knew it wasn't your style.

"You'll find out soon, Lucy. Can you wait for me in your room, while I get your sister ready" mom asked.
155131331313312111.title: Mom is unfazed by the news

1551313313133121111.content:
You were not happy to wear a dress but you were more curious about where mom was taking you and Hannah. Minutes later, mom came to fetch you with Hannah who was just as curious.

"You look cute, Lucy." Swishing the skirt of her identical dress. "Do you have any idea where we are going?"

"Not a clue." Sighing, you replied. "Can't you even give us a clue?"

Mom giggled. "Hayley and Mel went to it when it was their turn." Cryptically, she replied.

"That's a lot of help." Folding your arms, you said.

Mom smiled. "Enough stalling, you two; in the car, now."

You were still not used to sitting in a booster seat but your curiosity silenced your protests and mom was soon driving you and Hannah to your unknown deatination. The drive took you and your sister just outside of town to a private club where mom parked the car that was reserved for 'the coming of age'.

"What is this?" Curious, Hannah asked.

Mom laughed. "It is a celebratory dinner in honor of your magic taking root." Smiling, she said. "If John had not become Lucy, you would have been coming here alone, Hannah."
1551313313133121111.title: A celebratory dinner

choices: you're shocked to find Kristy in the room
15513133131331211113.content:
"I see. Why am I dress up like this?' you asked, leaving out the part that you thought being so girlishly dressed was extremely embarrassing.

"I wanted you to look nice" mom said as she ushered into into the club. While there was several kids your new age inside, the only one you recognized was the only boy; your cousin, Tim. That surprised you, as you was expecting to see just girls. Hannah was surprised as well. She turned to mom and whined, "Why is Timmy the Toad here, mommy?"

"Yes. I want to know as well. He cannot see me like this. I thought only girls can work magic" you whined.

Hayley and Mel gave a slight giggle at your complain, while Hannah started to grin. You knew what was going on in her mind; she thought Tim would be changed.

"I don't think that is going to happen, sis. Look. One, he is as nicely dressed as me. I doubt aunt Catherine would had bothered if he was going to end up like me" you said, slightly sourly. Ignoring Mel's giggles, you continued. "Two. Look at his face. He is clearly stressed. He knows where he is, who he is with and what could happen. I think he will be on is best behavior tonight." You sisters seemed to be eager to put it to the test, especially Hannah. They immediately walked over towards your slightly terrified cousin. You stayed back; you wasn't ready to face him yet.

"Nice work" a girl said from behind. You turned and saw an eight year old girl smiling at you. She was similar to you, except she worn a pale blue dress and had her mousy brown hair secured with a bow. Her brown eyes showed intelligence.

"Good evening Lucy Harrison. Nice work deducing about that jerk of a cousin of yours" the girl said.

"Who are you?" you asked.

"My name is Robyn Turner. My story is like yours, except it happened last year."

"Oh...." you said.
15513133131331211113.title: Continue.

155131331313312111131.content:
You didn't quite know what to say to Robyn's statement. A part of you didn't want to; a part from being clearly intelligent, you didn't want to take the risk of hearing if Robyn had gone completely girlie. Before the silence became too uncomfortable, you decided to confront the other thing that Robyn had told you.

"So how do you know my 'sweet' and 'charming' cousin?" you asked.

Robyn gave you a slight grin. "Timothy does have a way to make a girl feel welcome. Anyway I was sent to deal with him."

"Sent? What do you mean?" you asked, partly out of curiosity and partly out of worry.

"I'm kind of the problem solver when it comes to anything to do with kids and witches. Your transformation meant that magic could no longer be hidden from either of your cousins, Tim or Brooke, so the head witch decided that maybe a talk between me and Tim would calm him down" Robyn said with a slight shake of her head.

"What did the little toad do? Put his pet frog down your dress?" you asked.

"Jeans actually. No. He said he won't let cootie brained creatures corrupt his sister whilst he poured oatmeal into my hair" Robyn said. She pouted slightly as you gave a slight involuntary giggle. "I glad you think its funny."

"Tim has done worse, Robyn. Last year he dropped Fella -that is his pet frog- down one of the school cheerleader's top. While he certainly fears girls, and likes taunting them, there is a pattern to all of it. Nothing physical. Protect his favorite target."

"You mean his sister?" Robyn said dryly.

"Yes. Tim probably is worried that someone will teach Brooke bad habits. Mainly to use against him. Wanna go and ask him" you said.

Robyn's eyes lit up. "I wouldn't mind watching him squirm a bit more. He will recognize me."

You and Robyn walked towards Catherine's table, where Tim was pleading to his mother about something. You guessed it was for her to get him out of there, but whatever it was, it was irrelevant. Tim spotted you and Robyn and stopped pleading.

"Timmy" you said.

"Princess cootiehead" Tim responded, but you could tell it was a front; he was terrified.
155131331313312111131.title: facing Tim

choices: There are a few other boys here.
The party for the boys is tomorrow.
1551313313133121111311.content:
"How does it feel to be the only boy at an all girl's party?" Smiling slightly, you asked. "I'm pleasantly surprised you are not insulting everyone in sight."

Tim frowned. "I'm here because my power has surfaced." Glumly, he said. "Normal boys would see it as cool but to me its nothing but a headache."

"Your power?" Curious, you asked.

"There is a balance in most witch households." Patiently, Catherine explained. "You have magically blessed girls and physically blessed boys. Every case is different; in your case, you are a twin to a witch which makes you also magically blessed."

"In Tim's case, he will become increasingly stronger as he ages." Shaking her head slightly, Robyn stated. "He will have to be more and more careful not to hurt anyone."

"Girls are like glass." Pouting further, Tim said. "They bruise way to easily. If I keep getting stronger every year like Robyn said..." he gulped slightly, "I don't want to hurt anyone! I just like to mess with their heads, get them to fight back."

"It's not fun to Tim if the girl just runs away crying." Bemused, Robyn said. "He wants the girl to strike back; to make the 'game' more interesting."

"Who are you? A psychiatrist?" Sarcastically, Tim asked.

Robyn smiled slightly. "In a sense, yes." Simply, she replied. "You are fascinated by magic only you are weary of the one requirement other than being born in a witch family."

"Being a girl." Ruefully, you muttered.

"You don't know everything about me." Frowning, Tim said. "I promised to behave so don't try to bait me into breaking my word."

"We will leave you to your dinner then." Smiling, Robyn said. "You look very handsome in that suit."

Tim blushed at that, unaware how cute it made him look. Brooke giggled slightly at the sight of him but shrugged as Tim turned to her. Tim just shook his head as you returned to your table. "Is Tim really the only boy here?" Concerned, you asked. "He'll be wearing a dress before the night is over."

Robyn smiled slightly then replied...
1551313313133121111311.title: continue

15513133131331211113111.content:
"He is the only boy here, Lucy. All the others are girls. Either they're always been one, like your sisters, or your cousin, Brooke, or they've been permanently transformed like me" Robyn said.

"Or like me" you said in a slightly sour voice.

"Yes. That is why I think the dress comment is appropriate. Tim's presence is obvious and I think a few people here would like to see Tim as the only temporary transformed girl here" Robyn replied.

"Is the whole strength thing true? Would that had happened to me if.... you know."

"It is true. Brothers to a witch tend to have physical prowess, though I don't fully understand how. You felt it yourself, right?"

"Yeah" you sighed. Turning away, you focused your attention towards mom. "What is going on?"

"With the dinner, or with Timothy?" mom quizzed.

"Both" you said, noticing that Robyn had taken a seat nearby.

"Your situation as far as we know is unique throughout history. As for Tim, Catherine brought him along to keep an eye on him. Not only because his new found strength, but because she wants to observe his reaction around witches. Especially that one" mom said

"Forrester" Hayley said in a low voice.

"What is she doing here?" you demanded
15513133131331211113111.title: The Tim Question

choices: Elvira called Tim to the stage.
Elvira called you to the stage.
155131331313312111131111.content:
"This is a time for all witches in the community to come together and welcome its newest members." Smiling slightly, Samantha said. "Congratulations on becoming a witch, young lady. You will find your life has greatly improved compared to your previous life as a boy."

"There would be no witches without the boys, Samantha." Patiently, mom said. "They are the ones who carry the 'magic gene'."

"A sad truth." Pouting, Samantha said. She raised a mock dramatic hand to her head. "I weep for their sacrifice to keep magic alive."

You giggled slightly, seeing Samantha's dark humor.

"Don't encourage her, Lucy." Frowning, Hayley scolded. "Samantha likes to toy with boys, turning them into girls in various situations. None permanent... yet."

"This is a formal event; one I would not dare disrupt." Becoming serious, Samantha said. "I have reasons for what I do, just as you had reasons for your actions against Jack, my dear Natalie."

"I learned my lesson." Frowning, mom countered. "You still need to learn."

"Um... a story for another time." Quickly, you said. "It looks like the dinner is about to start."

Mom smiled, thankful you were not pressing for answers at the moment. Samantha sighed, seeing Elvira walking onto a stage nearby and walked to her seat as the dinner began...
155131331313312111131111.title: continue

1551313313133121111311113.content:
"Good evening. Before I can announce the start to this evening's celebrations, I would like to call miss Lucy Harrison to the stage" Elvira said.

What?! You didn't want to that. It was bad enough that you was stuck as a girl, something that made you reluctant to been seen publicly, but to walk up onto that stage appearing like a very girlie girl was something else. Seeing that you had began to blush, mom said, "Don't worry about things, Lucy. Just walk up there and be yourself."

'That is easy for you to say', you thought darkly, as you reluctantly walked to the stage. You didn't care why Elvira wanted you in the spotlight, but you knew it was better to obey, then run away as soon as you could. Elvira was oddly distant; the only sign of acknowledgement was a slight nod of her head. Her attention focused back to the crowd as she continued her speech.

"Young ladies. Lucy was the victim of the magical condition called the Twin Factor..."Elvira said, or at least, tried to say. She was cut off by the crowd.

"Huh?" a few, confused voices murmured.

"It occurs amongst twins of different gender, where the magically weaker twin becomes the gender of the stronger" Elvira calmly explained, as a few of the girls giggled. You blushed even more, seeing that some of the little girls had figured out what had happened to you, and thought it was funny. Daring a glance over towards Tim, you saw he was looking increasingly angrier.

Elvira continued, seemingly undisturbed by the interruptions. "However, Lucy's case is unique. She only regressed to her 'twin's' age, and started to change her sister."

"Ewwwwwwww" the same voices protested in the crowd. Smiling, Elvira turned towards you. "Sorry I had to do that, grand-daughter, but I think I made my point."
1551313313133121111311113.title: Elvira called you to the stage.

15513133131331211113111131.content:
Although you were embarrassed, Elvira's words gave you an idea and you turned to her. "May- May I say something?" Almost whispering, you asked. "I think its important."

"Go ahead, tell the audience what you must say." Lowing the microphone, Elvira said.

"The twin factor is more than a 'condition', its a delicate balance." Looking at the audience, you said. "When I first learned of it, I thought I would transform into my twin sister, Melanie."

Mel blushed as a few girls turned to her, surprised. They then turned back to the stage as you continued to speak. "I instead changed into a twin for my little sister, Hannah. She and I are real close." you blushed, giggling to spite yourself. "Even though we'd never admit it."

Giggles erupted from the audience as Elvira took the microphone. "Boys have magic within them but it effects them physically unless they are turned into a girl." Smiling, she said. Lucy and Hannah have many similar interests; thus she regressed to her age." She turned to you. "Thank you, Lucy. Please take your seat while I call the next person."

The audience applauded, causing you to blush while you returned to your seat. "Well, said, Lucy." Smiling, mom stated. "I'm glad that you see magic is more than it seems."

You smiled slightly, still blushing. Then, Elvira called the next person to the stage. "Tim Towers, please come to the stage."

Tim moaned as several girls giggled. It was apparent they found it funny to see him the only boy at a ceremony for girls with magical power. A glance from Elvira brought silence as Tim reluctantly walked into the spotlight on the stage. Elvira placed a firm hand onto his shoulder. "Tim was the victim of a near tragedy involving his little sister, Brooke." To everyone's surprise, she said. "A young witch with no chance of having children of her own attempted to kidnap Brooke from her own bed."

Gasps rose from the audience as Hayley turned to mom, startled. "I didn't know that."

"Neither did I." Worried, mom replied. "There must be a reason."

"Tim confronted this witch, becoming a miniature Juggernaut like my husband, Dr. Moriarty Strange, easily overpowering the witch's magic." In a serious tone, Elvira stated. She waited for her words to sink in before continuing. "Just as strong emotions augment magic in girls, it augments a boy's physical strength; Tim nearly killed the witch in his attempt to stop her."

Tim began to sob slightly, blushing brightly but Elvira ignored him and continued. "The witch placed a taunting curse onto this young man, forcing him to taunt every girl in sight. It loses it's grip over him when Tim either becomes a girl permanently or falls in love." She smiled at the audience. "The reason he is here tonight is to celebrate him..."
15513133131331211113111131.title: Magic is more than it seems.

choices: Tim escapes; you and Robyn search for him
Tim is magically lifted into the air and pulled back to the stage
155131331313312111131111311.content:
"......Permanently becoming a girl" Elvira announced.

Tim face fell, which was quite understandable. Not only because of what Elvira said, but because a few of the girls in the audience giggled at the idea.
"What!?" he said in a oddly quiet, disbelieving voice. "You're going to turn me into some icky, gross dumb girl?! Not going to happen." Seeing that Elvira was going to grab his hand, Tim pulled away and started to take a step back.

"Don't make this harder, Timothy" Elvira said in a gentle voice, but Tim wasn't listening. He had moved to the edge of the stage and was risking taking a glance around the room, apparently looking for an escape route. Everyone could see this, including Elvira. She frowned and said, "You're not going to run away, Tim. I promise it won't hurt, and I promise that you won't get any more 'comments' for the audience" she said in a slight dark tone.

"He's going to run. I would have done the same" a voice said. It was Robyn.

"Why?" you asked.

"Why transform Tim? Or why I'm here? You look tense, Lucy. As for Tim, I think the head witch is bluffing. Lucky for her; if she was anyone else, I think that cousin of yours would had punched her in the guts, then fled" Robyn said, as Tim made a dash for the exit.

"Do you think he can escape?" you asked, as Catherine roared, "Timothy Towers! Get back here at once!"

"From a room full of witches? The only way he can escape is if we let him" Robyn said, as you glanced around. Nobody seemed to want to stop the panicked boy, with two exceptions. The first was Hannah, who was whining to mom. The other was Samantha; while she didn't move, yo saw a glint in her eye that you didn't like. It was if she was planning something, and you instictively knew it would be bad news for Tim. Elvira herself was still on stage, frowning deeply
155131331313312111131111311.title: Flight or fight

1551313313133121111311113111.content:
"Guess everyone wanted him to escape" you muttered as you watched Tim's fleeing form burst through the exit. "So what now?"

That was the question that most of the others were asking, along with why did we let him escape. Even Elvira had left the stage, and was having a hurried discussion with mom and Catherine. Disturbingly, you noticed that Samantha had gotten up and was listening in even though she was not part of the discussion. You remembered her look she had before Tim's flight, and you
figured that she was plotting something. After three minutes, mom walked over to you.

"You're going to leave the dinner, find your cousin, and persuade him to come back and accept her fate" mom announced.

"Me? Are you out of your mind?" you asked.

"Language, miss. Yes, I'm perfectly sane. You're the best shot at getting Tim back before he does something we'll regret. Take your friend, Robyn with you. She has experience with this sort of thing."

You was glad to get out of the dinner, but you didn't like the fact you had an impossible task. As you made your exit, you turned to Robyn. "Can you alter clothes?"

"What?" she asked, surprised.

"I look like a girlie girl" you said motioning to your outfit.

"Just take off those wrist gloves, Lu. I've got a bag to put them in. The rest of your outfit looks fine" Robyn said with a slight giggle.

"Whatever. So where to you think my cousin would had ran off to? He has at least a half mile head start."

"I overheard that he was invited to some sort of party, but he couldn't make it" Robyn said.

"How do you know this?" you demanded.

"Problem solver witch. Remember. I'm the new girl in your sister's class."

"Where you expected to see me, I suppose" you muttered. "So he is with Steve and Rick. Perfect."
1551313313133121111311113111.title: Tim escapes; you and Robyn search for him

15513133131331211113111131111.content:
"This isn't a good idea. Steve and Rick are jerks" you said quietly as you and Robyn steadied yourselves to knock on Steve's front door.

"I know, but we have to try" Robyn said.

'Even if Tim answers the door, we'll only have a minute before the jerks investigate" you growled as you knocked on the door. To your relief, Steve's mom answered the door.

"Oh. How can I help you two?" she asked, surprised to see you.

"I'm Tim's cousin. I need to talk to him" you said.

"Okay, though I was surprised to see Tim come. I thought he wasn't able to come."

"The dinner we were at ended early" Robyn said, as Steve's mom yelled for Tim. His eyes narrowed as he realized that you had tracked him down.

"You! What do you want?" Tim growled.

"You know what we want, Timothy" Robyn said in a calm, yet plain voice.

"Not going to happen. I don't want to become some mush-brained moron like you. I don't want to do it, but I will fight you if you try to bring me back."

"I know, Tim. Do you think I wanted this?" you demanded.

Tim didn't answer, but you could tell he wanted to say 'yes'. "Damn it, Timmy. If you don't want to become a girl, kiss one."

You heard another disgusted groan, but this time it was from Robyn. She turned to Tim and said, "You know what to do."

Tim hesitated, but it was irrelevant. Steve and Rick came to investigate and once they saw that Robyn (reluctantly) wanted Tim to kiss him, they started their own taunting.

"Ewww. No way. I'm not going to with you" Tim protested, as he slammed the door closed. Even through the door, you could hear the three boys discuss things like how dumb girls were.

"Can you blast down the door?" you asked.

"Probably, but it isn't the right way" Robyn said, as she walked away. Neither her or you spotted that Samantha had appeared and was starting at the house with a slight bemused look on her face

*******************************

"Stupid girls" Tim muttered softly to himself, relived that nobody had changed him during the night. Opening his eyes, he saw that he was still normal. His smile widening, he turned towards his sleeping friends, but it instantly fell flat; two small girls were sleeping where his friends were supposed to be.....
15513133131331211113111131111.title: continue

155131331313312111131111311111.content:
His alarm growing, Tim jumped out of bed and over to the where the girls were sleeping, roughly shook them awake. "Wake up. I'm going to kill me stupid gross cousin for what she has done to you."

"What? Its bad enough that you accidentally turned yourself into some stupid gross boy, Tina...." the girl said, as she opened her eyes. The first thing she saw was Tim panicked face.
