Seconds later, she saw her girlish body. Half expecting a scream, Tim moved back a couple of feet, the the girl's reaction wasn't the expected one; she started to frown.

"That wasn't funny, Christina. What you've done to yourself is bad enough without you trying to scare us like that. Raquel. Tina is trying to scare us."

"Raquel?! Christina? What is going on?" Tim said alarmed.

"Don't you remember? You was showing Steph and I that real magic exists but you turned yourself into a boy. Eww. Why did you do that?" Raquel said, her face showing disgust.

"Stop that. Can't you see what my dumb icky cousin has done to you? I've got to get out of here" a panicked Tim said, ignoring the increasingly worried look on his transformed friend's faces. He looked around and saw that his clothes were still thankfully those of a boy.

"Wait. Mom doesn't know what happened to you. Nobody does, Tina" Stephanie said. perspective
"You're more concerned about your mom? What about Tina? She is thinking she is some dumb boy. We've got to snap her out of it" Raquel said. "Tina.."

Tim had already fled. Going out the window, Tim was alarmed to see that his bike had somehow materialized by the front door, but he could see it was a girl's bike....

*********************

"Where to you think Tim has gone?" you muttered as you got out of bed.

"I don't know, but I probably will see him at school" you new roommate said. After your failed attempt the previous night, Robyn had stayed over.

"I would prefer that to having to deal with that Kristy Hart" you growled.

"Sorry, it would look too weird for two child geniuses to suddenly appear" Robyn said, as your door was flung open. It was Tim
155131331313312111131111311111.title: Rude awakening

choices: Tim slips away. You get ready for school
Too late, Hannah bursts into your room
1551313313133121111311113111111.content:
"I didn't expect to see you.." you started to say, but Tim cut you off. His voice raised by his anger, he said, "Fix them now."

"What?" you said. You was still half asleep, but you knew something was wrong. The fact Tim was around two girls -you and Robyn- yet didn't insult you meant something.

"Don't treat me like if I'm some dumb girl. You couldn't get your way, so you took it out on Rick and Steve. I told you that I will fight you if you force me to" Tim said in a cold voice.

"We didn't do anything to your friends. Lucy and I have been here the whole time" Robyn protested.

"You must have put some delayed action spell" Tim insisted.

"I'm telling you that we didn't do it" you said, you voice showing a hint of anger.

"Then who did? You was the only porridgehead that had followed me" Tim said.

You closed your eyes and sighed. "Samantha."

"What are you saying?" Tim said.

"I agree. She took an interest in you last night, Tim, and that something like this in well within her abilities" Robyn said.

"You're saying that stupid, old witch did this to my friends!? Why?" Tim demanded.

"Partly for some payback for what you've done in the past, but mainly to pressure you. You know the others want to change you to lift your curse."

"Not going to happen. I don't want to be some cootie ridden girl" Tim protested.

"Then kiss the girl" you said motioning to Robyn.

"Not going to happen" Tim repeated.

"You going to choose one eventually. Tim, you better get out of here before my sisters realize you're here."
1551313313133121111311113111111.title: continue

15513133131331211113111131111112.content:
The words had barely escaped your lips before your bedroom door burst open. It was Hannah, and she looked delighted (for once) to see Tim.

"Tina! I'd knew you'd come back" Hannah said in her cheery voice. Neither you or Robyn needed to look at each other. You dragged your little sister further into your room, as Robyn slammed your door shut. Feeling slightly more secure, you turned your attention to a fearful cousin and a delighted sister.

"Hannah. you're not going to change Tim" you said in a stern voice. It reassured Tim, but left Hannah confused.

"But Lucy. Tina would love it much better when she isn't a yucky boy..." Hannah pleaded.

"Remember when you and Erin were turned into boys? How you felt? Its exactly how Tim is feeling right now" you said, though it made you feel uncomfortable. Erin found herself linked to Hannah thanks to her brief transformation; you wondered why none of your friends got links to yours. Not wanting to dwell on it, you focused onto Tim.

"But grandma said......" Hannah counted.

"I was there, sis. Just stay quiet. Okay?" you demanded.

Hannah pouted, and remained silent as she was pushed out of your room. Tim didn't look too happy. Frowning, he said, "You let her go? She's going to talk the first moment she can."

"Probably. You better get to school" you said. Robyn nodded, agreeing with you, but Tim looked even more unhappy.

"Nobody is going to do anything while you're at school, Timmy. Plus, I'll be with you. We've bought you eight hours"

"I know" Tim whined, but he seemed to allow himself to be lead back out the window with Robyn, who magically changed their clothes for a new day at school. You was pleased to see that Robyn didn't fall to the urge to toy with Tim, and had dressed him properly. Frowning you started to dress yourself; you couldn't get used to the feel of a skirt or tightness of a bra.
15513133131331211113111131111112.title: Too late, Hannah bursts into your room

choices: You ask if Hannah can watch him.
You offer a plan of your own.
155131331313312111131111311111121.content:
"I know what you're thinking." Startling you, mom softly said.

You turned to see her enter the room before quietly closing the door. "Mom... I'm getting dressed." Blushing, you protested.

Mom giggled. "We are all girls here, sweetie." Kindly, she said. "You are wondering why you were not linked to any of your friends."

You nodded. "The thought had occurred to me." You admitted.

"Had Harry or Megan been near you when you changed, it would have effected them as well." Serious, mom explained. "Such magic is powerful but has a limited range. This is why we kept you out of school for the transformation; to avoid such scenarios."

"I see..." Wincing, you said. "Why does Tim have to be permanently changed? I'm sure there is someone out there who can see through that curse he has."

Mom sadly shook her head. "We've been trying, Lucy." Patiently, mom replied. "However, Tim is running out of time."

This unnerved you. "What do you mean?"

Mom sighed. "Sit down." You did so; mom joined you. "Any personality curse that lasts a long time places a huge burden on ones mind. Especially if that person's true personality is fighting to regain control over the invading one."

"Are you saying that Tim's old self is losing?" Worried, you asked.

"I wish it were that simple." Gently, mom said. "The stress on Tim's mind is slowly driving him insane. He has been considering suicide."

You turned pale to this. "What!?"

Mom hushed you silent. "Catherine and I have managed to talk him out of this for now. He had been under Robyn's watchful eye ever since. However, this new mischief may throw him over the edge." She sighed, giving you a pleading look. "Would you consider going back to grade school as a tutor to help us watch him?"

There was no way you wanted to go back to grade school. That was why you begged to be put in as a gifted child. However, you would not live with yourself if you refused and Tim took his own life.

What will you do?
155131331313312111131111311111121.title: continue

choices: You teleport them into your room.
1551313313133121111311113111111213.content:
"It's a long shot, mom but a friend of... 'John's' has a little sister." After a thought, you said. "She seems to have a crush on Tim." You sighed. "It may be nothing more than a little girl fantasizing over the 'bad boy' in school."

"Still, you think its better than trying to force a permanent change." Mussing, mom said. "Who is this girl? Is she a friend of Hannah?"

You slowly nodded. "They just moved into town a few weeks ago." You explained. "The girl's name is Tina Moon and I know she is a witch."

"Are you certain?" Surprised, mom asked.

You sighed. "Hannah showed her her flame." Wincing, you said. "Tina showed hers in response."

Mom shook her head. "I'll have to have a talk to her about that later." She then smiled. "Now, about this crush; how do you intend to find out if it is true love?"

You smiled. "Simple, we get them together." You said.

"Obviously." Bemused, mom said. "How?"

"A chance meeting..."
1551313313133121111311113111111213.title: You offer a plan of your own.

155131331313312111131111311111122.content:
As you gingerly stared at your reflection, the door opened again, revealing mom. She smiled slightly as she asked if you were okay.

"I'm fine. I'm just not used to wearing these... things" you admitted.

"I know, sweetie. You'll get used to them soon" mom replied.

"Why wasn't I linked to any of my friends? Especially if I'm supposedly powerful?"

"Such magics are extremely powerful, but have a short range. Megan and Harry were lucky enough not to be within range. An hour either way...." mom said, trailing off.

You shuddered, thinking of what it could had been. "Why does Tim have to bee transformed? There has to be someone out there that can just kiss him."

"Yes. Tim. Why didn't you tell me he was here?" mom demanded.

"Do you really expect an answer, mom?"

"No. Just like how you don't need an answer for how I know he was here. Whether he is with Robyn or not, Tim is almost out of time."

"So it is just like that? Hand him over to Forester to have it done like those friends of his?" you snapped.

"What?!" mom demanded, confused by your comment.

"Samantha changed Tim's friends into girls. Worse, they seem to think they, Tim included, have always been girls, and that a magic wielding Tim goofed up a spell" you explained.

"I see. Lucy, once you've done your hair, tell Hannah I need to see her, then head off to school" mom ordered.

*************************************

"Lucy. Your hair is a mess" Harry said as he stared at you.

"So is yours" you protested.

"Just let me do it. I should had done this before we got to school" Megan said kindly. As Megan did your hair, she quizzed you on why she saw Tim walking to school with a girl.

"It's complicated. What do we have first?" you muttered.
155131331313312111131111311111122.title: continue

1551313313133121111311113111111221.content:
"We all have a free break first" Harry said.

"Great' you said without your normal enthusiasm. "What's next?"

"I'm concerned Lu. You know your schedule" Harry said, concerned. Though he didn't say it, you knew he was thinking that you might be thinking like the eight year old you've become.

"They're moved my classes around. Part of this reality altering spell that seems to had originated in me" you said. "So what is the class?"

"Kristy" Megan said flatly, her disgust clear in her voice.

"Can you explain it to me again. How did the biggest bitch in the school get invited to teach?" Harry demanded.

"Steal from Samantha Forester" you said, heading for the library. You was hoping to get rid of some of your assignments, but you stopped the moment you saw Kristy was sitting, looking around the deserted room. Not wanting to listen to her snide remarks, you started to back out, but Kristy smiled.

"Realized you walked into the wrong room, little girl?" Kristy said in a mocking voice.

"What are you doing? I thought you was supposed to be, like, teaching." you said.

"I'm preparing for it. Is one plus one too difficult for you?" Kristy said. As she glanced at Megan and Harry, her smile became wider. "So, you've found some new friends?"

Neither you or Megan knew yo whom the comment was directed at. "Are you going to sit there, or are you going to say something constructive?" you demanded.

"Ooooohhhh. Little girl is throwing around some big words. And what is she wearing? That training bra doesn't make you a big girl, Lucy."

Wondering how she could had known that; you had covered all signs that you was wearing one, you turned to leave. Megan though, wanted the last word. "You know, Kristy. I think Samantha made a mistake. You may hate having to teach me, or Lucy, but I know you. You'd hate it more if you was in the same grade was us. Or even better, the same age as Lucy" Megan said with a slightly mean smile.

Kristy stared a Megan, seemingly like if she was finally listening to her, but she quickly covered it with a forced smile. "I'll see you three in class" she said in a stiff voice.

"That bitch" Megan said.

You frowned, not wanting to say that she was a lot more competitive and generally more Kristy-like when she was in a verbal fight with the hated teacher. "Yeah. Thanks for not letting her know I could do those things."

"Can you?" Harry asked, a slight tone of worry in his voice. You shook your head.

"Not yet. Don't worry, I'm not going to change you" you said. Frowning, you added, "We better get to class early. That teacher would love to put us in detention."

******************************

"Nerds don't belong on the cheer squad" Kristy said as she stared at Megan. You had arrived on time.

"Teachers don't insult her students" you muttered in reply.
1551313313133121111311113111111221.title: Kristy confrontation: Round two

15513133131331211113111131111112211.content:
"How could someone like that become any sort of teacher?" a voice complained halfway during Kristy's class. Like before, Kristy was making the class as boring and unpleasant as possible. Everyone was uncomfortable, but you was fuming. Kristy was messing with everyone's futures simply because she hated Megan, and found delight in your situation.

"I know. They'll get rid of her, Tonya" you whispered back. You liked Tonya; she was more accepting, other than Megan and Harry, of having an eight year old 'genius' in her class, and treated you like if you was a teen. Whispering though was a mistake; Kristy was waiting and walked up to you.

"No talking in class, little girl" Kristy sneered.

You couldn't take it any more. "If you was a better teacher, or even person, I wouldn't need to talk. Besides, I know that last year you constantly gossiped in class" you snapped, saying what everyone else was thinking.

"I'm going to enjoy having you sent back to where you belong, you little grade-schoolgirl" Kristy mocked, empathizing the girl part. You felt angrier than ever, and something had to give. A white flash shot out, engulfing the room. As your vision cleared, you saw that Kristy had drastically changed.

Somehow your magic had regressed Kristy back to 14. She was thin, awkward looking, and had lost most of her curves. plus she was now dressed in the school's uniform. You didn't know if this was what Kristy looked like when she was 14 the first time, but it was clear this time, she wasn't the athletic type. You hurriedly looked around the class, but apart from Megan, Harry and the shocked former teacher, everyone acted if it was normal.

"What?!" Kristy said.

"Just because the teacher had to rush out of class, doesn't mean you have to act like if you're it" Tonya shouted. It was all you needed to hear. Confused, you thought, Did I do that?

*********************************

Damn you thought as you headed to the locker room for PE. A week ago you would had loved the idea of being in the girls' locker room before PE. Now, you was just one of the girls. Worse, Kristy had decided to follow you and Megan. Whether it was out of fear or suspicion that you changed her, or she was somehow fitting into the life of a 14 year old, you didn't know, but it was alarming. As you entered the room, you noticed that a letter was sticking from the locker. Picking it up, you saw it was from Elvira.

.
15513133131331211113111131111112211.title: trouble in class

155131331313312111131111311111122111.content:
Quickly, you read through the letter.

Lucy. I've detected the spell that you inadvertently cast on you teacher during class and I hope this letter serves as a warning.....

"Great. Here it comes" you said aloud in a soft voice as you reluctantly read more of the letter.

You have to be more careful with your powers as you potential is extreme. While I have cleaned up any mess involving Miss Hart's 'unfortunate accident' in terms of other students, Miss Hart will be fully aware of her regression and you will have to deal with the fallout and consequences of it. The other thing is if you continue to accidentally change.. how shall I put it.... people who deserved it, you will find yourself being trained and in vastly different attire. Go find a hobby to take the edge off your frustrations Don't treat this is pure criticism. You're not in trouble.

Elvira

PS. I am aware what our mutual friend has done last night to influence Timothy.

"Okay" you said, as a mean voice said, "Learning how to read?" It was Kristy.

"What do you want, Kristy?" you demanded, as she snatched the letter from you. She started to scan the paper, much to your horror, but threw it back at you after a second. You released your held up breath; from Kristy's point of view, the letter was blank.

"I'm telling you that you don't belong in here. freak" Kristy said.

"Leave her alone" one of the girls yelled in your defense. You stared back at the girl, grateful, but you turned away as she started to undress.

"Don't worry, Lucy. We're all girls here. You'll get these in a few years" the girl cheerfully yelled back at you.

"I know" you replied in a small squeak as you didn't relish the idea of going through puberty as a girl. You turned to reply to Kristy, but she was gone. Shaking your head, you thought, Did she look different? Like if she was more plump? Shaking your head, and trying not to look at the other girls, including Megan, you started to undress and change into your sports gear.
155131331313312111131111311111122111.title: continue

1551313313133121111311113111111221112.content:
"Where's our shadow?" Megan asked, as she sat down to lunch with you and Harry.

"I think I've done more to Kristy than just regressing her. I couldn't stop noticing that she had gained a little weight during gym" you said gulping.

"What do you think you've done?" Harry asked.

"I don't know. She was bullying me for being 'smart' at the time, so maybe she's becoming a nerd. Or someone that is unpopular. Or maybe one of those dumb guys she used to date..... " you said.

Harry paled slightly; he was uneasy with what you could do, and by extension, Mel. "So how was gym?"

You didn't answer. and Megan frowned. You both knew you found it awkward in the changing rooms, and even more awkward on the field. turns out your new girlish body is quite flexible, and there were calls for you to try out several sports from gymnastics, to ballet. Even cheerleading, much to Kristy's disgust and Megan's bemusement. It wasn't something you wanted, and didn't fit in with your ideas of getting a hobby. "Ask Lucy again, and you can find out. No, she was fine" Megan said.

"Okay. I get it" Harry said defensively.

"Don't worry. I'm not going to change you. I'll have enough to deal with once school finishes" you said, wondering if you should call Robyn.
1551313313133121111311113111111221112.title: during lunch

choices: Temporarily change Tim to buy him more time, and hope it isn't permanent
You're forced to carry out your threat
Tim walks up to Robyn and....
15513133131331211113111131111112211122.content:
As the final bell rang out, you felt both relieved and worried at the same time. Relief that you second school day as Lucy had gone relatively well, and that you hadn't received a call from Robyn, which meant things had to be okay with Tim. Worry, because Tim's deadline was up, and that you hadn't seen Kristy since you inadvertently cast a spell onto her. That said, Kristy wasn't your concern; Tim was.

"Time's up. Want to come with me to help deal with Tim?" you asked Megan and Harry.

"Sorry. Got practice. Let me know what happens" Megan said, as she headed to her locker to get her cheer gear.

"What about you?" you asked Harry.

"Um. Err. I think Mel wants me around. See you around, Princess" Harry stammered.

Frowning slightly, you headed for your bike, which was fortunately, a reduced version of your old one. Five minutes later, you arrived outside Tim's school and saw that he was walking away from a crowd of girls, which wasn't a situation you was familiar with. on closer inspection, you saw that the group consisted of Hannah, Robyn, and his two transformed friends, Stephanie, and Raquel.

"'Timmy' please listen to her. You'll feel better once you're back to normal" Raquel said. You groaned slightly; it was clear that Raquel and and Stephanie still thought that they, and Tim were really girls, and that Tim was the transformed one. Sliding next to Robyn, you said, "Fill me in."

"Lucy. It seems that both 'Raquel' and 'Stephanie' are an odd mixture of extreme tomboys and extreme girlie girls. One minute, they want to play with dolls and dress up with Tim and Hannah. Next minute, they're running around like if they're boys. Must be some sort of side effect from Forester's spell" Robyn said distastefully.

"And Tim?" you inquired.

"Still no kiss, and I don't think it will ever come. You can here what he is saying" Robyn said half relieved. "What are you doing to me, you cootie ridden thing? You don't have the power...." Tim protested, noticing his girlish sounding voice.

"You evil witch! I'm going to...." Tim protested, as you cupped his mouth in an attempt to silence him.

Turning red with anger, you stepped forward, looking Cassie in the eye. "You have absolutely no comprehension of the consequences that truly await you." Gravely, you said. "Perhaps a simple demonstration will enlighten you."

Cassie was completely taken back by your response. Mom cleared her throat. "Cassie Bane, allow me to introduce you to Lucy Harrison, Lady First."

"Lady First?" Confused, you thought. You decided to let it go and continued to glare at Cassie who turned to you, bemused.

"Even so, there is nothing you can do." gripping the door knob, she said.

"Oh, I don't need to do anything." Casually waving your hand, you said. "Your brother can take it from here; he's right behind you."

Cassie turned and froze seeing her brother back in his male form only he was twice his normal size with muscles that fit an Olympian warrior. There was a certain hysterical anger in his eyes and, from what you could see, it was taking everything he had not to tear his sister apart. "What the hell!?" Stunned, the shouted.

"That is the consequence of toying with your brother." Smugly, Hayley said. "Boys in witch families are blessed physically. If you push them too far, you become the victim only instead of being transformed and toyed with..."

"They break your bones." Gravely, you finished. "My cousin nearly killed a witch who tried to kidnap his sister from their home."

Cassie was literally shaking in terror before her now huge older brother. To Hayley, it was a satisfying sight only to you, it was frightening. You feared that you might have inadvertently returned him to his male form, though that was not the case. "You need to calm down, Allen." Firmly but kindly, you said. "Anger augments your strength; if you attack now, you might kill her without realizing it."

Suddenly, Cassie's mother came into view behind Allen. "Like magic, a witch boys strength can not kill anyone." Startling Cassie, she said. "However, they can beat a witch to an inch of her life." She turned to Cassie. "I did not interfere with your 'fun' with 'Ally' but, if it were not for this visit, I would not have interfered with Allen's retaliation either."

"You would allow him to tear me limb from limb!?" Mortified, Cassie asked.

"Your magic would have protected you from any fatal injuries." Lightly, Mrs Bane replied. "I did you a favor by immobilizing your brother." She turned to mom. "You may not approve of my methods, Ms Harrison but, as you can see, I stayed within the laws and my daughter now has an understanding of the price that comes with pushing a witch boy into a rage."

"There has to be better ways." Annoyed, you said.

"There are better ways, as you had experienced yourself." Firmly but kindly, mom said. "I could have easily chosen the same method. The reason I did not is because of your twin connection."

"You would have been completely impossible to stop once you returned to normal." Frowning, Hayley added. "We would all have ended up in the intensive care unit at the hospital."

Hayley's words shook you to the core, causing you to gulp. "I could never...."

As you returned to the car with mom and Hayley, you had a better understanding. Your family was truly trying to make your experience tolerable. "I guess I have been a bit of an airhead." Muttering, you said. "It's ironic."

"Ironic that you called Mel that on occasion." Grinning, Hayley said.

"Still, why do they allow that to be done to a boy?" Worried, you asked.

"Two reasons." Simply, mom said. "One, the more magic is used against a witch boy, the more resistant he becomes to its effects."

"Two, magic used against a witch boy helps him control his 'physical magic'." Smiling, Hayley said. "Physical training only increases normal strength, magical strength is different, it requires magic to build and sculpt into the desired form."

"Without it, that magical strength grows wild; like a witch learning on her own." Serious, mom said. "That makes him dangerous."

You nodded then stared out the window thinking as mom and Hayley took you...

"That's enough Tina. We're not afraid of dolls, and you know it. From our point of view, its would be like you trying to be entertained by a young girl toddler's toy" you said to your cousin's chicken sounds. "As for it being gross, we find dolls as gross as you would find Fella."

Tina stopped her clucking. "Fella isn't gross."

"Agreed" Robyn said. closing her eyes, she said, "I've been like this for a year, and even then I'm not comfortable with a lot of things for 'our' age. I can tolerate playing things like 'pretty princess' though I don't like it. i wouldn't expect either of you girls to do so either."

"I'm not afraid of Lucy's favorite clothes" Tina said defiantly, apparently taking Robyn's comments as a challenge.

"Whatever. As for dolls, I can 'play' with them, but only by using my powers."

"What do you do? Launch them? Melt them?" Tina asked, causing you to smile slightly.

"Forget the dolls. I don't think any of us wants to know. This place needs a serious renovation, but first thing i want to do is to get out of this uniform" you said. Tina nodded as well, much to your relief.

"Where is my book? Tina, what to try changing our clothes?" you said, thinking aloud.
1551313313133121111311113111111221112211.title: Differing intepretations of grossness

1551313313133121111311113111111221112211.content:
Tina hesitated. "I don't really want to learn magic, unless it will change me back to normal."

You sighed as you found your book. "Like me, this is the new normal. the question is would you prefer to be a witch, or just an ordinary girl?"

"But..." Tina protested.

"We're no ordinary girls, Lu, but she's right, Tina. you may as well use your abilities" Robyn added.

"You know the deal, Tina" you said, before you opened the book. Quickly scanning it, you found the page that you wanted. "Here is a spell on clothing."

"Clothes?" Tina asked. You could tell she had become curious, thinking of the possibilities.

"Why don't you try it?" you coaxed, as curiosity overcame Tina's caution. She quickly read, then cast the spell. Instantly you and Robyn knew something had gone wrong. So did Tina, once she saw what she was wearing.She gave a scream.

"You tricked me!" Tina yelled, as she looked at her Repulsion dress.

"Do you think Rob or I wanted this to happen?" you said, wincing. Christina's spell backfired, switching her's, Robyn's and your clothes for a dress up costume in your wardrobe. Robyn was now wearing a Snow White dress, where you got the blue dress and pinafore of Alice. "I should had known you would have some control issues and that this was going to happen; you previously did turn both Brooke and Mel into boys..."

Tina's angry glare faded as she gave a half giggle. Her giggle stopped as your door was forced open by a concerned (and normal) looking Mel, along with Harry.

"Why are you dressed in that?!" Harry demanded.

"Which one? Ally, or Rep?" Mel said, guessing what had happened.

'Shut up, Melanie. Remember what happened the last time Tina tried magic?" you growled.

"How can I forget" Mel sulked.

"What happened?" Harry asked. Mel glared at you, her message obvious. Don't tell.
1551313313133121111311113111111221112211.title: Control issues

1551313313133121111311113111111221112211.content:
You gulped slightly, seeing Mel's death glare. It was clear that she would make your life harder if you told Harry that Tina had turned your girly, airheaded twin into a boy by mistake. "So what happened? Did Tina turn her into a boy? Or a kid? Or...."

"I better not" you said, wincing as you looked at Mel. You felt frustrated; before your own transformation, you would had the mobility to tell Harry what had happened, even with the threat of magic powers hanging over your head. Now, you felt slightly helpless."

"Why? Come on, bro. Whatever it is cannot be worse than whatever comes into my head" Harry said.

"Harry, there is some aspects to your girlfriend that should be left alone. What I will say is, after you had finished kissing, you'd go home. For me, I have to life with her."

Both Tina and Robyn gave a half giggle as they stood behind you. Mel didn't look too impressed. Pouting she said, "That isn't funny, little sis. Do you have any idea how gross that day was?"

You stared at her surprised, stunned that after all her posturing she would go and reveal that she had been grossed out because a little witch had accidentally gave her a gender change. A part of you wanted to berate her, because you was stuck in a girly nightmare, and that getting regressed into a child the opposite gender was far worse than anything she had experienced. Another part said it would be better to make up some plausible story. The heroine in you won out.

"What do you expect, you stupid airhead? Animated slime would be gross" you said.
1551313313133121111311113111111221112211.title: continue

choices: See the spell to its end.
Ask someone to cancel the spell for you.
1551313313133121111311113111111221112211.content:
"I hit her an opposites spell." Sighing, you explained.

"That would make Kristy a boy." Frowning, Hayley stated. "What were the changes?"

You quickly told Hayley and Mel that changes that happened to Kristy. When you were finished, Hayley shook her head, a bemused look on her face. "You hit her with an irony spell." Softly, she said. "It makes Kristy everything she hated about others so she would see things from their perspective."

"It's not permanent, is it?" Wincing, you asked.

Hayley shook her head. "Kristy will be back to her usual self once she gains an understanding of those 'stereotypes' she had hated." Serious, she replied. "It will only become permanent if she begins to like her new self and does not wish to change back."

"So what happens now?" Worried, Mel asked.

"Well, Lucy, you have a choice at this point." Looking at you, Hayley said. "I will help you either way but you have to tell me now. You can..."
1551313313133121111311113111111221112211.title: another transformation

1551313313133121111311113111111221112211.content:
Your jaw dropped as you saw that Hayley was holding a pink leotard. "What are you doing, Hayley?"" you hissed.

Hayley didn't respond verbally. Instead she produced a pair of pink tights, which told you she intended for you to do ballet. That was the last straw for you; while you could stomach gymnastics, ballet was far too stereotypical 'little girl' for your tastes. "Hayley. I'm not doing ballet. Not for you. Not for Hannah or Mel. Not for anyone. Ever" you said, raising your hand as if you're willing (you were) to use magic to protect yourself.

"Lucy. You're got far greater potential powers than I do, and that you can use magic without training. But, you're worn out from the use of magic you've already done today, and you're an eight year old girl. You will lose a fight against me" Hayley said calming.

"Try me, sis" you growled.

"Nobody is going to laugh because you're doing ballet. You're an eight year old gi-...."

"Damn it, Hayley" you started, as you moved to cast a spell, but Hayley was quicker. instantly you felt your body stiffen, with your head the only part of you that you could move..

"What did you do to me?" you screamed.

"Immobilization spell" Hayley said calmly as she walked over to you and started to strip off your school clothes.

"Hayley!" you shrieked as you saw your naked body. "Mooooooommmmmm!"

"It's okay, Lu. We're all girls here" Hayley said as she started to put up the tights.

"Hayley. there's two of us. Robyn, do something!" you pleaded.

"Don't look at me. Sorry, bro, but do you think I want to get involved in this?" Robyn said slightly guiltily as Hayley forced the leotard onto you, and started to tie up your ballet shoes. You felt sick, as Hayley tied your hair into a perfect bun; you was the perfect ballerina."

"All done. Time for your lesson" Hayley announced, releasing you from her spell.
1551313313133121111311113111111221112211.title: bitten off more than you can chew

info.brief_description: A 14 year old boy discovers that his family members aren't exactly normal....
info.description:
A small decision can make a big difference in one's course in life. In The Witch going home resulted in the discovery that women in your family could wield magic

In this case, the decision not to go home that day meant that the family secret was allowed to remain dormant for a year

However when you're the only boy in a family of witches, you're bound to discover things out eventually.

Your name is John Harrison (14 years old), with a twin sister called Mel. You used to get on with her, despite the fact she can be a bit of an annoying airhead at times. Least until she disappeared off the face of the planet for a year. Your older sister Hayley (15) also disappeared the previous year, and despite the fact you were, and still are fairly close, you've never found out why. Neither your younger, girly princess obsessed sister Hannah (8), or your mom, Natalie have given you any insight into the mystery. nor have your two closest friends, Megan and Harry been able to tell you anything since they're just as puzzled as you.

Rules

Magic is unable to be used by males. Only females can use magic, and even then only those above a certain age can safely wield it.
Magic cannot reanimate the dead.
Only human or near human transformations are allowed. ie no turning people into frogs, but giving them webbed feet is okay
